loan.use: To purchase livestock feed and farm supplies.

loan.name: Jyambere Group

texts.fr: Germain U., ne bugesera secteur Sake lEst du pays, mari, il a 3 enfants, il a 33 ans, son ain a 6 ans et son dernier enfant 2 ans et son niveau dducation est primaire. Il vit avec sa famille sake Bugesera. Cinq de ses enfants vont lcole. Avec son pouse ils travaillent pour faire vivre et amliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Il fait le commerce des habits pour dtail, avec ce prt il veut acheter les chemises et pantalons pour hommes et femme et pour enfants, il effectue ce commerce dans le centre commercial de Sake qui est un centre rural mais qui en voie de dveloppement. Il a pu construire une maison dans laquelle il habite, lui et sa famille. Il appartient dans un groupe solidaire appel JYAMBERE, qui est un groupe dont les membres sont tous commerants et ils se garantissent mutuellement, Jrmie et son groupe travaillent pour faire vivre leurs familles en amliorant leurs conditions de vie et en amenant leurs enfants lcole. En fait, le groupe a contract un prt au sein dAmasezerano Community Banking pour acheter les articles de leur commerce et les revendre, une partie du profit est rinvesti pour maintenir la stabilit financire du groupe et pargner afin de prparer pour un bon futur.
texts.en:
Germain U. was born in Bugesera, in the Sake district in the Eastern part of the country. He is 33 years old. His eldest child is 6 and the youngest 2 years old. His education level is primary. He lives with his family in Sake Bugesera, and five of his children attend school. He earns his living together with his wife and they seek to improve their familys living conditions. He retails clothing, and with this loan intends to buy shirts and pants for men, women and children. His business is located in the commercial area of Sake, which is a developing rural centre. He was able to build a house where he lives together with his family. He belongs to a solidarity group named Jyambere, whose members are all merchants and provide each other with mutual guarantee. Jrmie and his group work to ensure their familys subsistence, improve their living conditions, and provide schooling for their children. In fact, the group has obtained a loan from the Amasezerano Community Banking association, to buy items for resale in their commerce. Part of the profit is reinvested to ensure the groups financial stability, and put into savings to prepare for a prosperous future.

Translated from French by Ren McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy shirts and pants for men, women and children

loan.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian N. is from the town of Banga. She is 34 years old. Vivian is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Vivian owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Vivian has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.
Vivian joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She also plans to purchase two piglets to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loan.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli T. is from the town of Banga. She is 48 years old. Arceli is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Arceli owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Arceli also hopes to have enough capital to venture into raising pigs. She says she has to work hard so she can support her children's education.
Arceli joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arceli is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Arceli from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loan.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina S. is from the town of Banga. She is 53 years old. Florentina is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Florentina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. When free of farming duties, Florentina spends time selling dried fish around her community. She says it helps in providing for their daily needs.
Florentina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florentina is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and additional dried fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Florentina from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loan.name: Kiira Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
S. Soprano exudes self confidence and self esteem at first glance. He has invariably believed in his worth from his early 20s. These traits have been winning trump cards for him in successfully operating his 15-year-old retail and charcoal sales businesses in Kyaliwajjala-Mukono. At 43 years, S. has a success story connected with him that can act as motivation for todays youth. Most youth lack that self-initiative, which normally comes about as a result of low self-esteem. For this happy-go-lucky married father of 5, a strong belief in your own abilities is a big plus especially from the point of view of running and consolidating any business enterprise.
S. surprisingly got inspiration from his wife. His wife impressed upon him to try his luck at brick laying. This was his first business and with savings from that, he embarked on his current businesses. In a week, his net profits add up to 105,000 shillings. With this loan, he is looking forward to restocking his retail shop with an array of purchased items such as sugar, bars of soap, salt, plastics, soft drinks and bread that he will at length resell.

loan.use: The purchase of bars of soap, salt, sugar, soft drinks and bread for resale.

loan.name: Emma

texts.en: 45-year-old Emma L. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has an 8-year-old child. Emma raises and fattens hogs for sale and also uses her backyard for planting vegetables that she sells in her community. She also loves cooking so she decided to earn from what she loves doing: she used part of their house to display cooked food that her neighbors and passersby buy from her. Emma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell and will also buy ingredients for her cooking business. This loan will be her first from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. loan.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell and also ingredients for her cooking business

Emelyn owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale and also helps her husband plant and harvest corn on their farm. She sells their harvest to their town's market. Emelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. loan.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen G., a 49-year-old married mother with five school-aged children, is from the town of Banga where she earns a living planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years.

Helen joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having successfully repaid her previous loan from CEVI, she is now requesting a new one, her sixth, of 15000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seeds. Helen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her enterprise and sustain her family's income.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. loan.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds

loan.name: Gaudence

texts.en:
Gaudence is 33 years old and she is still single. Gaudence is well known for her business selling cloth as shown in the photo. This is her fourth successful year in this business. The hours of her business are from 8 am to 7 pm every day.
Gaudence needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. With this loan, Gaudence will expand her business by purchasing cloth. With this additional cloth, Gaudence's sales as well as profits will increase. If successful, Gaudence will keep reinvesting for better financial stability.

loan.use: To buy different kinds of raw cloth

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loan.name: God Gee Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the God Gee group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are small businesspeople who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member of the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions.
The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Ramatu C., who is pictured on the left. Ramatu was born in Makeni 38 years ago. She is the wife of a businessman and the mother of four children.
Ramatu sells slippers and flip-flops and has been managing this business for many years. Ramatu will use her share of this loan to buy dozens of slippers to sell through her business.

loan.use: To buy dozens of slippers

loan.name: Let's United Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Lets United group. They are small-scale businesspeople in the northern city of Makeni. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve. At least they will be able to provide three meals a day for their children, pay their schools fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills in case any of them fall sick.
Mosia S. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. Mosia was born in Bo, a city in southern Sierra Leone. But he now lives in Makeni together with his wife, who is a businesswoman, and two children who attend primary school.
Mosia is a tailor and has been in this profession for five years. Mosia will use his share of the loan to buy working materials such as poplins, cloths, threads, etc.

loan.use: To buy working materials such as poplins, cloths, threads, etc.

loan.name: Bless United Women Group

texts.en:
Esther S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Bless United Women. She is 43 years old and is married with three children who range in age from 12 to 23 years. She also cares for one sibling. Esther was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to lack of financial support.
For 14 years, Esther has been selling dried fish in Gardnerville Market on Somalia Drive, Monrovia, Liberia.
Esther plans to use her 7,500 Liberian dollar portion of this 34,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more dried fish to sell. She describes herself as a serviceable woman.
Esthers dream is to improve her business and build a house.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, Jenneh is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loan.use: To buy more dried fish to sell

loan.name: New London Ii Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the New London II group. They are businesswomen who run small businesses in Makeni, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 500,000 leones each to enable them to further expand their businesses, make more profit and improve their standard of living.
The leader of this group is Adama T. (on the left). Adama was born in Makeni. She is approximately 35 years old. Adama is married to a farmer and the couple have five children two in primary school, two in secondary school and one who is no longer attending school. Adama sells flip-flops. She has been running this business for many years now. With her share of this loan, Adama will buy dozens of flip-flops to add to her business.

loan.use: To buy dozens of flip-flops

loan.name: Plan Your Future Group

texts.en:
Cynthia A., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Plan Your Future. She is 32 years old and is married with four children who range from 7 to 12 years old. Cynthia was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to lack of financial support.
For three years, Cynthia has been selling cosmetics in Logan Town Market on Bushrod Island, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 7,500 Liberian dollar portion of this 35,500 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more cosmetics to sell. She describes herself as a serviceable woman.
Cynthias goal is to grow her business and build a house.

loan.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loan.name: Ainagul

texts.en:
Ainagul A. is 47 years old and was born in the south of Kyrgyzstan in a large family; her father was an actor and her mother was a schoolteacher. Unfortunately, in 1964, when Ainagul was one year old, her parents died in a car accident and Ainagul grew up at her grandmothers house, helping her in the household: she milked cows and pastured the cattle.
From her childhood, Ainagul was eager to study and, after graduating from secondary school, she intended to pursue her studies through higher education. However, when Ainagul was 23, she was given into marriage.
Ainagul and her husband moved to the capital, Bishkek, where she graduated from Bishkek Humanities University with a degree with honors. Ainagul and her husband returned to the south of the country where Ainagul got a job as a researcher at Osh State University. In 1996, Ainagul divorced her husband. Some years later, Ainagul, being a very whole-hearted and persistent woman, adopted two little girls, who are presently 8 and 11 years old.
In 2004, Ainagul and her daughters moved to Belovodskoe village near the capital. It was the beginning of a new life which led Ainagul to start up her business. With an investment of only 6,000 Kyrgyz Soms, Ainagul started to sell foodstuffs at a local market in 2006. After four years, she already owns her own little shop. Recently, she also bought two milk cows and began cattle-breeding.
Ainagul will use this loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz Soms to further broaden the range of the food products in her shop and to buy one more cow. With the revenues, she plans to renovate her shop and to give a good education to her daughters. As for Ainagul, she intends to get a driving license this year.
About Bai-Tushum and Partners: Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable members of the population. Its Kiva borrowers benefit from a 5% discount on their interest rate if they pay back without delay.
Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, it contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loan.use: To broaden the range of her food products and to buy another cow

loan.name: Fatu

texts.en: Meet 48-year-old Fatu K., a small-scale businesswoman in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. Fatu sells locally dyed cloths (gara lappers), baby clothes, bowls, coolers, etc. She has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. With a loan of SLL 2,000,000, Fatu will be able to expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items at wholesale. Fatus husband is a businessman too and all three of her children are adults.

loan.use: To buy gara lapper making materials (inks, white cotton cloth, etc), baby clothes, bowls, coolers, etc.

loan.name: Ngon

texts.fr: Madame Ngon F. est une femme marie de 46 ans qui habite dans la localit de Yoff plus prcisment dans le quartier de Dagoudane. Elle est marie et mre de 4 enfants dont lge varie entre 12 et 23 ans. Madame F. a choisi lactivit de commerce dans laquelle elle volue depuis plus de 15 ans par passion mais aussi linfluence de son mari a beaucoup contribu ce choix. Elle est en mme temps artiste et volue depuis plus de 20 ans dans la troupe Mame Ndiar de Yoff. Madame F. est socitaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis avril 2009. Elle a dj rembours 2 prts antrieurs. Elle sollicite un crdit de 300 000 frs prvu pour lachat dhabits pour enfants et autres marchandises diverses destines renforcer son commerce. Son objectif tant de raliser des bnfices en vue de satisfaire ses besoins personnels et amliorer la situation sociale de sa famille, madame F. pense que ce crdit lui sera dun trs grand apport.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ngon F. is 46 years old and lives in the locality of Yoff, or more precisely in its Dagoudane borough. She is married with four children whose ages vary from 12 to 23 years. Mrs F. chose the commercial activity she embarked on 15 years ago by passion but also through her husbands influence, which contributed significantly to her choice. For the past 20 years she has also been a performing artist in the Mame Ndiar troup of Yoff. Mrs F. is a member of the Yoff branch (of UIMCEC) since April 2009, and has already reimbursed two previous loans. She is requesting a loan for 300,000 francs destined to buy childrens clothing and various other merchandise to bolster her business. Her objective being to generate revenue to satisfy her personal needs and improve her familys social situation, Mrs. F. believes this credit loan will help her significantly.

Translated from French by Ren McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Build up her stock

loan.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 35 years old and is married with two children: the first one is 6 years old and the last is 5 years old. Francine owns a business selling various styles of shoes while her husband works in the private sector. This family works hard for the purpose of getting all the basic needs of their family.
Francine employs one person from her community as a helper and the hours of her shop are from 7 in the morning to 6 in the evening, every day except Sunday. Francine is seasoned in her business because this is her 12th year of successful operation.
Now, Francine is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more shoes to satisfy her customers. With this loan she will be able to sort out her family problems.

loan.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loan.name: United Women Group

texts.en:
Oretha D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called United Women. She is 43 years old and is married with six children who range from 10 to 21 years old. She was only able to attend school through 6th grade due to poverty.
For five years, Oretha has been selling crme, body lotion, grease, shampoo, gel, etc., in Red Light Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 9,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 39,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more crme, body lotion, grease, shampoo, gel, etc. She describes herself as a determined woman.
Orethas dream is to improve her business, build a house and continue to educate her children.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kpana is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loan.use: To buy more crme, body lotion, grease, shampoo, gel, etc.

loan.name: Bien Fait Plus Group

texts.en:
Patrick N. N. is the chairman of this community bank called Bien Fait Plus which means Well done in English. It is composed of fifteen members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.
Patrick, 31, is married and became a micro-entrepreneur in 2006 with beginning capital of $100. Today, his telephone booth business has prospered thanks to his hard work, good management and determination.
Patrick is a trustworthy client of HOPE DRC, having twice received and correctly repaid loans. He will increase his stock of merchandise with this next loan by purchasing phone accessories and prepaid cards to resell at a profit.
Patricks business brings in $60 per week and is located to the South-west of Kinshasa. His dream is someday to open a large general store in his area.

loan.use: To increase his business stock by buying phone accessories and prepaid cards to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loan.name: Blessing Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Blessing. She is 51 years old, is widowed, and has five children who range from 10 to 34 years old. She was only able to attend school through 8th grade due to poverty.
For ten years, Elizabeth has been selling rice, cooking oil, sugar, flour and pepper in Chicken Soup Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.
Elizabeth plans to use her 25,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 65,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, sugar and flour. She describes herself as a determined woman.
Elizabeths dream is to improve her business, build a house, and continue to educate her children.

loan.use: To buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, sugar and flour to sell

loan.name: Fad Plus Group

texts.en:
Lutala is the leader of this community bank named FAD Plus. It is composed of fourteen members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.
Lutala has been selling secondhand clothing since 2005. He started his business selling one bundle of clothes. Over the years, his business has prospered through determination and hard work, and he has been able to build a loyal customer base that has stabilized his business.
With good management and savings, Lutala has been able to reinforce his working capital. He started with one bundle of secondhand clothing and is up to ten bundles today. He sells at the market in the southwestern area of Kinshasa and his business makes $90 per week.
Lutala has already obtained five loans from HOPE DRC and correctly repaid them. He will increase his stock of merchandise with his next loan by buying a bundle of secondhand clothing to resell the clothes at a profit.
Lutala is confident in his business and he is determined to someday be a secondhand clothing importer and provider for the market in DRC (The Democratic Republic of the Congo) in general and Kinshasa in particular.
Lutala is 55 years old, married, and has five children between the ages 13 and 25 of whom two attend school.

loan.use: To purchase another bundle of secondhand clothing in order to reinforce his working capital

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Tugolokoke Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Nineteen years is the time 40-year-old Eva N. has spent having an oversight role over her retail business in Kyetume-Mukono. With 70,000 shillings as weekly profits, Eva has shown that through hard work and determination, one can achieve a great deal. This business has been bringing her dividends since she began it.
She initially was a farmer and after the idea of diversifying her business crossed her mind, she made a decision to start her retail shop. She also operates a pig husbandry and poultry business. These have contributed to her drive to make more profits. With this loan, she wants to purchase retail items, such as sugar and maize flour, in bulk for resale.

loan.use: The purchase in bulk of more retail items such as sugar and maize flour, amongst other things, for resale

loan.name: Marta Luz

texts.es:
Martha Luz Z. Valencia tiene 39 aos y vive en el barrio Villa del Carmen, con su cnyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 10 a 15 aos, Municipio de Soledad en el Departamento del Atlntico. Tiene una miscelnea donde vende de todo un poco as usted puede comprar desde un lpiz hasta productos de bisutera, perfumes y detalles en general. Su negocio es de origen familiar surgi por su necesidad de hacer un aporte importante al sostenimiento de su hogar y para poder solventar las necesidades de la comunidad, all vende todo tipo de mercancas, especialmente tiles escolares y papelera en general, aprovechando la vecindad de su negocio con una zona escolar.
Este es sus segundo crdito con la Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo, desde el primero not un aumento en sus ventas y tambin que le produjo un mayor margen de ganancias por las compras de contado que hizo con su crdito, el que le funcion como un el capital de trabajo a bajo costo. Ahora con su credikiva va a surtir la miscelnea de lpices, plumeros, libretas, moos, blusas, pulseras, binchas, colonias, aretes y perfumes femeninos y masculinos.
Su sueo es que sus hijos terminen una carrera universitaria y que su negocio sea reconocido no solo en su barrio, sino en su localidad, por eso justamente su mayor desafo es posicionarlo en el mercado, aprovechando que vive en un barrio donde la oferta de mercanca econmica tiene una gran demanda y eso es justamente lo que ella comercializa desde su miscelnea.
texts.en:
Martha Luz Z. Valencia is 39 years old and lives in the Villa del Carmen neighborhood, within the Soledad Municipality in the Atlantic Department with her husband and her 3 children, between ages 10 and 15. She has a general store that sells a little bit of everything, from pencils to accessories, perfumes and other items. It's a family business that started because she needed to make important contributions toward supporting her household and also to fulfill her community's needs. While her shop sells all sorts of products, the most useful items are the school and general stationary supplies; taking advantage of the fact that her business is next to a school. This is her second credit with Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo. Since her first credit, she has noticed an increase in sales and also a wider profit gap from being able to make her stock purchases in cash with her credit. It worked like a low cost work capital. Now, with her Kiva credit, she is going to stock her shop with pencils, pens, notebooks, overalls, blouses, bracelets, earrings, perfume and cologne. Her dream is for her children to earn a University degree and for her business to be known not only in her neighborhood but in the entire area. As such, her greatest challenge is to make a name for her business in the sector, taking advantage of the fact that she lives in a neighborhood where the availability of inexpensive merchandise is in high demand and this is exactly what she is commercializing off of with her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To supply her general store with pencils, pens, notebooks, overalls, blouses, bracelets, cologne, earrings, and perfumes.

loan.name: Vagif

texts.en:
Vagif H. is a 57-year-old man who breeds sheep and cattle in the small village of Bilasuvar city. He is married and has three children. He has been engaged in this business for the last 15 years.
He sells cattle to the local butchers and cafes. His monthly income is about 250 to 300 Azerbaijani New Manat. He plans to use his loan to buy a milk cow and several sheep.

loan.use: Purchase one milk cow and two sheep

loan.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and bread at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.
Victoria is 39 years old and married to a peasant. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motorbike for the transportation of charcoal bags to her home for stock.

loan.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loan.name: Samangul

texts.en:
Samangul M. is 33, is married, and has four children. She has bred sheep for the last five years. Her monthly income is 250-300 AZN and her main customers are local butchers and cafs.
Samangul would like to expand her business and purchase more sheep for her herd. This will allow her to increase her profit and improve the lives of her dearest children. She applied for 1,000 AZN.

loan.use: To purchase ten sheep for her herd

loan.name: Getrude

texts.en:
M. Getrude is as lively as they come. The 50-year-old has a sparky sense of humor that close friends say has endeared her to many of her consorts but more importantly, they point out, to her customers.
Being cordial and welcoming is a winning factor that many people operating a business often gloss over. Getrude says no matter how adverse the situation may be, whether in terms of personal moods or a persons business going through a checkered career, it is always advisable to maintain that cordial, serene and friendly attitude, especially in dealing with new, old and prospective customers.
Getrudes seventeen-year-old retail shop has, to a large extent, been a benefactor of the aforementioned factors. In a month, Getrude makes profits to the total of 300,000 shillings.
Getrude set forth in business after she got ideas from her husband. Her first business, poultry, also played a leading role in helping her to get established. She used savings from that business to buy many of her first retail items.
With this loan, this married mother of nine wants to restock her shop with purchased items such as sugar, salt, maize flour, rice and soap.

loan.use: The purchase of items such as sugar, salt, maize flour and rice

loan.name: Ilqar

texts.en:
Ilqar A. is a 47-year-old man who is engaged in farming and has been doing this for the last ten years. He is married and has four children.
Ilqar also is a tractor operator but his main income comes from his farming business. His monthly income is 200-300 AZN but this is too low for such a big family. He applied for 800 AZN and he will use this loan to improve the irrigation system of his garden and to purchase two calves.

loan.use: To improve the irrigation system of his garden and purchase two calves

loan.name: Elkhan

texts.en:
Elkhan R. is a 45-year-old farmer who raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and also raises cattle. He is married and has three children.
Elkhans monthly income is 200-300 AZN and he has eleven years of experience in this field. He sells fruits and vegetables in the local bazaar and uses his cows for milk and milk products.
Now Elkhan has applied for 1,000 AZN in order to purchase one milk cow and more seeds. He will use this cow to start selling milk to the local people.

loan.use: To purchase one milk cow and seeds

loan.name: Takhmina

texts.en:
Takhmina A. is a 24-year-old woman who is married and has one son. Together with her husband, she breeds cattle.
Takhmina sells cattle to the local butchers for a profitable price and her monthly profit is 150-250 AZN. She has seven years of experience in this field.
Cattle breeding is the only source of income for Takhminas family. She applied for a 1,000 AZN loan in order to purchase two calves.

loan.use: To purchase two calves

loan.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah S. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local Sudanese alcohol (siko) at home and is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer to sell.
Sarah is 49 years old and is married to a retired police officer. She has seven children and three of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

loan.use: To stock crates of beer to sell

loan.name: La Ilusion Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama La Ilusin. Esta ubicado en la comunidad de Tepexco, en el estado de Puebla, Mxico. El grupo esta conformado por 5 integrantes que se conocen por ser vecinos. Este es su 1er. Prstamo con Fundacin Realidad. La integrante del grupo la seora Ivet V. S. tiene 28 aos de edad estudio para tcnico en computacin, tiene 2 hijos, 1 hombre y 1 mujer, Benito tiene 4 aos de edad y estudia el Kinder, Azul Isabel tiene 8 meses de edad. La seora Ivet se dedica a vender pantalones de mezclilla para dama y necesita su prstamo para comprar pantalones de mezclilla para dama, vive en unin libre con el seor Herminio Quien se dedica al trabajar en el campo recibiendo un salario mnimo por esta razn se vio en la necesidad de emprender este negocio, inicindolo hace 3 aos, cuando el hermano de su compadre le dio la mercanca para comenzar a vender y le fue pagando poco a poco, su negocio esta en su casa en Tepexco, atiende de 5 a 15 clientes por dia, regularmente son las jovencitas que acuden a su negocio a comprar sus pantalones y la seora Ivet siempre es amable y cordial como siempre las atiende personalmente para que regresen a comprar su mercanca. Su negocio es importante para ella por que le ayuda en su economa, tiene ingresos para la alimentacin de su familia, tambin puede atender a sus pequeos hijos. Sus sueos y esperanzas son seguir trabajando para obtener mas ganancias para darles a sus hijos una mejor vida, ampliar su negocio aumentando en playeras y ropa interior para dama, invitar a ms personas para obtener mas prestamos. Los desafos que enfrenta el negocio son los costos elevados, a veces hay prdidas porque los pantalones salen mal o defectuosos, tambien tiene mucha competencia pues varias personas venden los mismos productos que ella vende. Tepexco es un lugar con clima caluroso hay cerros una presa, algunos campesinos tienes animales como caballos y burros que usan para trabajar o para trasladarse a sus trabajos y a sus casas. Los integrantes del grupo son Ivet V. S. va a comprar con su prstamo pantalones para dama por mayoreo para surtir su negocio. La seora Maria del Rosario Gutirrez C. va a comprar abono por bulto para su cultivo de sorgo y venta. La seora Delia T. M. va a comprar ropa. Pantaln para dama, caballero y nio, faldas, blusas, ropa interior camisetas etc. para surtir su negocio. Ana Maria C. M. va a compra alimento para cerdo y lechones para crianza, tambin va a comprar tomates, jitomates, chiles seco, queso etc. para preparar sus alimentos (antojitos Mexicanos). La seora Irene B. R. va a compra la inscripcin y catlogos para iniciar la venta de sus productos compra de kit es un paquete nutricional para su club nutricional. La seora Ivet quiere decir a Kiva y a Fundicin Realidad: ojala que sigan ampliando los prestamos porque as nos ayudan a levantar los negocios, gracias por apoyarnos
texts.en:
This group is called La Ilusin. They are located in the Tepexco community in the state of Puebla, Mexico. The group is composed of 5 members that know each other as neighbors. This is their first loan with Fundacin Realidad. One of the group members is Seora Ivet V. S., who is 28 years old and is studying to become a computer technician. She has 2 children, 1 boy and 1 girl. Benito is 4 years old and is in Kindergarten while Azul Isabel is 8 months old. Seora Ivet works selling women denim trousers and needs a loan to purchase more. She lives with her partner, Seor Herminio, who works in the fields and is paid minimum wage. As such, she saw a need to begin this business, starting it over 3 years ago, when her friend's brother gave her some merchandise to begin selling and paid her little by little. She operates her business out of her house in Tepexco and attends 5 to 15 clients a day. Normally, they are young women that visit her business and Seora Ivet is always nice, cordial, and attends to them personally so that they return for more. Her business is important because it adds to her household's income. It provides towards her family's groceries and also allows her to care for her children. Her dream is to continue to work to increase her earnings in order to be able to provide her children with a better life, expand her business by eventually selling women's bathing suits and underwear, and invite more people to join the group to obtain more loans. The challenges that she faces are her business' high bills. Sometimes there are losses due to trousers coming out badly or defected. Also, there is a lot of competition because various people sell the same products as she does. Tepexco is a very hot place with hills. Some of the people have animals, like horses and donkeys that they use to work or to get to their jobs or their houses. The members of the group are: Seora Ivet V. S., who, with her loan, is going to purchase women trousers at wholesale with which to stock her business. Seora Maria del Rosario Gutirrez C. is going to purchase fertilizer in bulk for her sorghum cultivation and to resell. Seora Delia T. M. is going to purchase clothing, such as trousers for women, men, and children, skirts, blouses, underwear, shirts, etc, with which to stock her business. Seora Ana Maria C. M. is going to purchase food for her pigs and baby pigs. She is also going to purchase tomatoes, dried chiles, cheese, etc. in order to prepare her antojitos Mexicanos (typical Mexican snacks). Seora Irene B. R. is going to pay for the initial fee and the catalogs to start selling nutritional packets for her nutrition club. Seora Ivet would like to say the following to Kiva and Fundacin Realidad: "I hope that you continue to increase your loans because they help us uplift our businesses. Thank you for supporting us!"

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase women's trousers.

loan.name: Sibomana

texts.en:
Sibomana is 35 years old and married with five children. Sibomana is a driver of a motorbike and he has been in this business for about 10 years. The business hours are from 6 am to 9 pm every day.
Sibomana needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, Sibomana will purchase one more motorbike and this motorbike will hopefully allow him to increase his revenue. If successful, Sibomana will improve the living style of his family and he will also renovate his own house.

loan.use: To purchase one additional motorbike

loan.name: Vuqar

texts.en:
Vuqar S. is a 39-year-old man who has been breeding sheep for the last 12 years. He is married and has four children.
Vuqar sells sheep in the livestock bazaar and to the local butchers. His monthly income is 250 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN). He would like to increase his profit and improve the life of his family. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1000 AZN and will use it to purchase six sheep and one calf.

loan.use: Purchase six sheep and one calf

loan.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel M. T. is twenty-six years old, single, and does not have any children yet. His business is located at Barsheba estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites--not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches.
He has been selling fruits and vegetables for the last year to the local people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more fruits and vegetables to expand his business. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future and even open other outlets. He describes himself as very customer friendly.

loan.use: Expanding store inventory

loan.name: Chajerina

texts.en: Chajerina J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Chajerina is 41 years old and married; her husband is a peasant. She has three children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loan.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loan.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 29 years old and married with one child who is one and a half years old. Alphonsine's husband is a driver. This family works hard to develop their family. Alphonsine owns a small business selling shoes. This business is profitable in the city where her business is located.
Alphonsine is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more shoes to sell. This loan will be fruitful because she will be able to sell a large quantity of shoes, which will allow her to earn more profit.

loan.use: To expand her business

loan.name: Phoibe

texts.en:
Phoibe is 36 years old and married with three children. The oldest child is 14 years old, the next is 11 years and the last one is 8 years old. Phoibes husband works in government. They both work hard in order to provide their children all the necessary things. Phoibe, in particular, has five years of experience in her business but she has only a little capital, which is a challenge for her. The hours of her shop are from 7 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day except on Saturday.
Phoibe is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business. With the extra money that Phoibe expects to earn, she will be reinvesting in her business.

loan.use: To expand the business

loan.name: Donatha

texts.en:
Donatha is 39 years old and married with two children. The oldest one is 16 years old and the youngest one is 2 and half years old. Donatha owns a small business selling various styles of shoes. This business is profitable. That is why she chose it. Donathas husband works in the bank. This family has a target of obtaining all things that they need. Donathas business is open from 7 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day except on Saturday.
Donatha is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business. With this expansion, she will be able to earn more profit, which is the target of everyone in business.

loan.use: To expand her business

loan.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 21 years old and married with two children. The first one is 5 years and the last one is 2 years old. Christine is a businesswoman as is her husband. This family works hard in order to get everything the family needs. Christine has a business selling the various styles of the shoes. Christine has 10 years of experience working from 6 in the morning to 5 in the evening every day except on Saturday.
Christine is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business. With this expansion, she will be able to earn more profit, which is the target of everyone in the business.

loan.use: To expand her business

loan.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Actualmente, Oscar vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo donde la mayora de sus vecinos y amigos se dedican al turismo. Hace muchos aos atrs viva en la ciudad de Urubamba donde tena una ferretera y tuvo que cerrar porque haba mucha competencia y no haba muchos clientes.
Decidido a empezar una nueva vida, Oscar se mudo a Ollantaytambo, donde tena algunos amigos y familiares lejanos quienes le motivaron para abrir una tienda. Utiliz el dinero de la liquidacin de la ferretera para abrir una nueva tienda en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, donde vende pintura, cemento, clavos, chapas, lijas y muchas cosas ms. Hace diez aos que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeo que pone en su negocio y con los beneficios que obtiene saca adelante a sus tres hijos.
Oscar en un padre responsable y trabajador que desprende una imagen de experiencia y profesionalidad. Un flujo regular de clientes visita su tienda pero por los meses de marzo las ventas estaban bajas debido a las lluvias que cayeron en la ciudad. Oscar pertenece al banco comunal La Amistad de Ollantaytambo y es uno de los fundadores, con su prximo prstamo, Oscar espera recibir $300 y le gustara implementar su ferretera y desea comprar focos ahorradores, clavos y accesorios elctricos. El sueo de Oscar es abrir otra ferretera en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo.
texts.en:
Oscar currently lives in the city of Ollantaytambo, where most of his neighbors and friends work in the field of tourism. Many years ago, he lived in the city of Urubamba, where he had a hardware store. He had to close it because there was a lot of competition and he did not have many customers. Determined to start a new life, Oscar moved to Ollantaytambo, where he had some friends and distant family members who encouraged him to open a store. He used the money from the liquidation of his hardware store to open a new store in the city of Ollantaytambo, where he sells paint, cement, nails, metal sheets, sandpaper, and much more. He has operated this business for ten years, and it is going very well for him, thanks to the dedication he puts into the business. With the benefits he obtains from his work, he has helped his three children get ahead. Oscar is a responsible and hard-working father who presents an image of experience and professionalism. A regular flow of customers visits his store, but his sales are low in the month of March, due to the rains that fall in the city. Oscar belongs to the communal bank called La Amistad de Ollantaytambo ["The Friendship of Ollantaytambo"], and he is one of the founders. With his next loan, Oscar hopes to receive $300, and he would like to improve his hardware store. He wants to buy energy-saving lightbulbs, nails and electrical accessories. Oscar's dream is to open another hardware store in the city of Ollantaytambo.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying energy-saving lightbulbs, nails and electrical accessories

loan.name: Norma Patricia

texts.es:
Norma Patricia E. A. tiene 36 aos. Es soltera y vive con los hijos, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. Tiene 2 hijos, Alejandro y Estefana.
Norma es una socia de la ventanilla rural la Y, que est ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer prstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San Jos.
Norma se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y calzado en un local de su vivienda. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Guayaquil y Quito y los vende en su casa o de puerta en puerta.
Solicita el prstamo para la compra de ropa y calzado para incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos es comprar una casa para aumentar el negocio. Enfrenta desafos es la competencia de la localidad. Le gusta viajar y algn da le gustara salir del pas.
texts.en:
Norma Patricia E. A. is 36 years old and a single mother of 2 children, Alejandro and Estefania. They live in Ventanas, in the province of Los Rois. Norma is a member of a communal bank located an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total, the majority of them working in agriculture. This is the first loan that they will be taking with Cooperativa San Jose.

Norma works selling clothing and shoes from a shop in her house. She purchases her inventory every month in the city of Guayaquil and Quito, and she sells her merchandise from her house or door to door. She is requesting this loan to purchase more clothing and shoes to grow her busines. She feels this loan is a chance to improve the quality of her life. Her dream is to be able to purchase her own home from where she can grow her business. She faces challenges from the competition in her area. Norma would like to be able to travel, and one day leave Ecuador.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase more clothing and shoes to grow her small business

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loan.name: Mahira

texts.en: Mahira H., 50, is a widow with three sons. She engages in several activities: she breeds cattle and poultry, and raises corn, sunflowers, and other seasonal fruits and vegetables. Her monthly profit is 200-250 Azerbaijani manat (AZN). She would like to expand her cattle business as it is very profitable and in high demand. She applied for a loan of 900 AZN to purchase sheep. As she is the only financial source in her family, Mahira works very hard to cover the needs of her dearest sons, who actively help her.

loan.use: purchase eight sheep and fodder

loan.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 36 years old and married with two children: the first one is 5 years old and the last one is 3 years old. Rose runs a business as does her husband. Rose sells clothes in Kigali city. Rose is seasoned in her business with 10 years of experience. The hours of her shop are from 8 in the morning to 7 in the evening, every day except on Saturday.
Rose is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase various styles of clothes. With this loan, Rose will be able to satisfy her customers.

loan.use: To expand her business

loan.name: Betrice

texts.en: Betrice D. is currently in the business of selling various drugs at the medical clinic and is requesting a loan to stock more drugs to sell. Betrice is 32 years old, married, and her husband is a director. She has three children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build wards for admitting patients.

loan.use: Stock more drugs to sell

loan.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es cusquea y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo que se encuentra ubicado a 1 hora y 20 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Las vendedoras actuales del mercado Virgen de Asunta de Ollantaytambo vendan sus productos de forma ambulatoria porque no habia mercado y no tenan puestos de venta.
Actualmente cada vendedora cuenta con sus propios puestos de venta y Francisca tambin. Francisca en el puesto de venta vende comestibles y tambin se dedica a la venta de artesana y pertenece a la asociacin de artesanos Seor de Choque Quilca. La pueden encontrar en su puesto cada tres veces a la semana desde las 8am hasta las 11am.
Francisca desprende una imagen de responsabilidad y amabilidad. Un flujo de turistas visitan el mercado y el negocio se anima bastante por las maanas a la llega de los turistas que se dirigen a visitar las ciudadela inca de Machu Picchu. Ella vende artesana de calidad como por ejemplo mantas, chulos, sombreros y bordados. Hace 15 aos que se dedica a la venta de artesana y le va muy excelente.
Con su prximo prstamo, Francisca espera recibir $ 300 UDS. Por el momento, su tienda esta modestamente equipado con mercadera necesaria. Le gustara emplear el dinero de este prstamo en comprar mercadera como por ejemplo gaseosas, arroz, azcar, muchos productos ms.
Francisca pertenece al banco comunal La Amistad de Ollantaytambo, y es una de las fundadoras. Hace 4 aos atrs un grupo de vecinas se juntaron para formar el banco comunal y vieron en la Asociacin Arariwa una alternativa de ayuda con los prstamos.
texts.en:
Francisca is from Cusco, but now lives in the city of Ollantaytambo which is located about one hour and 20 minutes from the city of Cusco. The vendors of the market "Virgin of Ollantaytambo" used to sell their merchandise door to door and around the city, since there was no market nor any stalls from which they could operate. Today, each vendor counts on his own stand, Francisca as well. From her stand, Francisca sells food, snacks and grocery items. She also sells handicrafts from the group of artists called "Senor de Choue Quilca". You will find Francisca at her stand 3 times a week from 8 in the morning until 11 in the morning.

Francisco exudes the qualities of a responsible and friendly person. A constant flow of tourists visit the market and the environment is very animated in the mornings when the tourists headed for Machu Picchu arrive. Francisca sells quality handicrafts, for example table cloths, hats and embroidery. She has been selling handicrafts for 15 years now and the business has gone well. With her next loan, Francisco will receive $300US. For the moment, her stand is modestly stocked with the merchandise she needs. She would like to use the money from this loan to puchase sodas, rice, sugar and other products.

Francisco is a member of the communal bank "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo", or "The Friendship of Ollantaytambo" and she is one of the founders. 4 years ago a group of neighbors got together to form the communal bank and saw in the Association Arariwa an alternative way to get help with the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to purchase products for her small business such as sodas, rice, sugar and other ingredients she uses to prepare the snacks she sells

loan.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 50 years old and married with eight children who are between the ages of 8 and 24 years old. Beatrice makes a living by selling pastries in her shop and some drinks. She has been in this small business for about two years. The hours of her business are from 6 am to 9 pm every day.
After realizing that her sales can't satisfy her customers, Beatrice decided to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, Beatrice will hopefully satisfy her customers by purchasing a large quantity of beverages and pastries. If successful, Beatrice will hopefully earn more profit which will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability.

loan.use: To buy a large enough quantity of beverages and pastries

loan.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia tiene 55 aos y tiene 5 hijos, ella vive en la comunidad D. Pachar que se encuentra ubicado a 10 minutos D. Urubamba. La socia tiene un pequeo negocio el cual consiste en compra y venta D. frutas para lo cual a un inicio se le haca difcil ya que no contaban con mucho capital, fue entonces que se presento la oportunidad D. pertenecer al banco comunal D. la Asociacin Arariwa el cual le brindo apoyo con prstamos D. dinero y as pudo mejorar su negocio. La pueden encontrar en su puesto D. venta en el mercado central Virgen Asunta D. Ollantaytambo, donD. venD. frutas tradas del valle D. la Convencin y del norte del pas, los 7 das D. la semana, desD. las 8 D. la maana hasta las 4 D. la tarD..
Aurelia es una mujer responsable y trabajadora. Un flujo regular D. clientes visita su puesto y el negocio se anima bastante por las maanas. Con su prximo crdito, Aurelia espera recibir $100. Por el momento, su puesto esta modestamente equipado D. frutas. Le gustara usar el dinero D. este prstamo en comprar ms frutas como por ejemplo pltanos, pias, naranjas, etc.
Aurelia pertenece al banco comunal la Amistad D. Ollantaytambo D. la Asociacin Arariwa.
texts.en:
Aurelia is 55 years old and has got 5 children. She lives in the Pachar community, which is located 10 minutes from Urubamba. She has got a small business, which consists in the purchase and sale of fruits. Its beginnings were difficult because she didn't have much capital. It was then that she was presented with the opportunity to join the communal bank, Asociacin Arariwa, which offers loans and from there was able to improver her business. She can be found at a stall in the central market, "Virgen Asunta D. Ollantaytambo", where she sells fruit brought from the Convencin valley and from the north of the country, seven days a week, from 8am until 4pm. Aurelia is a responsible and hard working woman. A regular flow of customers visit her stand, and her business gets quite busy in the mornings. Aurelia hopes to receive $100 in her next loan. At the moment, her stand is moderately stocked with fruit and she would like to use the money from her next loan to purchase more fruit, such as bananas, pineapples, oranges, etc. Aurelia pertains to the communal bank, Amistad D. Ollantaytambo of Asociacin Arariwa.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase more fruit, such as bananas, pineapples, oranges, etc.

loan.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia M. is currently in the business of selling saddles, clothes and women's handbags at the market and is requesting a loan to stock women's headdresses and some pairs of shoes to sell.
Lucia is 53 years old and married. She has seven children and three of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend her business by building another shop for a supermarket business.

loan.use: Stock women's headdresses and some pairs of shoes to sell

loan.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila naci en Ollantaytambo y vive en el barrio de San Isidro de la misma ciudad. Lucila lleva toda la vida rodeada de la ganadera y la agricultura. La mayora de los pobladores de Ollantaytambo hoy en da ven en el turismo una forma de darse una mejor calidad de vida.
Lucila en su domicilio a cmodos unos dormitorios para ofrecer servicios de hospedaje a los turistas nacionales y extranjeros que llegan a la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, cada habitacin cuesta aproximadamente entre 15 y 20 soles. Ella en la plaza principal de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo tiene una casa y lo alquila para un cafetn. Lucila desde muy joven aprendi la cosecha y siembra. La socia tiene una pequea chacra, al lado de su casa, donde cultiva maz, papas, cebollas, etc. Hace varios atrs falleci su esposo y se quedo con sus cinco hijos. Lucila desprende una imagen de una seora muy tierna y amable.
Con su prximo prstamo de $150 USD. Le gustara emplear el dinero de este prstamo para comprar semillas y abono. Lucila pertenece al banco comunal La Amistad de Ollantaytambo y es una de las socias fundadoras.
texts.en:
Lucila was born in Ollantaytambo and lives in the neighborhood of San Isidro. She has lived her entire life surrounded by cattle raising and agriculture. The majority of the residents in Ollantaytambo today see tourism as a way to help improve their quality of life. In her home, Lucila rents out a couple of rooms to both Peruvian as well as foreign tourists. Each room costs approximately 15 - 20 soles. Her home is located in the main plaza of Ollantaytambo. From the time she was young Lucila learned how to harvest and plant. She has a small plot of land, alongside her house, where she grows corn, potatoes and onions. Several years ago her husband died and left Lucila with 5 children to support. She exudes the qualities of a kind and friendly woman. With her loan of approximately $150US, Lucila would like to buy seeds and fertilizer. She is one of the founding members of the communal bank called "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo", or "The Friendship of of Ollantaytambo".

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loan.name: Gulsare

texts.en: Gulsare Q. is 48 years old, married, has four children and has made a living raising cattle for the last nine years. She breeds cattle to produce both meat and milk, and earns 200-250 AZN a month from her work. She has applied for a loan for 1,000 AZN to buy a new cow and a calf to raise.

loan.use: to buy a cow and a calf to raise

loan.name: Anita

texts.es:
Anita lleva toda la vida rodeada del turismo. Sus vecinas y ella ven en el turismo una forma de negocio rentable. En la ciudad de de Ollantaytambo se encuentra una de las ruinas ms importantes del Incanato y tambin es paradero obligatorio para los turistas que se dirigen a ciudadela Inca de Machu Picchu. Desde los 19 aos, Anita se las ingenio para vender artesana en la ciudad, actualmente vende en dos sitios, el primero es en la estacin de trenes y el segundo en la plaza de principal de Ollantaytambo. La pueden encontrar en sus puestos de venta que est equipado con mercadera surtida como por ejemplo mantas, chompas, mochilas, bordados, sombreros, maletines desde las 8 am hasta 4pm, los 7 das de la semana.
Anita desprende una imagen de alegra y amabilidad. Un flujo de regular de turistas nacionales y extranjeros que visitan su puesto. Ella vende sus productos de calidad y de un buen acabado.
Con su prximo crdito, Anita espera recibir $500 USD. Por el momento, su puesto est bien equipado de mercadera porque en esta poca del ao hay una alta vista de turistas. Le gustara emplear el dinero de este prstamo para comprar una computadora personal para el estudio de sus hijos. Anita pertenece hace 7 aos al banco comunal La Amistad de Ollantaytambo.
texts.en:
Anita has been surrounded by tourism her entire life. She and her neighbors recognize that tourism offers an opportunity for profitable business. One of the most notable Incan ruins is located in the town of Ollantaytambo. This is also the location of a mandatory stopping point for tourists who are on their way to the Incan city of Machu Picchu. Since age 19, Anita has sold artisan crafts in the city. She currently works at two different sites, one being located at the train station and the other in the main plaza of Ollantaytambo. Anita can be found at either of her locations from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m., 7 days a week. Anita sells assorted merchandise such as blankets, sweaters, bags, embroidered goods, hats and small cases. She maintains an attitude of joy and kindness. Tourists, both domestic and foreign, regularly visit her locations for the high-quality products. Anita hopes to receive $500 for her next loan. Because this time of year is a season of increased tourism, her operation is currently well-stocked with merchandise. She would like to use the money from this loan to buy a personal computer, which will aid her children in their studies. Anita has been a member of the communal bank "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo" for seven years.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase a personal computer to aid her children's studies.

loan.name: Romania

texts.es:
Romania naci y vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo donde la mayora de los pobladores se dedican a al turismo. La ciudad de Ollantaytambo se encuentra ubicada a hora y media de la ciudad del Cusco por la carretera asfaltada. Romania abri hace cuatro aos atrs un restaurante Doa Romania en su domicilio y est ubicado en la calle principal o entrada a la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. La pueden encontrar en su restaurante, los 7 das de la semana, desde las 7 de la maana hasta bastante tarde en la noche, o hasta que se agote la comida.
Romania desprende una imagen de responsabilidad y amabilidad. Un flujo de clientes visita su restaurante y el negocio se anima durante la hora del desayuno, almuerzo y cena. Ella tambin vende pollos a la brasa y sirve porciones abundantes de papas fritas, una porcin de pollo a la brasa, ensalada y cremas.
Con su prximo prstamo, Romania espera recibir $1000 USD. Por el momento, su restaurante est bien equipado con las necesidades bsicas. Le gustara emplear el dinero de este prstamo para uso personal, ella desea terminar de construir su casa y va comprar tejas, etc.
Romania es una persona responsable, puntual y pertenece al banco comunal La Amistad de Ollantaytambo y hace 6 aos que participa en banco comunal pues es una de las socia fundadoras. Las reuniones del banco comunal se hacen cada treinta das en la oficina central de la Asociacin Arariwa sede Ollantaytambo.
texts.en:
Romania was born in and currently lives in the city of Ollantaytambo where the majority of its inhabitants work in tourism. The city of Ollantaytambo is located an hour and a half from the city of Cusco by asphalt road. Four years ago, Romania opened a restaurant called Doa Romania in her home, which is located on the main street or entrance to the city of Ollantaytambo. She can be found in her restaurant 7 days a week from 7 in the morning until pretty late in the evening, or until the food runs out. Romania is the very image of responsibility and kindness. A constant flow of customers visits her restaurant and business picks up at breakfasttime, lunchtime and dinnertime. She also sells grilled chicken and serves heaping portions of french fries, slices of chicken, salad and custard. With her next loan, Romania hopes to receive $1,000 USD. At the moment, her restaurant is well equipped with the basic necessities. She would like to use the money from this loan for personal use. She wants to finish building her house and purchase tiles et cetera. Romania is a responsible and punctual person and belongs to the communal bank "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo" (Friendship of Ollantaytambo). She has belonged to it for six years and is one of its founding members. Communal bank meetings occur every thirty days in the central office of the Arariwa Association headquarters in Ollantaytambo.

Translated from Spanish by David Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To build her house and to buy tiles et cetera

loan.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris naci y vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. La mayora de pobladores que viven en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo se dedican al turismo y otros pobladores que viven alrededor se dedican a la agricultura y ganadera. Doris hace 15 aos atrs abri un pequeo hospedaje La Casa de Doris, en su domicilio, donde hospeda a turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Ella y su esposo Amrico tienen un hijo. Doris en su hospedaje tiene cuartos matrimoniales, simple y dobles, donde los precios oscilan entre 20 soles o 50 soles dependiendo el cuarto. Le pueden encontrar en su hospedaje, que est equipado de computadoras personales para acceder a internet, cocina, sala de espera, baos privados, etc. todos los das de la semana, las 24 horas del da. Doris desprende una imagen de amabilidad y alegra. Un flujo regular de turistas se hospeda durante los meses de mayo, junio, julio y agosto.
Con su prximo prstamo, Doris espera recibir $200 USD. Por el momento, su hospedaje esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades ms bsicas. Le gustara emplear el dinero de este prstamo para ampliar el hospedaje y desea comprar ventanas y puertas para la parte que estn construyendo.
texts.en:
Doris was born in the city of Ollantaytambo and still lives there. Most of the people of Ollantaytambo work in the field of tourism, while others who live outside the city work in farming and ranching. Fifteen years ago, Doris opened a small inn, La Casa de Doris ["Doris's House"] in her home, where she hosts foreign and domestic tourists. She and her husband Amrico have one child. In her inn, Doris has single, double and family rooms, with prices ranging from 20 to 50 soles depending on the room. Every day of the week, 24 hours a day, she can be found in her inn, which is equipped with personal computers for Internet access, a kitchen, a waiting room, private bathrooms, etc. Doris projects an image of friendliness and cheerfulness. A steady flow of tourists stays at the inn during the months of May, June, July and August. With her next loan, Doris hopes to receive $200 in US dollars. For the moment, her inn is modestly equipped with the most basic needs. She would like to use the funds to help expand her inn, buying windows and doors for the new part that is under construction.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying windows and doors

loan.name: Leocadie

texts.en:
Leocadie is 27 years old and married with three children who are 2, 4 and 5 years old. Leocadie struggles by in life selling a variety of jewelry. She has been in this business for about seven years. The hours of her business are from 6 am to 9 pm every day.
Leocadie needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. This loan will allow her to expand her business by adding the sale of modern jewelry. With this additional jewelry, Leocadie will hopefully earn more profit which will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability of the business as well as her family.

loan.use: To buy a variety of goods, mainly jewelry, etc.

loan.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
Rosa Mercedes naci y vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. La mayora de pobladores que viven en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo se dedican al turismo y los pobladores que viven alrededor se dedican a la agricultura y ganadera.
Rosa desde muy nia aprendi de sus padres a sembrar, cultivar, ordear y pastear animales. Rosa tiene al lado de su domicilio una pequea chacra donde siembra maz, pasto, etc. Ya son 15 aos que esta con el negocio y le va muy bien, ella vende sus productos en el mercado de Virgen Asunta de Ollantaytambo pues tiene un puesto de venta. Con su prximo prstamo, Rosa que espera recibir de $200. Le gustara emplear el dinero de este prstamo en comprar abono.
Rosa es una mujer emprendedora, responsable y puntual y por ese motivo sus amigas la invitaron a participar D. banco comunal La Amistad de Ollantaytambo de la Asociacin Arariwa.
texts.en:
Rosa Mercedes was born in Ollantaytambo and still lives there. Most people who live in the city of Ollantaytambo work in the field of tourism, while those who live outside the city work in farming and ranching. Since she was a very small girl, Rosa learned from her parents how to plant and cultivate crops and how to milk cows and take them to pasture. Next to her home, Rosa has a small farm where she grows corn, hay, etc. She has operated this business for 15 years, and it is going very well for her. She sells her products at the Virgen Asunta market in Ollantaytambo, where she has a sales stall. With her next loan, Rosa hopes to receive $200. She would like to use the funds from this loan to buy fertilizer. Rosa is an enterprising, responsible and punctual woman, and for this reason, her friends invited her to participate in the communal bank La Amistad de Ollantaytambo ["The Friendship of Ollantaytambo"], of the Arariwa Association.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying fertilizer

loan.name: La Joya Group

texts.es:
ElL. son el grupo La Joya, llamados as por la colonia donD. radican. Este es su primer ciclo con nosotros y estn muy contentos D. formar parte D. Fundacin Realidad. La Joya la conforman: *Mara Flix G. M. (venta D. cosmticos por catalogo) *Antonia C. M. (venta D. servilletas) *Maribel Zacaras S. (venta D. cosmticos por catalogo) *Noe Jimnez Hernndez (venta D. F.) *Mara del Carmen Copelia Rodrguez B. (venta D. dulces) *Alma Yasmin M. Rodrguez (venta D. dulces) *Francisca M. A. (venta D. dulces) *Dulce Paola J. Snchez (venta D. productos D. limpieza) *Magdalena G. G. (venta D. servilletas) *Mara D. Lourdes Garca V. (Papelera)REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO *Mara Carmen S. E. (venta D. productos nutricionales) *Margarita M. D. L. S. (venta D. dulces) *Rebeca F. P. (venta D. adornos) y *Fausto Epigmento F. (venta D. dulces)
Noe Jimnez D. 32 aos D. edad es casado y con dos hijas en edad escolar. El era empleado D. una florera pero con el tiempo el sueldo que le brindaban ya no le alcanzaba ya que L. gastos D. sus hijas iban incrementando as que se decidi independizarse, hace un ao que No junto con su esposa decidieron comenzar con la venta D. F., durante la semana su esposa se ubica en L. tianguis mientras No va D. casa en casa, as es como se dan a conocer, el surte cada tercer da, va hasta L. invernaderos para encontrar buenos precios y a su regreso tiene que tomar un taxi para no maltratar su mercanca ya que traerL. en transporte publico es algo complicado, tambin elabora floreros y diferentes adornos que le solicitan sus clientes, con el crdito solicitado el va a comprar F., chalupas, bases para L. arregL. ya que as podr tener un mayor ingreso para L. gastos D. familia y poder construir un cuarto mas en su casa para tener un buen espacio para sus hijas. Sus planes son poner un pequeo local en su domicilio para poder exhibir sus arregL. y as aclientarse un poco mas al igual que desea que sus hijas puedan terminar una C. y salgan adelante
ElL. estn muy contentos con el crdito recibido por que as podrn incrementar su mercanca y tendrn un mayor ingreso para poder cubrir L. gastos D. sus familias.
texts.en:
This is the La Joya (The Jewell) group. They chose this name because its also the name of their neighborhood. They are in their first cycle with us and are very happy to be a part of Fundacin Realidad. The groups members and activities are: *Mara Flix G. M. (cosmetic sales via catalog) *Antonia C. M. (serviette sales) *Maribel Zacaras S. (cosmetic sales via catalog) *Noe Jimnez Hernndez (flower sales) *Mara del Carmen Copelia Rodrguez B. (sweets sales) *Alma Yasmin M. Rodrguez (sweets sales) *Francisca M. A. (sweets sales) *Dulce Paola J. Snchez (cleaning product sales) *Magdalena G. G. (serviette sales) *Mara D. Lourdes Garca V. (paper goods) GROUPS REPRESENTATIVE *Mara Carmen S. E. (nutrition items sales) *Margarita M. D. L. S. (sweets sales) *Rebeca F. P. (decoration sales) *Fausto Epigmento F. (sweets sales) Noe Jimnez is 32 years old, married, and has two school aged daughters. He used to work for a florist, but eventually his salary was no longer enough, since his daughters expenses continued to increase. A year ago he decided to go out on his own and he and his wife began selling flowers. During the week his wife sets up a stall, while Noe goes door to door. This is how they have become known. Every third day he visits the growers in order to buy at good prices, and takes a taxi home so as not to damage his merchandise. Trying to bring it back via public transportation gets complicated. He also makes vases and different decorations at his customers request. He will use the money from this loan to buy flowers, chalupas (in this case, dishes used for flower arrangements not food), and foam bases for his arrangements. This will allow him to increase his income so he can cover his family expenses. It will also allow him to add a room to his house so that his daughters will have more room.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Flowers and supplies for making arrangements

loan.name: Grisel

texts.es:
Grisel naci y vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. La mayora de pobladores que viven en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo se dedican al turismo y otros pobladores que viven alrededor se dedican a la agricultura y ganadera. Grisel hace varios aos atrs abri un puesto de venta de artesana, en la plaza de principal de Ollantaytambo, donde vende artesana como por ejemplo chompas de lana, sombreros, bordarnos, ponchos, etc. Ella y su esposo Fredy tienen un hijo. Le pueden encontrar en su puesto de venta, que est equipado con regular mercadera, los 7 das de la semana, desde las 8 de la maana hasta bastante tarde en la noche. Grisel desprende una imagen de amabilidad y alegra. Un flujo regular de turistas vistan su puesto de venta y el negocio se anima durante los meses de mayo, junio, julio y agosto.
Con su prximo prstamo, Grisel espera recibir $300 USD. Por el momento, su puesto esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades ms bsicas. Le gustara emplear el dinero de este prstamo para en comprar ms mercadera como por ejemplo sombreros, chompas, ponchos.
Grisel es una mujer emprendedora, responsable y puntual y por ese motivo sus amigas la invitaron a participar del banco comunal La Amistad de Ollantaytambo de la Asociacin Arariwa.
texts.en:
Grisel was born and lives within the city of Ollantaytambo. Most of Ollantaytambos inhabitants work in the tourist industry and those living in the surrounding area work in agriculture; farming and raising livestock. Several years ago Grisel opened a store to sell arts and crafts in the citys main plaza, where she sells things such as wool sweaters, hats, embroidery, ponchos, etc. She and her husband Fredy have one son. One can find her at her store, which is stocked with regular merchandise, seven days a week from 8:00 am until well into the night. Grisel presents an air of friendship and happiness. A regular flow of tourists visit her store and the store is lively during the months of May, June, July, and August. Grisel is hoping to receive a $300 loan. For the time being her store is modestly stocked with the basic necessities, but she would like to use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise, such as hats, sweaters, and ponchos. She is a very entrepreneurial, responsible, and punctual woman, so her friends invited her to participate in the La Amistad de Ollantaytambo (Friend of Ollantaytambo) communal bank of the Asociacin Arariwa.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Merchandise for resale

loan.name: Fabiana

texts.es:
Fabiana naci y vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. La mayora de pobladores que viven en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo se dedican al turismo y otros pobladores que viven alrededor se dedican a la agricultura y ganadera. Fabiana hace tres aos atrs abri un tienda de abarrotes, en la avenida principal de la ciudad Ollantaytambo, donde vende comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azcar, fideos, aceite, leche, gaseosas, etc. Ella y su esposo Fredy son casados y fruto de este matrimonio tienen tres hijos. Le pueden encontrar en su tienda, que est equipado con regular mercadera, los 7 das de la semana, desde las 5 de la maana hasta bastante tarde en la noche. Fabiana desprende una imagen de amabilidad y alegra. Un flujo regular de clientes vistan su tienda y el negocio se anima durante todos los das.
Con su prximo prstamo, Fabiana espera recibir $1000 USD. Por el momento, su puesto esta modestamente equipado mercadera con los productos bsicos. Le gustara emplear el dinero de este prstamo para en comprar ms mercadera como por ejemplo arroz, fideos, conversar de atn, etc.
Fabiana es una mujer emprendedora, responsable y puntual y por ese motivo sus amigas la invitaron a participar del banco comunal La Amistad de Ollantaytambo de la Asociacin Arariwa.
texts.en:
Fabiana was born and lives within the city of Ollantaytambo. Most of Ollantaytambos inhabitants work in the tourist industry and those living in the surrounding area work in agriculture; farming and raising livestock. Three years ago Fabiana opened a grocery store along the citys main street, where she sells food such as rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, milk, soft drinks, etc. She is married to Fredy and they are blessed with three children. One can find her at her store, which is stocked with regular merchandise, seven days a week from 5:00 am until well into the night. Fabiana presents an air of friendship and happiness. She has a regular flow of customers who visit her store and it motivates her every day. Fabiana is hoping to receive a $1,000 loan. For the time being the store is modestly stocked with the basic items, but she would like to use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise, such as rice, noodles, tuna, etc. She is a very entrepreneurial, responsible, and punctual woman, so her friends invited her to participate in the La Amistad de Ollantaytambo (Friend of Ollantaytambo) communal bank of the Asociacin Arariwa.
