Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Inventory

loan.name: Dulia

texts.es:
Dula naci y vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. La mayora de pobladores que viven en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo se dedican al turismo y otros pobladores que viven alrededor se dedican a la agricultura y ganadera. Dula tiene 35 aos y hace tres diez atrs abri un bar restaurante, en la ciudad Ollantaytambo, donde vende cerveza y comidas especiales como por ejemplo chicharon, adobo, etc. Ella es casada y fruto de este matrimonio tiene dos hijos. Le pueden encontrar en su bar que est equipado con regular productos, los 7 das de la semana, desde las diez de la maana hasta bastante tarde en la noche. Dulia desprende una imagen de amabilidad y alegra. Un flujo regular de clientes vistan su bar y el negocio se anima durante todos los fines de semana y por las noches.
Con su prximo prstamo, Dula espera recibir $700 USD. Por el momento, su puesto esta modestamente equipado con poca mercadera. Le gustara emplear el dinero de este prstamo para en comprar ms cervezas.
Dulia es una mujer emprendedora, responsable y puntual y por ese motivo sus amigas la invitaron a participar D. banco comunal La Amistad de Ollantaytambo de la Asociacin Arariwa.
texts.en:
Dula was born in the city of Ollantaytambo. Most of Ollantaytambos inhabitants work in the tourist industry and those living in the surrounding area work in agriculture; farming and raising livestock. Dula is 35 years old. She opened a restaurant-bar in town thirty days ago, where she sells beer and specialty dishes, such as pork rinds, adobo, etc. She is married and has two children. One can find her in her bar, which is stocked with regular products, seven days a week, from 10:00 am until very late at night. Dula exhibits an air of happiness and friendship. A regular flow of customers visits her bar and business is lively in the evenings and on the weekends. Dula hopes to receive a loan of $700. At this time her bar is not very well stocked and she wants to use the money to buy more beers. Dula is a very entrepreneurial, responsible, and punctual woman, so her friends invited her to participate in the La Amistad de Ollantaytambo (Friend of Ollantaytambo) communal bank of the Asociacin Arariwa.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Beer to stock her pub

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy more soap and slippers to sell to his customers

loan.name: Flor Andina Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Flor Andina actualmente se encuentra en el I ciclo y est conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta das en la oficina central D. la Asociacin Arariwa.
Las actividades econmicas D. los algunos D. los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo, venta D. productos D. belleza, venta D. frutas, venta D. perfumes, venta D. comida y venta D. relojes. Otros socios brindan servicios D. viajes tursticos, alquiler D. carros y empleada D. una ONG.
Justina, tiene 62 aos, es viuda y tiene seis hijos (2 mujeres y 4 varones), ella naci y vive en la ciudad del Cusco. Hace varios aos que abri un pequeo restaurante en su domicilio donD. sirve almuerzo. Hace varios atrs su esposo falleci, y Justina se quedo sola al cuidado D. sus hijos.
Decidida a continuar su vida, Justina se dedico D. completo al negocio. Utilizo sus ahorros para implementar el restaurante, donD. aproximadamente atienD. a ms 20 D. clientes todos los das. Le pueden encontrar en su restaurante, que est equipado con sillas y mesas, D. lunes a sbados, desD. las 9 D. la maana hasta bastante tarD., o hasta que se agote la comida y los domingos venD. platos especiales extras como por ejemplo chicharon y caldo D. cabeza.
Con su prximo prstamo, Justina espera recibir S/. 500 soles. Por el momento, su restaurante esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades ms bsicas. Le gustara emplear el dinero D. este prstamo en comprar ms gaseosas, arroz y azcar.
texts.en:
The Flor Andina (Andean Flower) communal bank is currently in its first loan cycle and is maD. up of hard-working, enterprising people who constantly seek opportunities to get ahead and, with their daily efforts, to give their children a better future. The communal bank's meetings are held every 30 days at Asociacin Arariwa's central office. Some of the members' economic activities are, for example, sales of beauty products, fruit sales, perfume sales, food sales and watch sales. Other members offer their services as tour guides, renting cars, and a member is employed by a non-governmental organization (NGO). Justina is 62 years old. She is a widow and has six children (two women and four men). She was born and lives in the city of Cusco. Several years ago, Justina opened a small restaurant in her house, where she serves lunch. Several years ago, her husband passed away, and Justina was left to take care of her children alone. Deciding to continue with her life, Justina dedicated herself completely to her business. She used her savings to start the restaurant, where she attends to approximately 20 customers everyday. They can find her in her restaurant, which is equipped with chairs and tables, Monday through Saturday from 9 in the morning until quite late, or until the food runs out. On Sundays she also sells special dishes like, for example, chicharrn [fried pork rinds] and caldo D. cabeza [sheep's head soup]. With her next loan, Justina hopes to receive 500 new soles. For the moment, her restaurant is modestly equipped with the most basic necessities. She would like to use the money from this loan to buy more sodas, rice and sugar.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase soda, rice and sugar

loan.name: Erika Lourdes

texts.es:
Erika Lourdes A. E. tiene 20 aos. Es soltera y vive con los padres, en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. No tiene hijos.
Erika es una socia de la ventanilla rural la Y, que est ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer prstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San Jos.
Erika se dedica al comercio, vende cosmticos en Yambal. Realiza sus compras por medio de revistas y vende de puerta a puerta.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en el negocio y ponerse otro. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos es tener su propio negocio y vivir con sus padres. Enfrenta desafos es la competencia de la localidad.
Le gusta hacer deporte y estudiar.
texts.en:
Erika Lourdes A. E. is 20 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in Ventanas, in in Los Ros province. She has no children. Erika is a member of the Y communal bank, located an hour and a half from Ventanas. It has a total of 17 members, most of whom work in agriculture. This is their first loan through the San Jos Cooperative. Erika works in the retail trade, selling Yanbal cosmetics. She makes her purchases through catalogs and sells her merchandise from door to door. She is requesting the loan to invest in her business and start another one. She believes that the loan will provide an opportunity for her to get ahead. Her dreams are to have her own business and keep living with her parents. One of the challenges she faces is the competition in the area. She likes to play sports and study.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Investing in her business and starting another one

loan.name: Carlos Hernan

texts.es:
Carlos Hernan V. V., tiene 26 aos. Es soltero y vive con los padres, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. No tiene hijos.
Carlos es un socio de la ventanilla rural la Y, que est ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer prstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San Jos.
Carlos se dedica a la ganadera, cra vacas. Realiza sus compras cada semana en Echeandia y vende las vacas en Ventanas.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de ms ganado. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos es tener dinero para comprar un vehiculo para transportar el ganado. Enfrenta desafos es la falta de dinero.
Le gusta jugar ftbol.
texts.en:
Carlos Hernan V. V. is 26 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in Ventanas, province of Los Ros. He does not have children. Carlos is a member of the "Y" solidarity group, which is located an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 17 members altogether, who mainly work in agriculture. This is the first loan they have taken out with Cooperativa San Jos. Carlos raises cows. He makes his purchases every week in Echeandia and sells the cows in Ventanas. He is asking for the loan to invest in buying more cattle. He thinks the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have money to buy a vehicle for transporting the cattle. A challenge he faces is lack of money. He likes to play soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Cattle purchases

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy more cartons of soap to sell to her customers

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Buying construction materials

loan.name: Maria Piedad

texts.es:
Maria Piedad I. C., tiene 57 aos. Es casada y vive con el esposo y los hijos, en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. Tiene 3 hijos.
Maria es una socia de la ventanilla rural la Y, que est ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer prstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San Jos.
Maria se dedica al comercio, a la venta de pollos pelados. Realiza sus compras cada semana en Echeandia y vende en la misma localidad.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de pollos. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos es tener dinero para comprar un terreno para tener pollos y otros animales. Enfrenta desafos es la falta de dinero.
Le gusta leer y caminar en el campo.
texts.en:
Maria Piedad I. C. is 57 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in Ventanas, in Los Ros province. She has 3 children. Maria is a member of the Y rural solidarity group, located an hour and a half from Ventanas. It has a total of 17 members, most of whom work in agriculture. This is their first loan through the San Jos Cooperative. Maria is in the retail trade, selling plucked chickens. She makes her purchases each week in Echeandia and sells her products in the same area. She is requesting the loan to invest the funds in buying chickens. She believes that the loan is an opportunity for her to get ahead. Her dream is to have enough money to buy a plot of land to raise chickens and other animals. One of the challenges she faces is the lack of money. She enjoys reading and taking walks in the country.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying chickens

loan.name: Sumac Puririsun Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Sumac Puririsun actualmente se encuentra en el III ciclo y est conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta das en la oficina central D. la Asociacin Arariwa.
Las actividades econmicas D. los algunos D. los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo, venta D. comida, venta D. cuyes y gallinas, venta D. artesana, venta D. pasto, venta D. rocoto relleno y venta D. tamales. Otros socios brindan servicios D. cuidado D. nios y obrero.
Neil, tiene 24 aos y tiene un hijo, ella naci en el distrito Cusipata que esta y ubicado a 45 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco y actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco. Neil desD. los 11 aos est rodeada del negocio D. venta D. tamales. Su cuada Nayda se dedicaba a la preparacin D. tamales y Neil le ayudaba a su cuada a vender los tamales en los buses que se dirigan D. la ciudad D. Sicuani a la ciudad del Cusco. Ella suba a los carros y se suplicaba a los choferes para que ella pueda ofrecer sus tamales. Hace varios aos atrs se caso y tuvo que venirse a vivir a la ciudad del Cusco para esta al lado D. su esposo.
Decidida a empezar una nueva vida, se mudo al Cusco. Utilizo sus ahorros para preparar y vender los tamales en el terminal terrestre D. buses D. la ciudad del Cusco, donD. ella sube a los buses y ofrece a los viajeros. La pueden encontrar en el terminal, los 7 das D. la semana, desD. las 5 D. la maana hasta las 6 D. la tarD. o hasta que se agote los tamales, Ella venD. tamales D. dos sabores D. sal y D. azcar a un costo D. 0.50 soles cada tamal.
Con su prximo prstamo, Neil espera recibir S/. 1000 soles. Le gustara comprar maz, hoja D. planta D. maz, azcar, huevos, pasas y muchos insumos ms. Por ahora, Neyl est preocupada porque el director del terminal le quiere desalojar y le est obligando a alquilar un puesto D. venta pero ella no cuenta con suficiente dinero para alquilar. El sueo D. la socia es abrir una pequea tienda D. venta D. comestibles en su domicilio y desea convertirse en una microempresaria.
texts.en:
The Sumac Puririsun communal bank is currently in its third loan cycle. It is maD. up of hard-working and enterprising people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and to give their children a better future through their daily efforts. The communal bank's meetings are held every 30 days at the central office of the Arariwa Association. The economic activities of some of the members are, for example, selling food, selling hens and guinea pigs, selling handicrafts, selling hay, selling stuffed peppers, and selling tamales. Other members proviD. services such as child care and manual labor. Neil is 24 years old and has one child. She was born in Cusipata district, located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco, and she currently lives in the city of Cusco. Since she was 11 years old, Neil has been surrounded by the business of selling tamales. Her sister-in-law Nayda went into the business of preparing tamales, and Neil helped her sell the tamales in the buses that travel from the city of Sicuani to Cusco. She got into the buses and asked the drivers if she could offer her tamales to the passengers. Several years ago, she got married and had to come live in the city of Cusco to be with her husband. Determined to start a new life, she moved to Cusco. She used her savings to prepare tamales and sell them at the bus station in Cusco, where she gets on the buses and offers them to the travelers. She can be found at the terminal 7 days a week, from 5 in the morning until 6 in the evening, or until the tamales run out. She sells tamales in two varieties, sweet and savory, at a price of 0.50 soles each. For her next loan, Neil hopes to receive 1000 Peruvian soles. She would like to buy corn, corn husks, sugar, eggs, raisins and many more ingredients. At present, Neil is worried because the director of the bus terminal wants to evict her; he is requiring her to rent a sales stand, but she does not have enough money to rent one. Her dream is to open a small food store in her home, and she would like to become a microentrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying corn, corn husks, sugar, eggs, raisins and many more supplies

loan.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann R. lives in the town of Surallah. She is 29 years old, married and has three very young children. Mary Ann makes a living as a farmer, growing mainly rice. She has been in this business for more than three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from her work.
Mary Ann joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid five previous loan from CEVI and is applying for a new one, for 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for her crop. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to supplement her family's income.
About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training which are provided at regular group meetings.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

loan.name: Deidamia Marilin

texts.es:
Deidamia Marilin R. J., tiene 23 aos. Es casada y vive con el esposo y los hijos, en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. Tiene 2 hijos, Nataly (5) y Paul (1).
Deidamia es una socia de la ventanilla rural la Y, que est ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer prstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San Jos.
Deidamia se dedica a la agricultura, siembra naranja. Realiza sus compras cada semana donde el seor Gerardo y vende la misma localidad.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de naranja y cacao desea sembrar a futuro. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos es tener un negocio propio e incrementar los ingresos. Enfrenta desafos es la falta de dinero.
Le gusta el comercio y salir a vender las naranjas.
texts.en:
Deidamia Marilin R. J. is 23, married, and lives with her spouse and children in the Ventanas province in Los Rios. She has two children, Nataly (5 years) and Paul (1 year). Deidamia is a member of the rural community bank, the Y, which is located an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total, the majority of whom work in agriculture. This is the first loan they have taken out with the San Jose Cooperative. Deidamia works in agriculture, planting oranges. She makes her purchases every week in Mr. Gerardos location and sells in the same place. She requests the loan to invest in the purchase of oranges and cocoa that she wishes to plant in the future. She thinks the loan is an opportunity to get ahead in life. Her dreams are to have her own business and to increase her income. The challenge she faces is a lack of capital. She enjoys business and going to sell the oranges.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Invest in the purchase of oranges and cocoa that she wishes to plant in the future

loan.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 50 years old and married with six children between the ages of 9 and 20. Flora makes a living by selling drinks made from sorghum. This is her tenth successful year in the business. Her business hours are from 6 am to 9 pm every day.
Flora needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. With this loan, Flora will purchase a large quantity of sorghum to make into drinks. With the use of this loan, Flora will also start wholesaling to retailers who operate the same business. If successful, Flora will hopefully earn a lot of money and this income will allow her to keep reinvesting in her business and start saving for a better future for her family.

loan.use: To buy a large quantity of sorghum to make into drinks for sale

loan.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina D. lives in the town of Surallah. She is 38 years old, married and has seven school-aged children. She makes a living as a farmer, growing mainly rice, and has been in this line of work for more than 19 years.
Divina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid five previous loans from CEVI, and is applying for a new one, for 15,000 PHP, to buy seeds, fertilizer and other items for her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve her family's living standards.
About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI provides not only credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training at regular group meetings.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other items for her farm

loan.name: Mbukam

texts.en:
Born in 1982, Mbukam M. is married and a mother of two children. She has been very hardworking since she joined GHAPE as she explained how good it is for a woman to work for herself and care of the children. Her desire is to work for her childrens education and pay for their apprenticeship. Also, she says she finds it very difficult to take care of her two children because for some months back she has been having some marital problems. Because of that, her husband has not been giving her food money for the family. With these difficulties, she looked for a place to get capital in order to do some buy and sell trade, which would give her income. With the inability to get investment capital, which could give her higher income to meet her childrens needs and the family, she decided to join GHAPE in 2009, and since then she has successfully received and repaid one loan.
With the second loan she is requesting, she plans to buy 30 tins of potatoes for 50,000FCFA, 20 tins of beans for 50,000FCFA, vegetables for 10,000FCFA, and cocoyams for 5,000FCFA. This investment will help people in her community because she will sell her goods to the public, which will reduce their cost of transportation.
She says that she will use the profit generated from this investment to help her husband pay tuition fees for her two children and take care of their health.
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loan.use: To buy Irish potatoes, beans and vegetables.

loan.name: Argentina Piedad

texts.es:
Argentina Piedad S. V., tiene 73 aos. Es viuda y vive con los hijos, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. Tiene 5 hijos, German (45), Luis (60), Gloria (56), Maricela (45), Nancy (40) y Gabriel (50).
Argentina es una socia de la ventanilla rural la Y, que est ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer prstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San Jos.
Argentina se dedica a la agricultura, siembra banano, cacao, caf, maz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en Echeandia y vende la misma localidad y los alrededores.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de banano, cacao, caf, maz para sembrar y vender. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos es tener un negocio propio e incrementar los ingresos. Enfrenta desafos es la falta de dinero y las plagas y enfermedades que afectan los cultivos.
Le gusta trabajar en el campo y pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
Argentina Piedad S. V. is 73 years old and lives with her sons in the Ventanas province in Los Ros. She has 6 children: German (45), Luis (60), Gloria (56), Maricela (45) Nancy (40) and Gabriel (50). Argentina is a member of the communal bank 'Y', which is located 1 1/2 hours from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total and the majority work in agriculture. This is the first loan that they are seeking from Cooperativa San Jos. Argentina works in agriculture, cultivating bananas, cocoa, coffee and maize. She makes her monthly purchases in Echeandia and sells in the same locations and surrounds. She is seeking a loan to invest in the purchase of bananas, cocoa, coffee and maize to sow and sell. She thinks that this loan is an opportunity to improve their situation. Her dreams are to have her own business and increase her earnings. Preventing her from realising her goals is the lack of money and the plagues and diseases that affect the crops. Argentina likes to work in the countryside and spend time with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase banana, cocoa, coffee and maize to sow/grow

loan.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita E. is from the town of Surallah. She is 63 years old and married with two adult children. To make a living, Florita owns a business raising crops, primarily rice, for sale. Florita has been engaged in her business for over 46 years.
Florita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Florita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.
About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loan.name: Clavelina Estherlia

texts.es:
Clavelina Estherlia N. M., tiene 41 aos. Es casada y vive con el esposo y los hijos, en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. Tiene 2 hijos, Washintong y Johana.
Clavelina es una socia de la ventanilla rural la Y, que est ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer prstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San Jos.
Clavelina se dedica a la agricultura, siembra cacao y maz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en Echeandia y vende la misma localidad y los alrededores.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de cacao y maz para sembrar y vender. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos es tener un negocio propio e incrementar los ingresos. Enfrenta desafos es la falta de dinero y las plagas y enfermedades que afectan los cultivos.
Le gusta trabajar en el campo.
texts.en:
Clavelina Estherlia N. M. is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas province in Los Ros. She has two children, Washington and Johana. Clavelina is a member of the communal group 'Y', which is located 1 1/2 hours from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total, and the majority work in agriculture. This is the first loan that they are seeking from la Cooperativa San Jos. Clavelina works in agriculture, producing cocoa and maize. She makes her purchases in Echeandia each month and sells in the same place, and around the area. She is seeking a loan to invest in the purchase of cocoa and maize to sow and sell. She thinks that the loan is an opportunity to move forward. Her dreams are to have her own business and increase her earnings. Preventing her from achieving her goals is the lack of money and the plagues and diseases that affect the crops. Clavelina likes to working in the countryside.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase cocoa and maize to sow and sell

loan.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita F. is from the town of Surallah. She is 39 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She hopes to be successful in her business, just like other entrepreneurs. She also wants her children to finish college and does her best to achieve it.
Anita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizer. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Anita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.
About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loan.name: Ayeah

texts.en:
Born in 1984, Ayeah L., is married to Mr. Isaac Jam and they have three children who are all younger than 15. Her motivation comes from the difficulties she faced, especially the death of her mother, poor health, her inability to continue education and the destruction of her cassava farm by wild fire. As a consequence of all this, she was unable to educate her children even at primary school level.
Encouraged by GHAPE borrowers she became a member of GHAPE and received her first loan of 40,000CFAF in 2009. Since then she has proven her ability to receive, invest and repay her loan. From previous loans she provided her community with food stuff like beans, corn and Irish potatoes. She is proud of her achievements, especially her success in owning and managing her own business. With profits from these loans, she has been paying her childrens school fees.
With a new loan, she plans to continue in the same line of business. She plans to buy twenty tins of beans for 50,000FCFA, fifteen tins of Irish potatoes for 20,000FCFA, six tins of corn for 15,000FCFA and vegetables for 10,000FCFA She will provide food stuff to the community and the business will succeed since she has many customers. Her intention is to use the profit to continue to educate her children and to take care of her health and her family.
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loan.use: to buy corn, beans, Irish potatoes and vegetables for resale

loan.name: Libia Noemi

texts.es:
Libia Noemi R. J. tiene 43 aos. Es casada y vive con el esposo y los hijos, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. Tiene 2 hijos, Rolando y Holger.
Libia es una socia de la ventanilla rural la Y, que est ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer prstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San Jos.
Libia se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda de licores. Realiza sus compras cada mes en Echeandia y vende la misma localidad. Solicita el prstamo para invertir en el negocio de venta de licores. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Ella espera incrementar los ingresos de su negocio con la ayuda de este prestamo. Enfrenta desafos es la falta de dinero y las plagas y enfermedades que afectan los cultivos.
Le gusta trabajar y ver la televisin.
texts.en:
Libia Noemi R. J. is 43. She lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas province in Los Ros. Libia has 2 children: Rolando and Holger. Libia is a member of the communal bank 'Y', which is located 1 1/2 hours from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total, and the majority work in agriculture. This is the first time that they are seeking a loan from Cooperativa San Jos. Libia works in commerce and has an alcohol store. She makes her monthly purchases in Echeandia and sells in the same location. She is seeking a loan to invest in her business and sees it as an opportunity to improve her situation. She hopes to increase her earnings with the help of this loan. Preventing her from achieving her dreams are the lack of money and plagues and diseases that affect the crops. Libia likes working and watching television.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Invest in business

loan.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Born in 1966, Eunice D. is the mother of three children. She has faced so many challenges as a woman, like when the cold hands of death took her mother away when still very young and when she finds it difficult to single-handedly pay tuition fees and provide the basic needs for her children. This is the first time she has requested a loan from GHAPE. As she was unable to get investment capital that would help increase her income, she was motivated to request a loan from GHAPE.
With the loan, she plans to buy three tins of beans seedlings for 195,500FCFA and she will use 30,500FCFA to pay for labor on her farm. She will pay for clearing, hoeing and planting.
She thinks the business will succeed because she has been doing this activity for a very long time, she has a plot of land on which to operate and, also, her community will provide a ready market for her beans when they are ready. The profit obtained from this investment will be used to pay tuition fees and cover the basic needs of her children.
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loan.use: to buy beans and pay for labor

loan.name: Edmarie

texts.en:
Edmarie D. is from the town of Surallah. She is 44 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Edmarie has a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Edmarie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.
Edmarie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Edmarie from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.
About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loan.name: Wilson Roberto

texts.es:
Wilson Roberto Y. D., tiene 34 aos. Es soltero y vive con los padres y un hijo, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. Tiene 1 hijo, Yesenia.
Wilson es un socio de la ventanilla rural la Y, que est ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer prstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San Jos.
Wilson se dedica a transportar a la gente de la comunidad trabaja ya por 5 aos. Realiza los fletes todos los das en la comunidad.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de otra unidad de transporte. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos es tener ingresos mayores para comprar una casa. Enfrenta desafos es la falta de dinero y los caminos estan daados.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Wilson Roberto Y. D. is 34. He's single and lives with his parents and a child (Yessenia) in Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. Wilson is a member of the "Y" rural community bank that is about and hour and a half from Ventanas. There are a total of 17 members most of whom work in agriculture. This is their first loan with Cooperativa San Jose. Wilson has made a living transporting people in the community every day for the past 5 years. He is requesting a loan to purchase another transport vehicle. He feel the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have a better income to be able to buy a house. He faces challenges such as a lack of money and roads in poor conditions. He likes to play sports.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase another transport vehicle

loan.name: Esther

texts.en:
Born in 1960, Esther is married and has seven children. Four of the children are below the age of 15. She works hard and strives higher for herself and the family. The inability for her to have business capital and to be with people motivated her to join GHAPE in 2009. This is the first loan she is requesting from GHAPE.
She knows she will succeed in her farming business because she knows all the farming techniques and her farm products are in very high demand in her community. Also, she will buy Irish potatoes in bulk in her area and resell in the urban areas of Bamenda and Yaound, which will give her a high income.
Esther F. plans to buy farmland for 30,000FCFA and to buy ten tins of Irish potatoes for 20,000FCFA. The profit obtained from this investment will be used to pay tuition fees for her children and basic needs.
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loan.use: To buy farmland and Irish potatoes

loan.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 33 years old and married with five children between the ages of 4 and 14. Marie makes a living by selling a variety of goods in her shop. These goods include soap, sugar, cooking oil, etc. She has been in this business for about two years. The hours of her business are from 8 am to 7 pm every day.
Marie needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to allow her to start investing in the sale of more foodstuffs (rice, beans, wheat, peas, cassava, sugar, etc.) With the sale of these foodstuffs, Marie will hopefully earn more profit which will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and to start saving for the future of her family as well as her business.

loan.use: To buy a variety of goods, mainly foodstuffs, for sale

loan.name: Bertha Piedad

texts.es:
Bertha Piedad V. G., tiene 45 aos. Es casada y vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. Tiene 2 hijos, Jhony y Julio.
Bertha es una socia de la ventanilla rural la Y, que est ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer prstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San Jos.
Bertha se dedica al comercio, tiene un bar donde vende jugos. Las compras las realizan a diario en el mercado de la localidad, vende en un bar en la misma Comunidad.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en el negocio e incrementar con ropa y viveres. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos es tener dinero para arreglar la casa y aumentar el negocio. Enfrenta desafos es la falta de dinero.
Le gusta escuchar msica.
texts.en:
Bertha Piedad V. G. is 45 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and her sons in Ventanas, a town in the province of Los Ros. She has two sons, Jhony and Julio. Bertha is a member of the "Y" communal bank, located an hour and a half from Ventanas. It has 17 members, mostly working in agriculture. This is their first loan through the microfinance institution Cooperativa San Jos. Bertha is a merchant. She has a bar where she sells juice. She buys her ingredients daily at the local market. Her bar is also there. She applies for a loan to invest in her business and purchase more clothes and groceries. She believes that the loan will provide an opportunity for her to get ahead. Her dreams are to have enough money to repair her house and expand her business. Lack of money is a challenge she has to face. Bertha enjoys listening to music.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To invest in her business and purchase more clothes and groceries

loan.name: Ten Sticks Group

texts.en: Satta N., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Ten Sticks. She is 60 years old, married, and has seven children between 23 and 39. She was not privileged to attend school due to poverty. For 20 years, she has been selling lappas in Chicken Soup Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 20,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 58,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more lappas. She describes herself as a determine woman. Her dream is to improve her business. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Hawa S. is inset a the lower left because she was not present during the meeting.

loan.use: To buy more lappas

loan.name: Olga Rebeca

texts.es:
Olga Rebeca R. P., tiene 57 aos. Es divorciada vive solo, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. Tiene 4 hijos, Rocio, Eduardo, Alberto y Jina.
Olga es una socia de la ventanilla rural la Y, que est ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer prstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San Jos.
Olga se dedica a la agricultura, la siembra de naranja, yuca, caf y maiz . Las compras las realizan cada vez que sale la cosecha en Guayaquil y Babahoyo y vende sus productos en la misma localidad y en los alrededores.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para incrementar la produccin. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos es tener dinero para viajar a Italia para encontrarse con sus familiares. Enfrenta desafos es la falta de dinero.
Le gusta trabajar, salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Olga Rebeca R. P. is 57 years old. She is divorced and lives alone in Ventanas, a province in Los Ros. She has 4 children: Rocio, Eduardo, Alberto and Jina. Olga is a member of the Y rural bank, which is located an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total who, for the most part, work in agriculture. This is the first loan they are taking with Cooperativa San Jos. Olga dedicates herself to farming, such as the planting of oranges, yucca, coffee and corn. She makes her purchases at harvest time in Guayaquil and Babahoyo, and sells her products in the same cities and in neighboring areas. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of seeds, so she can increase her production. She believes the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. Her dream is to be able to travel to Italy to meet her relatives. She faces challenges related to lack of funds. She likes to travel, and to go on trips with the family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase seeds so she can increase her crop production.

loan.name: Osvaldo Javier

texts.es: El Sr. Osvaldo V. es cliente recurrente, vive en casa propia. El titular es fotgrafo independiente hace mas de 5 aos, realiza trabajos para todo tipo de eventos , (cumpleaos, casamientos, colaciones de colegios, etc.). Solicito dicho prstamo para la compra de una nueva cmara digital de tal forma a realizar mejor sus trabajos. El titular opera con la Fundacin Paraguaya desde el ao 2010 abonando en fecha su prstamo, que a la vez le ha ayudado para su inversin y mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Seor Osvaldo V. is a repeat client who lives in his own house. He is a freelance photographer and has spent the last five years photographing all kinds of events (birthdays, weddings, graduation ceremonies etc.). He is requesting a loan to buy a new digital camera to improve his work. Seor V. has worked with the Fundacin Paraguaya since 2010, paying back his loans on time, which has helped him with his investment and improved his standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy a new digital camera

loan.name: Djumapili

texts.en:
Djumapili is 47 years old and married with three children. Djumapili is well known for his shop where he sells a variety of goods. Djumapili has been in this business for a long time. The hours of his business are from early in the morning until late in the evening.
Djumapili needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. With this loan, Djumapili will start selling foodstuffs such as cassava flour, rice, beans, peas, etc. With this sale of foodstuffs, Djumapili will hopefully earn a lot of money and this will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and to start saving for the future.

loan.use: To buy a variety of goods, mainly foodstuffs such as cassava flour, rice, beans, peas, etc.

loan.name: La Juquilita Group

texts.es: La Sra. Luz Maydet A. Ramrez originaria del pabelln en el Estado de Guerrero es la presidenta del Gpo. La Juquilita, es una persona que trabaja vendiendo zapatos por catalogo, ella sustenta a su familia, pues es madre de un nio de 2 aos y 6 meses, ella esta casada y tiene la edad de 26 aos su mximo sueo es incrementar su negocio, como nos comenta que este ultimo prstamo lo invirtir en la compra de zapatos y dice que esta agradecida con la Fundacin por que la apoyo con su negocio y que le gusta mucho la forma de trabajo de la Fundacin a si como su tasa de inters y su bonificacin y el trato del personal, tambin menciona que ojala Fundacin les siga apoyando por mucho mas tiempo para que ellos puedan sacar adelante su negocio, el nombre del grupo es debido a que tienen una creencia muy arraigada en el pueblo por la virgen de Juquila haya en el estado de Oaxaca, en este grupo hay 10 integrantes trabajadoras que luchan por Salir adelante y todas agradecidas con fundacin realidad, por su confianza que les han brindado y la comprensin. Las integrantes son Clara M. J. que se dedica a la venta de pollos, Evangelista Hernndez M. elabora tamales, Yazmn Alicia Ros Garca vende de ropa, Yanina M. J. se dedica a la venta de comida, Maricruz A. C. venta de comida, Gloria M. C. se dedica a la venta de tamales, Luz Maydet A. Ramrez venta de calzado por catalogo, Dayna Ynez M. ella se dedica a la venta de perfume, ngel Yair Garca A. se dedica a la albailera y Florentino L. Rodrguez que se dedica a la venta de agua de garrafn. Ellos estn muy contentos por el crdito que se les financio para el incremento de sus ingresos y comentan que su grupo esta muy unido trabajando en equipo.
texts.en:
Luz Maydet A. Ramrez is a native of the state of Guerrero. She is the president of the group La Juquilita, and works selling shoes by catalog to support her family. She has a 2-year old child, is married and 26 years of age. Her greatest dream is to grow her business, and she tells us that this latest loan will help finance the purchase of shoes. She is thankful to the Foundation for the support of her business. She says that she very much likes how the Foundation works, as well as her interest rate, the rewards and the personal treatment. She also mentions that, hopefully, the Foundation will continue to help support her efforts for a long time so the group can grow their businesses. The Foundation got its name due to the towns deep-rooted religious belief in the Virgin of Juquila. There are 10 hard-working members in the group, and they are all grateful to the Foundation for its confidence and understanding. The members are: Clara M. J., who sells chickens; Evangelista Hernndez M., who makes tamales, Yazmn Alicia Ros Garca, who sells clothing; Yanina M. J. and Maricruz A. C., who sell food; Gloria M. C., who sells tamales; Luz Maydet A. Ramrez, who sells shoes by catalog; Dayna Ynez M., who sells perfume; ngel Yair Garca A., who is a bricklayer; and Florentino L. Rodrguez, who sells bottled water. They are very glad for financing to grow their businesses, and comment that the group is united and working as a team.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase shoes for women, men and children by catalog.

loan.name: Ronald Luis

texts.es:
El sr. Ronald D. tiene 24 aos de edad, es soltero, sin hijos, cuenta con un almacn en su domicilio, es muy conocido en la zona de la ciudad de Villarrica. Empez hace mas de 1 ao en su actividad con la ayuda de su madre la Seora Tranquilina B., la misma cuenta con un comercio en el mercado de abasto de la Ciudad de Villarrica, quien a la vez firma el crdito como la codeudor de Sr. Ronal.
Solicit dicho prstamo a Fundacin Paraguaya para la compra al por mayor de (arroz, azcar, fideos, etc.) para su almacn.
texts.en:
Mr. Ronald D. is 24-years-old. He's single and has no children. He has a shop in his home which is very well known in the area of Villarrica. He began his business more than a year ago with the help of his mother, Mrs. Tranquilina B., who has a business in the wholesale food market in Villarrica. She also acts as co-debtor for Ronald. He's asking for this loan from Fundacin Paraguaya to buy rice, sugar, noodles, etc. wholesale for his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of products such as rice, flour, corn, noodles, canned goods, hardware, and dairy products

loan.name: Maria Lida

texts.es:
Maria Lida A. Y., tiene 50 aos. Es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. Tiene 4 hijos, Jesenia (26), Patricia (20), Carlos (25) y Jeny (13).
Maria es una socia de la ventanilla rural la Y, que est ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer prstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San Jos.
Maria se dedica a la agricultura, la siembra de caf y maz. Las compras las realizan cada vez que sale la cosecha en Guayaquil y Babahoyo y vende sus productos en la misma localidad y en los alrededores.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para incrementar la produccin. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos es tener un negocio propio y estable para mejorar su nivel de vida. Enfrenta desafos es la falta de dinero y las enfermedades de la plantacin.
Le gusta trabajar.
texts.en:
Maria Lida A. Y. is 50 years old. She is married, and lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas province of Los Ros. She has 4 children: Jesenia (26), Patricia (20), Carlos (25) and Jeny (13). Maria is a member of the Y rural bank, located 1 hours from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total, who primarily work in agriculture. This is the first loan they are taking through Cooperativa San Jos. Maria dedicates herself to farming, specifically the planting of coffee and corn. She makes her harvest purchases in Guayaquil and Babahoyo, and also sells her products there and in neighboring communities. She is requesting this loan to buy seeds, so she can increase her production. She believes this credit is an opportunity to get ahead. Her dream is to have her own stable business, in order to improve her standard of living. The challenges she faces are lack of funds and diseases of her crops. She very much enjoys working.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: The purchase of seeds to increase production.

loan.name: Jess Andres

texts.es:
Jess Andres P. E., tiene 19 aos. Es soltero, vive con los padres, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. No tiene hijo.
Jess es un socio de la ventanilla rural la Y, que est ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer prstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San Jos.
Jess se dedica al comercio, a la venta de ropa. Las compras las realizan cada mes en Guayaquil y Babahoyo y los vende en la misma localidad en un local de la casa donde vive.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa para incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos es tener un negocio propio y estable para mejorar su nivel de vida. Enfrenta desafos es la falta de dinero y la competencia de la localidad.
Le gusta hacer deporte y trabajar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Jess Andres P. E. is 19 years old. He is single and lives in Ventanas in the province of Los Ros. He has no children. Jess is a member of the rural bank Y, which is located an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total, and most of them work in agriculture. This is the first loan they have taken out with the San Jos Cooperative. Jess works selling clothes. He makes the purchases every month in Guayaquil and Babahoyo and sells them in a locale in the house he lives in. He is asking for a loan to invest in purchasing clothes to grow his business. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have his own stable business to improve his quality of life. His challenges are the lack of money and the competition in the area. He likes sports and working in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To invest in purchasing clothes to grow his business

loan.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati K. is 32 and married with two children aged 14 and 10. In 2008, she established her poultry business. Working 6 days a week, 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received, and successfully repaid, 8 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to purchase chicks. In the future, Saraswati plans to send her children to private school. She thanks you for your support.
In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.
This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loan.use: purchase chicks

loan.name: German Alberto

texts.es:
German Alberto E. S., tiene 46 aos. Es soltero, vive con la madre, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. Tiene 1hijo, Niurka (6 aos).
German es un socio de la ventanilla rural la Y, que est ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer prstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San Jos.
German se dedica al comercio, a la venta de banano. Las compras las realizan cada mes en Guayaquil y Babahoyo y los vende en la misma localidad en un local de la casa donde vive.
Solicita el prstamo para incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos es tener un negocio propio y estable para mejorar su nivel de vida. Enfrenta desafos es la falta de dinero y la competencia de la localidad.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
German Alberto E. S. is 46 years old. He is single and lives with his mother in Ventanas in the province of Los Ros. He has one son, Niurka (6 years old). German is a member of the rural bank Y, located an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total, and most of them work in agriculture. This is the first loan that they have taken out with the San Jos Cooperative. German sells bananas. He makes the purchases every month in Guayaquil and Babahoyo and he sells them in a locale in the house he lives in. He is asking for the loan to grow his business. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have his own stable business to increase his quailty of life. His challenges are the lack of money and the competition in the area. He likes sports.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To grow his business

loan.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 29 years old and married with two children who are 1 and 3 years old. Beatrice is in the business of selling Irish potatoes and this is her second successful year in this business. The business hours are from 7 am to 4 pm every day.
Beatrice, after realizing that her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully to satisfy her customers, needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. With the use of this loan, Beatrice will increase her sales as well as profits. With these profits, Beatrice will keep reinvesting in her business for better growth until she becomes a wholesaler to the retailers from her environmental area.

loan.use: To purchase a large quantity of Irish potatoes

loan.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
This is 22-year-old Laxmi Gautam. She is married and has no children. In 2010, she established her poultry business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family.
She has already received and successfully repaid loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to purchase chicks. In the future, Laxmi plans to earn her own livelihood. She thanks you for your support.
In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open-air markets throughout the valley.
This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business-training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: http://www.kiva.org/partners/62

loan.use: Purchase chicks

loan.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 48 aos, es viuda y vive con el menor de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 8 aos tiene su tienda, ubicada en su misma casa, en donde sus hijas la apoyan en la atencin, por lo que diariamente trabaja, descansando solo los domingos. Procura siempre que su tienda est siempre abastecida con la mayor variedad de productos, ya que de eso depende de que sus clientes retornen nuevamente a comprar y eso es lo que le agrada de su trabajo. Tambin disfruta ser independiente en sus ingresos, es por ello que se ha propuesto la meta de crecer en su negocio y tener a futuro una tienda amplia. Es su doceavo crdito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, adems le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece aquellas personas que sern gestoras del prstamo que solicita y le ser muy til en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crdito que solicita, invertir en la compra de ms productos de primera necesidad en su tienda.
texts.en:
Vilma, 48, is widowed and lives with the youngest of her three children in her own home. For the past 8 years she has had a store located in her home, where her daughters help her so that she is able to work daily, resting only on Sundays. She tries to always keep her store stocked with a wide variety of products since whether customers return again to shop depends on this. This is what she likes about her job. She also enjoys being independent in her income, which is why she has set the goal of growing her business and having a large store in the future. This is Vilmas twelfth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is very happy to know that she has financial support since she has always been responsible with her payments. In addition, she likes to be part of her community group because all of its members are responsible and very supportive. She thanks those that will be managing the loan that she requests. It will be very helpful to the progress of her business. With the loan that she requests, she will invest in the purchase of more staples for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of staples

loan.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es:
Ana Beatriz G. B., tiene 67 aos. Es divorsiada, vive sola, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. Tiene 4 hijos, Margota (43), Beatriz (40), Vernica (33) y Fernando (29).
Ana es una socia de la ventanilla rural la Y, que est ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer prstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San Jos.
Ana se dedica al comercio, a la venta de pollos. Las compras las realizan cada mes en Guayaquil y Babahoyo y los vende en la misma localidad en un local de la casa donde vive.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de pollos para incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos dinero para mejorar su nivel de vida. Enfrenta desafos es la falta de dinero y la competencia de la localidad.
Le gusta leer y trabajar.
texts.en:
Ana is 67 years old. She is divorced and lives alone in Ventanas in the province of Los Ros. She has four children, Margota (43), Beatriz (40), Vernica (33) and Fernando (29). Ana is a member of the Y rural bank, located an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total, the majority of whom work in agriculture. This is the first loan that they are taking with Cooperativa San Jos. Ana works in trade, selling chickens. She makes purchases every month in Guayaquil and Babahoyo and sells her products in the these cities and in room in the house where she lives. She requests this loan in order to invest in the purchase of chickens to grow her business. She believes that this loan is an opportunity to get ahead. She dreams of money to improve her standard of living. The challenges that she faces include lack of capital and competition in the area. Ana likes to read and to work.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of poultry to grow business

loan.name: Handerson Marcelo

texts.es:
Handerson Marcelo A. E., tiene 22 aos. Es soltero, vive con los padres, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. No tienen hijos.
Handerson es un socio de la ventanilla rural la Y, que est ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer prstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San Jos.
Handerson se dedica a la agricultura, la siembra de caf y maz. Las compras las realizan cada mes en Guayaquil y Babahoyo y los vende en la misma localidad en un local de la casa donde vive.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de semilla de caf y maz para incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos dinero para incrementar la produccin. Enfrenta desafos es la falta de dinero y la variedad del clima las plagas y enfermedades.
Le gusta hacer deporte y trabajar en el campo.
texts.en:
Handerson Marcelo A. E. is 22 years old and single. He lives with his parents in Ventanas in the Los Ros province. He does not have children. Handerson is a member of the Y Communal Bank, which is located an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 17 members in all, and most of them are farmers. This is their first loan from the Cooperativa San Jos. Handerson is a farmer, and he grows coffee and corn. He makes his purchases every month in Guayaquil and Babahoyo. He sells in the same town from a place in his house. He is requesting a loan to buy coffee and corn seeds to increase his business. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. He dreams of having the money to increase his production. He faces challenges; which are the lack of money, the change of climate, pests, and illnesses. He likes to play sports and work in the field.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy coffee and corn seeds to increase his business

loan.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 31 years old and married with four children between 4 and 12 years of age. Angelique owns a small business selling shoes in the Kigali city where it is profitable because most of the people wear shoes. Angelique has 2 years of experience in her business. Angelique employs one person from her community as a helper so that her business runs well. The hours of her shop are from 7 in the morning to 7 in the evening every day.
Angelique is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more shoes for sale. With this expansion, Angelique will be able to attract more customers, which will allow her to earn more profit.

loan.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loan.name: Jaqueline

texts.en:
Jaqueline was born in 1970. She is married with two children. One of the children is 13 years old, and one is 9 years old. Jaqueline owns a business selling various products in Kigali city. She has seven years of experience in her business. Jaqueline employs one person from her community as a helper.
Jaqueline is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing large quantities so that her business satisfies everybody. The profit that Jaqueline expects to earn will allow her to save money for the future.

loan.use: To purchase large quantities to products to sell

loan.name: Habinshuti

texts.en:
Habinshuti was born in 1982 and he is single. Habinshuti lives with his parents and he has to contribute to his home. Habinshuti is one of the family members who is old enough to provide some of the needs of the family. Habinshuti owns a small business selling bed sheets and other products in Kigali city. This business is well organized and profitable because he gets what he needs from this business. Habinshuti has two years of experience in his business and he employs one person from his community as a helper. The shop hours are from 7 in the morning to 5 in the evening every day except on Saturday.
Habinshuti is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business. Once his business expands his monthly profit will increase, which will allow him to buy land where he will build his own house so that he can get married.

loan.use: To purchase more bed sheets and other products

loan.name: Anitha

texts.en:
Anitha is 31 years old and married with two children. One child is 6 years old and the other one is 4 years old. Anitha owns a small business selling shoes in Kigali city. Her business is profitable and known in the city. Anitha has one year of experience in her business. Her shop is open from 7 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day except on Saturday.
Now, Anitha is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing a large quantity of shoes. This loan will help her to earn more profits, which will allow her to save money for her future.

loan.use: To buy a large quantity of shoes

loan.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 34 years old and married with three children. The first one is 14 years old, the next is 6 years old and the last is 3 years old. Nelly is a businesswoman as is her husband. This family is serious about her daily activities. Nelly owns a small business selling shoes. Nelly employs one person from her community and the hours of her shop are from 7 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day except on Saturday. Nelly has one year of experience in her business.
Nelly is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more shoes to sell. This loan will help Nelly satisfy her customers, which is one way to earn more profits.

loan.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loan.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Clarisse is 27 years old and single. Clarisse lives with her parents, where she has some responsibilities at home. Clarisse has to contribute in her family to provide all their needs. Clarisse owns a business selling eggs. This business is profitable. Clarisse works hard and she works every day except on Saturday.
Clarisse is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing large quantities of eggs. With this loan, Clarisse will be able to earn more profit, which will allow her to save money for her future.

loan.use: To purchase a large quantity of eggs

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Buy construction materials

loan.name: Oscar Ivan

texts.es:
Oscar Ivan E. L., tiene 32 aos. Es soltero, vive con los padres, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ros. Tienen 2 hijos.
Oscar es un socio de la ventanilla rural la Y, que est ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer prstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San Jos.
Oscar se dedica a la agricultura, la siembra de caf y maz. Las compras las realizan cada mes en Guayaquil y Babahoyo y los vende en la misma localidad en un local de la casa donde vive.
Solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de semilla de caf y maz para incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crdito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueos dinero para incrementar la produccin. Enfrenta desafos es la falta de dinero y la variedad del clima las plagas y enfermedades.
Le gusta hacer deporte y criar animales.
texts.en:
Oscar Ivan E. L. is 32 years old and single. He lives with his parents in Ventanas in the Los Ris province. He has two children. Oscar is a member of the Y Communal Bank, which is one and half hours from Ventanas. There are 17 members in all, and most of them are farmers. This is their first loan with Cooprativa San Jos. Oscar is a farmer, and he plants coffee and corn. He makes his monthly purchases in Guayaquil and Babahoyo. He sells in the same town in a place in his house. He is requesting a loan to buy coffee and corn seeds in order to increase his business. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have the money to increase his production. He faces challenges; which are lack of money, the change in climate, pests, and illnesses. He likes to play sports and raise animals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy coffee and corn seeds to increase his business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Buying supplies for preparing ice cream and paying the vendors for their work

loan.name: Juntos Para El Exito Group

texts.es: Organizacin y responsabilidad es lo que caracteriza a L. Alcanca "Comunal Juntos para el xito", ahora lo conforman 12 socios que cursan el segundo ciclo. L. Presidenta Mnica se dedica al rubro D. L. venta D. prendas D. vestir (reparte sobre pedidos), desD. hace tres aos y seis meses, es algo que le gusta hacer, aunque elL. nos manifiesta que este ao no ha tenido muchas ventas en comparacin con el ao pasado pero eso no L. desanima ya que siempre busca las circunstancias para poder ofrecer sus productos, ya piensa en el bienestar D. sus hijos, se inicio en este negocio ya que tuvo L. oportunidad D. juntar unos ahorros gracias al trabajo D. vendedora al cual se dedicaba anteriormente. Con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria ha logrado comprar un televisor y un equipo D. sonido, su gran sueo es tener una tienda propia. El reciente prstamo ser destinado para L. compra D. mercadera. Los socios estn conformes con el crdito y desean continuar trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD.
texts.en:
Organization and responsibility are what characterize the Juntos para el xito (Together for Success) communal bank which has 12 members currently in its second cycle. Group president, Mnica, sells clothing based on prior orders. She has been in this line of work for three and a half years. This is something she enjoys doing although she tells us that this year sales have been less compared to last year. However, this doesnt discourage her because she always looks for sales opportunities for her products because shes always thinking of her childrens wellbeing. She started out in this business when she had the opportunity to save a bit of money from her previous sales job. With her daily effort she has managed to purchase a television set and a sound system. Her great dream is to own her own house. The current loan will be used to buy stock merchandise. The group members are satisfied with the loan and wish to continue to collaborate with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy clothing.

loan.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther tiene 56 aos, vive con su hija en su casa propia. Vende comida desde hace 4 aos, desde entonces cocina todas las maanas en su casa y los lleva al centro educativo que queda cerca de su casa, en donde los profesores y alumnos son los que consumen su deliciosa sazn. Es as que se genera los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su hija. Siempre disfruta de su trabajo porque le gusta cocinar, adems que le ayuda cubrir los gastos educativos de su hija, que ya es universitaria. Afirma que este negocio es rentable y siempre esta dispuesta a continuar trabajando, en adelante desea tener un restaurante grande. Es su quinto crdito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, adems le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que sern gestoras del prstamo que solicita y le ser muy til en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crdito que solicita, invertir en la compra de ingredientes no perecibles para la preparacin de sus alimentos como arroz por sacos, menestras, azcar y fideos.
texts.en:
Esther is 56 and lives with her daughter in her own home. She's been selling food for the past 4 years. Every morning since then she cooks at home and then takes it to a nearby school where teachers and students enjoy her delicious food. This is how she makes a living to support her daughter. She enjoys her work because she likes to cook and because it helps pay for her daughter's university education. She says the business is profitable and she is willing to keep working, hoping to have a large restaurant in the future. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she is very happy to know she has financial support. She has always been punctual with her payments and is happy to be a part of the community group since all the other members are responsible and supportive. She is thankful to all those people who will help with the loan since it will be very useful for her business. She will use the loan to buy basic ingredients for her food such as: rice in bulk, vegetable stew sugar and noodles.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase ingredients for food preparation

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy replacement parts for his truck.

loan.name: Dolores Alexandra

texts.es:
Dolores de 33 aos, vive en el Fortn de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas), ella tiene una tienda de vveres llamada "3 hermanos" en donde vende legumbres, enlatados, canes etc.
Ella tiene la tienda desde que se separo de su esposo para poder conseguir sus propios ingresos, comenz comprando verduras y vegetales. Desde ese tiempo ella a continuado trabajando para mantener a sus dos hijos de 1 y 9 aos, vendiendo toda clase de vveres. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los das.
