Para poder incrementar su mercadera ella quiere comprar con el prstamo arroz, azcar, lcteos. En el futuro quiere ampliar y surtir mas su tienda para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dolores, age 33, lives in Fortn de Guayaquil (a mountainous periuban area with dirt roads and hills). She has a grocery store called 3 Hermanos (3 Siblings) where she sells vegetables, canned goods, and meats, etc. She has had the store since she separated from her husband. She did this to be able to have her own income. She started buying greens and vegetables. From that time on she continues working to support her two children, a one year old and a nine year old. She sells all kinds of groceries. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. everyday. She wants to use the loan to be able to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, and dairy products. In the future she wants to expand her store and stock it more. She wants to do so in order to give her children a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Rice, sugar, and dairy products

loan.name: Denise Delhia

texts.fr: C. Denise Delhia est ne le 09 Octobre 1961 Cotonou, capitale conomique du Bnin. Marie NADOHOU Steeve, Denise Delhia est mre de deux enfants, tous scolariss. Denise Delhia s'est installe depuis une vingtaine d'anne au quartier Agla Cotonou, o elle rside avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux diffrents besoins de la famille. Denise Delhia a arrt l'cole au cours secondaire. Depuis cinq ans, Denise Delhia vend divers produits (sucre, lait, piles, papier hyginique, vinaigre, charbon de bois, etc.) et de faon secondaire, Denise Delhia vend des vtements dans sa boutique. C'est Dantokpa, march international du Bnin, et Lom, pays voisin du Bnin, que Denise Delhia achte ses produits. Denise Delhia est une ancienne cliente de ALID, ayant obtenu deux crdits qui ont t tous bien rembourss. Face la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientle, Denise Delhia souhaite agrandir son activit et mieux satisfaire ses clients ; raison pour laquelle Denise Delhia sollicite un troisime prt.
texts.en:
Denise Delhia C. was born 9 October 1961 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Steeve Nadohou, Denise Delhi is mother of two children, both attending (or having attended) school. She settled some 20 years ago in the Agla borough of Cotonou, where she resides with her husband and children. The couple share family expenses. Denise Delhia interrupted her schooling at secondary level. For the past five years she has retailed various products (sugar, milk, batteries, toilet paper, vinegar, charcoal, etc.), and as a side business, she sells clothing in her shop. She gets her products from Dantokpa, Benins international marketplace, and from Lom in a country neighboring Benin. Denise Delhia is a regular ALID client, having been granted two previous loans, both reimbursed in full. Facing increasing customer demand, she wishes to expand her activity and improve customer satisfaction, which is why she is requesting a third loan.

Translated from French by Ren McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy 3 cartons of sugar, milk, batteries and clothing

loan.name: Odette

texts.fr: M. Odette est ne le 15 Mai 1981 Adja au Mono. Marie SIDI Basile, un militaire, Odette est mre de deux enfants qui sont tous scolariss. Odette vit depuis trois ans avec son mari et ses enfants Cocotomey, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Odette vient en aide son mari en assurant avec lui les diffrentes charges familiales. N'ayant jamais frquent l'cole, Odette mne comme activit la vente de mas en gros et en dtail son domicile et par le systme de distribution. Odette s'approvisionne Adja au Mono. C'est la deuxime fois que Odette sollicite l'appui financier de ALID, afin de renforcer son activit et de mieux rpondre la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientle. Odette a bien effectu le remboursement du premier prt. Plus tard, Odette dsire ouvrir une baraque et y vendre ses produits.
texts.en:
Odette M. was born 15 May 1981 in Adja, Mono (a region of Benin). Married to Basile Sidi, a serviceman, she is the mother of two children, both in school. Odette has been living for the past three years in Cocotomey, part of the Abomey Calavi municipality. She assists her husband in sharing family expenses. Having never attended school, Odettes commercial activity is selling corn (wholesale and retail) from her home and through the distribution system. She gets her supplies from Adja in Mono. This is the second time Odette has approached ALID for financial support, to strengthen her activity and better respond to increasing customer demand. She fully reimbursed the first loan. At some point Odette wants to open a stall to sell her products.

Translated from French by Ren McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy 10 bags of corn

loan.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres en Accin actualmente se encuentra en el XVI ciclo y est conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta das en la casa de la socia Benedicta que est ubicado en la comunidad de Compone, Anta. La comunidad de Componte se encuentra a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. La mayora de los pobladores se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadera.
Benedicta, tiene 35 aos y tiene dos hijos, ella naci y vive en la comunidad de Compone del distrito de Izcuchaca provincia de Anta. Hace dos aos atrs, Benedicta abri una tienda de abarrotes, en su domicilio, donde venda comestibles a sus vecinos. Tambin venda maz, papa, chicha de jora, yogurt y queso y lL. sus productos a vender a la ciudad del Cusco.
Ahora, Benedicta cambio de negocio y se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes. Utilizo el pequeo capital que tena para capacitarse en la crianza de animales, para construir un pequeo galpn y empez a criar 7 cuyes. En la actualidad tiene 15 cuyes y le estan capacitando los especialistas de la municipalidad de Anta.
Con su prximo prstamo, Benedicta espera recibir S/. 1000 soles. Por el momento, su galpn esta modestamente de implementado con las necesidades bsicas. Le gustara emplear el dinero para sembrar pasto en su chacra que esta a lado de su domicilio: El pasto es un buen alimento para los cuyes. El sueo de la socia es convertirse en una empresaria en el comercio de venta y crianza de animales de menores.
Benedicta es una de las socias fundadoras del banco comunal y la escogieron como la presidenta porque es una persona puntual y responsable. Ya son tres veces que est en el cargo y le va muy bien gracias al carisma y buena voluntad que tiene.
texts.en:
The Mujeres en Accin (Women in Action) Communal Bank is currently in its 16th cycle. It is comprised of hard-working and enterprising people who always look for opportunities to get ahead. With their daily effort they are looking to give their children a better future. The communal banks meetings are every 30 days. They meet in Benedictas house. She is a member, and her house is located in the Compone community in Anta. The Componte community is 45 minutes from the city of Cusco. Most of the inhabitants work in agriculture and with livestock. Benedicta is 35 years old, and she has two children. She was born in and lives in the Compone community in the Izcuchca district, Anta province. Two years ago Benedicta opened a grocery store in her home, and she sold food to her neighbors. She also sold corn, potatoes, chicha de jora (a traditional beverage of the area that is made of corn), yogurt, and cheese. She took her products to the city of Cusco to sell. Now Benedicta has changed businesses. She raises small animals like guinea pigs. She used the small amount of capital that she had to prepare to raise animals and to build a small shed. She started raising seven guinea pigs. She currently has 15 guinea pigs. The specialists in the Anta municipality are training her. The next loan that Benedicta hopes to receive is for 1,000 soles. At the present time the shed is modestly set up with the basic necessities. She would like to use the money to plant grass on her farm, which is at the side of her house. Grass is good food for the guinea pigs. Benedictas dream is to become an entrepreneur in the business of raising and selling small animals. Benedicta is a founding member of the communal bank. They chose her to be the president because she is a punctual and responsible person. She has had this position three times. It is going very well thanks to the charisma and good will that she has.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To plant grass on her farm

loan.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar tiene 24 aos, vive en casa de sus padres, en compaa de su madre y sus hermanos. Desde hace 3 aos decidi emprender su propia fuente de ingresos, en un inicio fue en un local que arrend en una calle comercial de su ciudad, tuvo su primer negocio, pero fue victima de robo, ante esto le motivaron a establecer su negocio en casa de sus padres. Desde entonces atiende en su establecimiento, dando el servicio de llamadas a celular con un maquina que calcula el tiempo y la tarifa que se utiliz en ese tiempo de llamada. Por otro lado su negocio lo complementa con la venta de golosinas y algunos artculos de bazar como regalos y detalles para el arreglo personal, de esta manera su negocio este ms surtido y atractivo para su clientela. Afirma que le gusta trabajar de manera independiente porque puede disponer de su dinero y es por esta razn que esta planeando adquirir mejores equipos pasa su negocio. Es su primer crdito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, adems le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que sern gestoras del prstamo que solicita y le ser muy til en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crdito que solicita, invertir en la compra de un maquina ms actual y electrnica que le permitir tener un control ms exacto en el costo de las llamadas que realicen sus clientes.
texts.en:
Pilar, 24, lives in her parents house with her mother and siblings. Three years ago she decided to start her own business to generate her own income. At the beginning, she rented a space in one of the citys commercial streets. She had her first business there but was robbed. This motivated her to move her business to her parents house. Since then, she has tended to her business there. Her business consists in offering cell phone calls using a machine that calculates call duration and charges. In addition, she also sells snacks and some general merchandise like gift items and items of personal adornment. This makes her business better stocked and more attractive to her customers. She states that she enjoys working independently because she can dispose of her income. She is planning, therefore, to acquire better equipment for her business. This is her first loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she can count on financial support. In addition, she enjoys team work because all her fellow group members are responsible and unified people. She is grateful to all those who will fund the loan which will be very useful to her business. She will use the requested funds to buy a more up-to-date, electronic machine that will allow her to have better control over the costs of calls placed by her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy a new machine in order to have improved ability to calculate customer call charges.

loan.name: Rolando Francisco

texts.es:
Rolando de 43 aos, vive en el Fortn de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas), tiene un puesto de venta de pollos en un mercado de Fortn.
Empez hace 15 aos en (1995) en un pueblo llamado Balzar (habitan agricultores), el compraba los pollos y se encargaba de matarlos y pelarlos, los venda en el pueblo, pero como quera mas ingresos decidi vivir en Guayaquil y comenzar con su negocio en un mercado, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener su propio puesto y ahora vende pollos por libra, se levanta a las 05h00am a faenar los pollos.
Con el prstamo quiere comprar gavetas, pollos, un congelador. En el futuro quiere tener un local y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Rolando is 43 years old and lives in the Fortn neighborhood of Guayaquil. It is on the hilly outskirts of the city and has dirt roads. He has a stand in the Fortn market where he sells chickens. He started this business 15 years ago in a rural town called Balzar. He would buy chickens and slaughter and pluck them before selling them around town. However, he decided that he wanted to earn more profits, so he moved to Guayaquil and began his business in the market. Little by little through his hard work he was able to buy his own stand and now he sells chicken by the pound. He wakes up at 5:00 a.m. to prepare the chickens. With the loan he will purchase drawers for his stand, chickens, and a freezer. In the future he hopes to have his own store and make improvements on his house.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of drawers, chickens, and a freezer

loan.name: Sika Opportune Clarisse

texts.fr: A. Sika Opportune Clarisse est ne le 09 Aot 1976 Cotonou, capitale conomique du Bnin. Opportune Clarisse est mre de deux enfants, tous scolariss et qui sont tous sa charge. Opportune Clarisse n'est plus avec son mari. Depuis une vingtaine d'anne, Opportune Clarisse vit Cocotomey, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Opportune Clarisse vit ensemble avec ses enfants et assure leurs diffrentes charges. Opportune Clarisse n'a frquent que l'cole primaire. Pour faire face ses charges, Opportune Clarisse est grante d'une cabine tlphonique, o elle vend en plus, des cartes de recharges tlphoniques. Opportune Clarisse s'approvisionne dans une maison GSM Cococodji. Opportune Clarisse exerce cette activit depuis cinq ans. C'est la deuxime fois que Opportune Clarisse sollicite auprs de ALID un appui financier, en vue d'lever le niveau de son activit et d'accrotre son revenu. Le premier crdit a t bien rembours.
texts.en:
Sika Opportune Clarisse A. was born August 9, 1976 in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. She is the mother of two children in her care, and both in school. She is no longer with her husband. For the past twenty years or so, Opportune Clarisse has been living in Cocotomey, in the commune of Abomey Calavi. She lives with her children and provides for their needs. Opportune Clarisse only attended primary school. To meet her expenses, she runs a telephone booth and sells mobile phone recharge cards. She gets her stocks at a GSM branch in Cococodji. Opportune Clarisse has been carrying on this activity for five years. She is seeking financial assistance from ALID for the second time to boost her activity and increase her income. The first loan was repaid without incident.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase mobile phone recharge cards

loan.name: Placida

texts.es: Placida tiene 44 aos, vive con su esposo y su hija en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 aos se dedica a la elaboracin de bellos bordados en su misma casa, que junto a su hija la ayuda en esta tarea. Juntas producen bellos y coloridas prendas de vestir que luego son ofrecidas a los clientes. Con el paso del tiempo se ha vuelto una persona reconocida en la produccin de bordados, quien ahora tiene clientes que proviene de diversos sitios que la buscan para comprarle su mercadera. Considera que esto es un gran logro adems de que este trabajo tiene una buena recompensa. Adicionalmente a esta actividad los fines de semana vende zapatos recompuestos a precio de segunda mano y esto tambin le genera las ganancias. Ante esto desea mejorar su produccin de bordados para tener mayor capital y una tienda de zapatos y prendas tpicas. Es su primer crdito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, adems le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que sern gestoras del prstamo que solicita y le ser muy til en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crdito que recibir, invertir en la compra de materiales para sus bordados como tela pana e hilos de diversos colores y calidades.
texts.en:
Placida is 44 and lives with her husband and daughter in their own home. For the past 15 years she has made beautiful embroideries from home with her daughter's help. Together the produce beautiful and colorful dress clothing that is then offered to customers. Over the years she has become well known as an embroiderer and is sought by buyers from various places. She feels this is a great achievement aside from the fact that the work is lucrative. Additionally, she sells repaired second hand shoes on weekends which also generates income. She hopes to increase her embroidery production and have greater working capital, as well as a shoe and typical clothing store. This is her first loan with MFP and she is happy to know she has financial backing. She is also happy to be a part of the community bank because all the members are responsible and supportive. She's thankful to all the people helping with the loan since it will be helpful to the business. She will invest the loan in the purchase of embroidery material such as corduroy, and thread in various color and quality.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase fabric for embroideries

loan.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 44 years old and married with eight children who are between 7 and 24 years old. Of her older children, one is a money collector on a bus and another is a tailor. She is unable to afford school fees for her children who are of school age. Her husband works for a church and earns a small income. In addition to her children, Asia supports orphans and elderly people in her family.
Asia has a hair salon where she cuts and styles hair. She plans to use the loan to start a shop that sells milk, soft drinks and snacks. With the profits she hopes to buy a sewing machine to support her child who is a tailor.
Asia attributes the success of her business to the fact that she is social and hardworking, which her clients appreciate. Eventually, she hopes to make enough money to have a small cattle and chicken farm.

loan.use: To start a shop that sells milk, soft drinks and snacks

loan.name: Mahutin Gilles

texts.fr: A. Mahutin Gilles est n le 21 Juillet 1973 Cotonou, capitale conomique du Bnin. Gilles vit depuis une trentaine d'anne Lokokoukoum, dans la commune de Sm-Podji. Gilles est mari YEHOSSOU Armelle, une commerante. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolariss. Gilles vit ensemble avec sa famille Lokokoukoum. Gilles a arrt l'cole au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir aux diffrents besoins de ses enfants et faire face ses charges, Gilles vend des racines et plantes mdicinales dans sa boutique. Gilles s'approvisionne Dantokpa, march international du Bnin. Gilles exerce cette activit depuis seize ans et a dj bnfici de deux crdits auprs de ALID, crdits qu'il a bien rembourss. Gilles dsire agrandir plus son activit et mieux rpondre aux diffrentes exigences de sa clientle ; raison pour laquelle Gilles sollicite un troisime prt.
texts.en:
Mahutin Gilles A. was born on 21st July 1973 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Gilles has lived for around thirty years in Lokokoukoum, in the municipality of Sm-Podji. He is married to Armelle Yehossou, a trader. The couple has four children who are all at school. Gilles lives with his family in Lokokoukoum. He left school at secondary level. In order to provide for the various needs of his children and to cover his expenses, Gilles sells medicinal roots and plants in his shop. He gets his supplies at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. He has been carrying out this activity for the past sixteen years and has already had two loans from ALID, both of which he repaid in full. Gilles would like to expand his business and respond better to the various demands of his customers; for this reason he is requesting a third loan.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of medicinal leaves, plants and bark

loan.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 32 years old and pregnant with her first child. She and her husband have a stand in the local market and a shop in their neighborhood, both of which carry general household items such as salt, sugar, and matches as well as a variety of flours, including millet and maize. Their clients appreciate this variety of products which Marie and her husband are able to acquire more cheaply when purchased in quantity, allowing them to earn profits in both of their two locations. Marie is requesting this loan to increase the number of items she sells, including different flours and charcoal. Eventually she hopes to buy land and build a house for her family.

loan.use: To purchase items to sell in her store

loan.name: Marie Claudine

texts.en:
Marie Claudine is 32 years old and married with two children, one of whom is four years old and attending school, while the other is only 6 months old. She and her husband, a veterinarian, both work hard to improve their family's standard of living.

Marie Claudine sells fertilizers for a variety of plants including wheat, carrots, and some fruits. She has been in this business for over five years and plans to use this loan to expand the types of fertilizers she carries, including fertilizers for cabbage. She also plans to buy seeds and insecticides to sell to local farmers. The seeds Marie Claudine will purchase are sealed in tin cans and last for a long time. With the profits she hopes to purchase a cow to ensure a constant supply of milk for her family, and eventually she anticipates buying a house so she no longer has to rent.

loan.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides to sell

loan.name: Gaudence

texts.en:
Gaudence has a boutique where she sells cosmetics and general household items such as candy, matches, and biscuits. She also has a small bar located on the side of the boutique where she serves drinks. Gaudence believes her business is successful because she sells a variety of items and her shop is the only one of its kind in the area. Her aspiration is to expand her shop to six times its current size after another year of operation. With the profits from her enterprise, Gaudence eventually hopes to open a restaurant.

Gaudence is a 28-year-old mother of an eight-month-old child. Her husband works in a bank.

loan.use: To purchase items for her general store

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 50 aos, vive con su pareja y sus 2 hijas en casa de su hija mayor. Desde hace 8 aos se dedica a vender quesos y dems productos alimenticios como trucha y maz seco a las diferentes zonas urbanas de la ciudad donde radica. Lleva sus productos en baldes bien hermtico que le ayudan a mantener en buen estado sus productos, en cuanto al queso, para abastecerse de este producto ella misma los prepara cuando va de viaje a su pueblo natal en donde consigue leche de vaca y por el lapso de 3 das vuelve a su rutina de siempre. Le agrada ejercer este negocio porque considera que su trabajo es mejor compensado cuando vende directamente sus quesos, es por eso que esta pensando a futuro industrializar su forma de fabricar quesos. Es su tercer crdito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, adems le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que sern gestoras del prstamo que solicita y le ser muy til en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crdito que solicita, comprar quesos ya preparados para que pueda incrementar a su propia produccin y cubrir con mayor xito los pedidos que tiene con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa, 50, lives with her life partner and two daughters in her oldest daughters house. For the last 8 years she has sold cheeses and other food items like trout and dry corn in various urban areas of the city where she lives. She transports her items in hermetically sealed tubs that help her keep her products in good condition. With respect to the cheeses, to stock up on them she herself makes them when she goes to her native city to get the cows milk and after three days returns to her usual routine. She enjoys this business because she considers her work to be well compensated when she sells the cheeses directly. For this reason, she is thinking of a way to industrialize her cheese production in the future. This is her 3rd loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she can count on financial help because she has always been responsible with her repayments. In addition, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all of its members are responsible and cooperative people. She is grateful to all the people that will fund the loan shes requesting which will be very useful for her business progress. She will use the requested funds to buy already prepared cheeses to augment her own production so that she can better fill pending customer orders.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy cheeses.

loan.name: Unidas Por Un Futuro Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. SARA TIENE 34 AOS D. EDAD, ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS MENORES. HACE CUATRO MESES ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "UNIDAS POR UN FUTURO", STE GRUPO TIENE 11 INTEGRANTES, LA MAYORA D. ELLOS VIVE EN EL DISTRITO D. COMAS UBICADO AL NORTE D. LIMA. SUS COMPAEROS LA ELIGIERON COMO PRESIDENTA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
LA SRA. SARA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. ANTICUCHOS, TODAS LAS NOCHES UBICA SUS MESITAS Y PARRILA EN LA PUERTA D. SU DOMICILI0. INICI VENDIENDO TAMALES, ARROZ CON LECHE Y MAZAMORRA, LA GANANCIA QUE TENA LO JUNT PARA PODER ADQUIRIR UNA PEQUEA PARRILLA CON LA CUAL INICIA SU NEGOCIO D. VENTA D. ANTICUCHOS. CON SU TRABAJO HA PODIDO APOYAR A SUS HIJOS EN GASTOS ESCOLARES COMO LOS TILES Y PAGO DEL COLEGIO.
ELLA TRABAJA CON LA META D. AHORRAR PARA LOS GASTOS UNIVERSITARIOS D. SUS HIJOS EN UN FUTURO CUANDO ELLOS TERMINEN EL COLEGIO.
EL PRSTAMO SOLICITADO LO UTILIZAR PARA LA COMPRA D. INSUMOS, INGREDIENTES, UTENSILIOS Y DESCARTABLES PARA IMPLEMENTAR SU NEGOCIO D. VENTA D. ANTOCUCHOS.
texts.en:
Sara, 34, is married and has three minor children. She has been a member of the "UNIDAS POR UN FUTURO" (United for a Future) group for the past 4 months. The group has 11 members most of whom live in the Comas district north of Lima. Her fellow group members elected her president of the groups governing board. Sara sells anticuchos (skewered, grilled beef heart) nightly. She sets up her grill and tables in her front yard. She started out selling tamales, rice pudding and bread pudding. With profits from this she bought a small grill with which she started her anticucho sales. Her work has maD. it possible for her to pay for her childrens school expenses like tuition and school supplies. She works with the goal in mind to save up for her childrens future university costs once they finish high school. She will use the requested funds to buy ingredients, supplies and disposable utensils to set up her anticucho sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy inredients and supplies for her Anticucho sales business.

loan.name: Marceline

texts.en: Marceline is 25 years old, single, and doesn't have any children. She owns a retail store where she sells household items. She prides herself on having an accurate scale for weighing products. With her business profits, Marceline has been able to afford healthcare for herself. She is taking out a loan to buy more household items for her store. Eventually, she hopes to be able to buy larger quantities of goods and become a wholesale store, selling to local retail shops.

loan.use: To buy household items for her store

loan.name: Dianne

texts.en:
Dianne is 28 years old, married, and has two children, aged 4 and 6, both of whom are in school. Her husband is a businessman and they are able to afford health insurance for the entire family.
Dianne sells used clothing in the local market and has been in this business for the past ten years. Her business has become well known for selling high quality clothing for children and women. Dianne sells at lower prices than the other clothing sellers in the market. With her loan she hopes to increase her inventory of children's and womens clothing. Eventually, she hopes to attract customers from Kigali, the capital city, to her store.

loan.use: To buy women's and children's clothes

loan.name: Anique Claudine

texts.fr: SALAKO Anique Claudine est ne le 19 Novembre 1958 Parakou dans le Nord du Bnin. Claudine vit au quartier K. Cotonou, capitale conomique du Bnin, depuis trente ans. Claudine est marie HOUNGUE Dominique et est mre de quatre enfants, tous scolariss, et dont un est sa charge. Claudine vient en aide son mari et assure avec lui les charges familiales. Claudine a trs peu frquent l'cole. Pour subvenir ses besoins, Claudine vend du charbon de bois et des bois de chauffage son domicile. De faon secondaire, Claudine vend galement des sous-vtements et de la glace. Claudine achte ses produits Dantokpa, march international du Bnin, et aussi Lom au Togo. Claudine est une ancienne cliente de ALID, ayant dj obtenu cinq crdits qui ont t tous bien rembourss. Claudine dsire dvelopper davantage son activit et mieux rpondre la demande de sa clientle. C'est pour ce faire que Claudine sollicite un autre crdit.
texts.en:
Anique Claudine Salako was born 19 November 1958 in Parakou in the North of Benin. She has been living in the K. borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for the past 30 years. Claudine is married to Dominique Houngue, and is the mother of four children, all having attended school, and of whom one is still under her care. She assists her husband in taking care of family expenses. Claudine has attended very little school. To meet her needs, she sells charcoal and firewood from her home. As a side business, she also sells underwear and ice. She gets her products from Dantokpa, Benins international marketplace, and also from Lom in nearby Togo. Claudine is a regular ALID client, having already been granted five loans, all of which were fully reimbursed. She wants to expand her business in response to customer demand, which is why she is requesting another loan.

Translated from French by Ren McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy firewood, charcoal and underwear

loan.name: Aimable

texts.en:
Aimable is 26 years old and married, but does not yet have children. He has been selling used clothing in a market for the past seven years. He has been successful because he works hard and the clothes he sells are very different from those offered by his competitors. From the success of his business he has been able to buy health insurance for himself and his wife.
With this loan, Aimable hopes to increase his inventory of clothing. Eventually, he hopes to have a wholesale store and sell to local retailers.

loan.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loan.name: Pablina

texts.es: La Sra. Pablina cuenta con 39 aos est casada con el seor Maximino Benitez, poseen tres hijos una nena en edad escolar y dos varones cursando el secundario. La seora era vendedora de calzados en una tienda durante muchos aos, su marido fue chfer de colectivos, la seora tuvo la idea de abrir su propio negocio con la ayuda de pequeos prstamos consigui dedicarse a la venta de calzados, actualmente alquila tres salones comerciales con 4 empleados, cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes. Le gustara ms adelante comprar para su propio local ya que le va muy bien en las ventas y que sus hijos estudien en la universidad ya que ellos no pudieron por tener que trabajar desde jvenes dedicarse al engorde de ganado. Solicita el prstamo para la compra de zapatos, zapatillas, calzados deportivos, y otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Pablina is 39 years old and married to Sr. Maximino Benitez. They have three children, an infant daughter in nursery school and two sons in secondary school. Pablina has sold shoes from her own store for many years. Her husband was a union taxi driver. She came up with the idea of opening her own business and sought the help of small loans in order to continue selling shoes. She currently rents three commercial locations. Pablina has four employees and several good customers. She would like to get ahead by acquiring her own location. Her sales are doing very well. Pablina has also been raising livestock for fattening since her children were little so that they do not have to find work when they attend university. She is requesting a loan to buy shoes, slippers, athletic footwear, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase shoes, slippers, athletic footwear, and other products

loan.name: Manos Confeccionistas Group

texts.es: GRUPO SOLIDARIO MANOS CONFECCIONISTAS EL GRUPO ESTA FORMADO POR LA SEORA TELMA ILEANA P. B., QUIEN ES LA REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO . SU NEGOCIO ES LA CONFECCON DE BLUSAS DE TELA EN DIFERENTES COLORES . SU MERCADO ES VARIADO Y CUENTA CON LA AYUDA DE SU ESPOSO. TAMBIEN LA SEORA VICENTA GERTRUDIS C. CANEL ES COMPAERA DEL GRUPO VENDIENDO UNICAMENTE BLUSAS DE TELA DE MANERA AMBULANTE. SARA ELIZABETH C. C. TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE BLUSAS DE TELA. ELLAS TIENEN MUCHOS SUEOS Y METAS Y DECEAN LOGRARLOS CON LA AYUDA DE DIOS Y A TRAVEZ DE PODER INVERTIR BIEN EN SUS NEGOCIOS EL PRESTAMO QUE ESTAN SOLICITANDO YA QUE ELLAS MENCIONAN QUE AUNQUE TENGAN MUCHOS PLANES SI NO TIENEN EL CAPITAL SUFICIENTE NO PUEDE HACER MAYOR COSA, ELLAS ESTAN MUY CONTENTAS DE TENER LA OPORTUNIDAD DE QUE KIVA LES APOYE ATRAVEZ DE FAPE.
texts.en:
Sewing Hands Solidarity Group

This group was formed by Sra. Telma Ileana P. B., who is the group representative. Her business involves producing blouses out of fabric in various colors. She has an assortment of inventory and receives help from her husband.

Sra. Vicenta Gertrudis C. Canel is a fellow group member who sells only blouses made of fabric as a street vendor. Sara Elizabeth C. C. also makes blouses out of fabric. They have many dreams and goals that they hope to achieve with the help of God. With the loan they are requesting, they plan to invest well in their businesses. Unless they have sufficient capital, they are not able to do anything. They are glad to have this opportunity to receive Kiva support through FAPE.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase materials for their businesses

location.town: Cantn San Francisco, Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Ped

loan.name: Anibal

texts.es: El Sr. Anibal posee 63 aos esta casado con la seora Maria del Carmen Gaona que es jubilada, cuentan con tres hijos todos mayores de edad. El seor fue sastre durante mucho tiempo, con los ahorros de el y el sueldo de su seora decidieron comprar su primer vehculo, actualmente cuenta con 6 transporte escolar con una buena cantidad de clientes, sus hijos tambin se dedican a lo mismo. Le gustara ms adelante dedicarse al engorde de ganado. Solicit el prestamo para el pago por mantenimiento de vehculo.
texts.en:
Sr. Anibal is 63 years old and married to Sra. Maria del Carmen Gaona, who is retired. They have three adult children.

Anibal worked as a tailor of a long time, but he then bought his first vehicle using his savings and his wifes salary. He currently owns six school buses and has a large number of customers. His children help with running the business.

Anibal would also like to have livestock for fattening in order to get ahead. He is requesting a loan in order to pay for vehicle maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Pay for vehicle maintenance

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: Acquire more inventory

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Purchase clothing & accessories

loan.name: Ana Dalinda

texts.es:
Ana de 56 aos, , vive en el Fortn de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas), ella tiene una papelera en su casa vende bebidas, papelera, cuadernos .(en Ecuador se los llama bazar).
Comenz hace 6 aos con la papelera para poder mantener a su familia, vendiendo cuadernos, plumas y papeles a sus vecinos y conocidos cuando completo el dinero para ubicar su pequea papelera readecuo su casa y la ubico en la parte delantera de su casa ya que hay un colegio cerca de donde vive. Trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 20h00pm todos los das.
Con el prstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, bebidas y vitrinas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere triplicar su mercadera y que su hija de 17 aos termine sus estudios con xito.
texts.en:
Ana is 56 years old and lives in Fortn de Guayaquil (a periurban area with dirt roads and hills). She has a stationery shop in her home where she sells beverages, paper, and notebooks. In Ecuador, this type of business would be called a bazaar.

She started her business six years ago in order to support her family. Ana began selling notebooks, pens, and paper to her neighbors and acquaintances. When she had enough money to set up a small store, she remodeled her house and placed her business in the front part of her home since there is a high school near where she lives. She works from 7:30am to 8pm every day.

With his loan Ana plans to buy notebooks, beverages, and display cabinets for her business. In the future, she hopes to triple her inventory and see her 17 year old daughter successfully finish her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase notebooks, beverages, and display cabinets

loan.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Mara Teresa Y. tiene 36 aos vive con su cnyuge en el municipio de Malambo en el departamento del Atlntico y con sus 4 hijos en las edades de 8 a 16 aos de edad. Desde all se dedica a la venta de pescado y a la comercializacin de mercanca variada, que son sus dos actividades y principales generadoras de ingresos. Mara Teresa es una mujer muy organizada, comenz su actividad de vender pescado, hace 16 aos junto a su cnyuge, ella sala a vender en la calle y a los empleados de un parque industrial llamado PINZA, ubicado en esta poblacin; en ese momento transportaba el pescado en cajas de icopor, sus principales clientes eran sus vecinos, familiares y amigos, y utilizaba el enfriador de su suegra; pero gradualmente la familia fue creciendo y llenndose de otras necesidades. As fu como cuando le hablaron de la Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo, busc el beneficio del crdito de esta organizacin el ao 2004 por un valor de $900.000 COP, all logr darle un impulso a su actividad y luego mediante otro crdito recibi $1,300.000 COP y as mismo el tercero por valor de $1.500.000. COP, y finalmente otro por valor de $1.500.000 COP; todos los invirti con disciplina en su negocio, logrando ahorrar de sus utilidades y comprar un lote y sobre esta base solicit un nuevo crdito simultaneo de mejoramiento de vivienda, con lo que construy su casa y el que ya cancel totalmente. Este es su sexto crdito y con l comprar un enfriador para guardar sus pescados y no pasar trabajo con su refrigeracin y adems para conservarlos; con el resto de dinero comprar mercanca que tiene encargada y una canoa porque Mara Teresa pertenece a una familia de pescadores, su cnyuge participa en la pre cooperativa de pescadores Nuevo Amanecer y pesca en la laguna que est ubicada al lado de las empresas de Malambo. Ellos tenan una canoa que se rompi y necesitan otra, porque en la actualidad compran el pescado a otros pescadores y les sale a un mayor precio. Desde que participa en los programas de la Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo, ha podido tener un capital para seguir negociando, ha mejorado sus condiciones habitacionales y suea con terminar de hacer todas las adecuaciones que requiere una saludable convivencia familiar, para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos. Su mayor desafo es el invierno, que no la deja salir por efecto de los arroyos y se le disminuyen las ventas, por eso su negocio simultneo es la venta de mercanca variada porque encontr su nicho de mercado en los mismos clientes que le compran pescado.
texts.en:
Mara Teresa Y. is 36 years old and lives with her husband in the town of Malambo in the Department of Atlntico. They have four children between the ages of 8 and 16. Mara has two businesses, one selling fish and the other selling general merchandise. Both of these activities are her main sources of income.

Mara Teresa is a very organized woman. She began selling fish with her husband when she was 16 years old. Mara worked as a street merchant, selling to employees who worked at an industrial park called PINZA that was located in her town. At the time, she transported the fish in polystyrene coolers. Her main customers were neighbors, relatives, and friends. She even resorted to borrowing her mother-in-laws refrigerator. As her family slowly grew, so did the number of other needs that she had to fulfill. It was around that time that she talked with Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo about applying for a loan. In 2004, she received a loan from the organization in the amount of 900,000 COP which she used to boost her business. Later she received another loan for 1,300,000 COP, and then a third loan for 1,500,000 COP, and finally an additional loan that was also worth 1,500,000 COP. All of the funds were invested into her business with great discipline. Using the earning she had saved, she was able to buy a plot of land and became eligible to apply for a new loan which she used to build her house. Her housing loan has since been repaid completely.

This is her sixth loan. She will buy a refrigerator where she can store her fish when she is not working. With the rest of the money, she will pay for merchandise that she has ordered and purchase a canoe since she belongs to a family of fishermen. Her husband is a member of the Nuevo Amanecer fishing cooperative and fishes in the lagoon in Malambo, which is near where many businesses are located. They have a canoe that is in disrepair, so they need another one. At the moment, Mara buys her fish from other fishermen and then sells it at a higher price.

Since participating in the programs offered by Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo, Mara has been able to build up enough capital to continue her business and make improvements to her living conditions. She dreams of finishing all of the adjustments she has to make for her family to live a healthy life and for her children to have a secure future. Her greatest challenge occurs in winter when her fish sales decline because she does not go out to sell. With her other business, she is able to sell different merchandise to the same customers who buy fish from her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase a refrigerator for storing fish, a fishing canoe for her husband, and merchandise for her second business

loan.name: Jos Antonio

texts.es: Jos Antonio P. R. de 35 aos de edad, reside en el Cantn San Diego, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, este cantn esta ubicado en una de las playas ms famosas del pas, lugar el cual cuenta con muchos turistas tanto nacionales como internacional. En este lugar esta ubicado el negocio de Jos, el cual es una tienda en la que comercializan diferentes tipos de productos comestibles y agua embotellada, as mismo su esposa le ayuda en el negocio, elaborando pupusas y tortillas, las cuales se venden muy bien. Jos desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, sobretodo contar con mayor cantidad de productos en su tienda, ya que las vacaciones de agosto estn muy cerca y esta es una de las temporadas ms importantes del ao en las cuales la afluencia de personas crece, el ganar ms para estas vacaciones le permitir surtir su negocio mucho ms. A pesar que no poseen hijos, ellos como pareja desean contar con una vida mejor y mucho ms estable en la cual puedan vivir con toda tranquilidad confiados que cuentan con un negocio estable, el cual les provee de todo lo necesario, es por esta razn que Jos solicita un prstamo a Integral y llevar a cabo todo lo mencionado para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Jos Antonio P. R. is 35 years old and resides in Cantn San Diego, which is located in the Department of La Libertad. This canton has one of the most famous beaches in the country where many domestic and international tourists visit. Jos has a store on the beach where he sells different types of food products and bottles of water. His wife helps with running the business by making pupusas and tortillas that sell very well. Jos wants to improve his business by acquiring more products for his store. The August vacation season is approaching and it is an important time of the year when the number of people visiting the area increases. In order to earn as much as he can during this time, Jos wants to restock his business.

Despite not having children, Jos and his wife want to have a better conditions and more stability so that they can live peacefully and have a steady business that provides them everything they need. For this reason, Jos is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can make the necessary improvements to his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase merchandise for his store

location.town: Cantn San Diego, departamento de La Libertad

loan.name: Sope Khadim Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarit SOPE NABY est cr en juin 2010 lors de la scission du Banc Villageois. Il est compos de 11 femmes toutes issues du mme village. Elles se sont organises par affinit et par voisinage.
Madame Nogaye D. debout gauche de la photo, de thioup noir mauve vtue et emmitoufle d'charpe est la responsable du groupe. Elle est marie et mre de 05 enfants.
Elle fait de la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide. Elle achte des gousses d'arachide, les dcortique avant de procder la transformation. Elle vend son produit dans les marchs et domicile.
Avec son prt elle va acheter de l'arachide pour poursuivre son activit de transformation d'huile.
Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans les diffrentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
The Sope Naby solidarity group was created in June 2010 when the Banc Villageois loan group was dissolved. It is made up of 11 women from the same village, who got together through personal affinities and as neighbors. Mrs. Nogaye D., the group responsible, can be seen on the left of the picture, wearing a black and purple thioup and wrapped in a scarf. She is married and the mother of five children. She processes and sells peanut oil. She buys unshelled peanuts, and has them unshelled before processing. She sells her product in local markets and does home delivery. She will use her loan to buy peanuts and continue her oil-processing business. Her objective is to assist her husband in handling the various family expenses.

Translated from French by Ren McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy peanuts

loan.name: Carlos Mauricio

texts.es: Carlos Mauricio P. Z. de 52 aos de edad, es un seor muy trabajador, el cual se dedica a la elaboracin de desayunos, almuerzos, pupusas, tortillas, as como tambin a la venta de jugos, batidos de frutas y sodas. Carlos reside en Antiguo Cuscatln, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de 12, 13 y 7 aos de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. El negocio esta ubicado en Antiguo Cuscatln, cerca de La Universidad Jos Simen Caas, lo cual es un enorme beneficio para l ya que la mayora de estudiantes, prefieren este tipo de negocios, ya que brindan los alimentos a menor precio, as mismo Carlos cuenta con muchos clientes los cuales son empleados de diferentes oficinas las cuales se encuentran alrededor de su negocio, a pesar que l cuenta con una gran competencia, el trata de elaborar lo mejor posible su trabajo para poder contar siempre con sus clientes frecuentes y as mismo que estos lo recomienden con otras personas, Carlos es un hombre muy responsable, amable y dedicado a su trabajo. l solicita un prstamo por medio del cual pueda cotar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para la elaboracin de ms comida y de esta forma ampliar su men, y as mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y con un gran deseo de seguir consumiendo los productos de Carlos, lo cual es de mucha importancia para l y su familia, ya que es la nica fuente de ingresos que poseen.
texts.en:
Carlos Mauricio P. Z., 52, is a hardworking man whose business is making breakfasts, lunches, pupusas (typical Central American food-cornmeal filled with cheese, or pork or beans) tortillas, and he also sells juices, fruit shakes and sodas. Carlos lives in Antiguo Cuscatln with his wife, their three children: 12, 13 and 7 - all students. The business is located in Antiguo Cuscatln near the Jos Simen Caas University. The location is a great benefit because the majority of students like this type of business since food is offered at a lower price. Also Carlos has many customers who are workers in different offices that are found nearby. Despite the fact that there is a lot of competition, he tries to make the best possible food so that he can always count on regular customers and that they will recommend him to others. Carlos is a very responsible and friendly man who is dedicated to his work. He is asking for the loan to have money to be able to buy a greater quantity of the necessary ingredients so that he can make more food, broaden his menu, and thus keep his customers satisfied and continue eating what he sells. This is very important to him and to his family since the business is their only source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy basic ingredients to prepare food

location.town: Antiguo Cuscatln, departamento de La Libertad

loan.name: Khassama Adara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarit KHASSAMA ADARA est cr en juin 2010 lors de la scission du Banc Villageois de TOUB. SERAS. Il est compos de 12 femmes du mme village qui se sont organises par affinit et par voisinage.
Madame NDEYE F., la femme dont le visage est mis en mdaillon en haut gauche de la photo est la responsable du groupe. Elle est ge de 54 ans. Elle est marie et mre de 8 enfants et a la charge de ses deux petits enfants.
Elle fait de l'embouche ovine depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle a acquire une bonne exprience de cette activit.
Son nouveau prt lui permettra d'acheter 05 moutons. Elle les embouchera pendant au moins 5 mois avant de les revendre dans les marchs hebdomadaires de sa localit.
Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille. Elle compte galement renforcer son niveau d'pargne
texts.en:
The Khamassa Adara solidarity group was created in June 2010 when the TouB. Seras Banc Villageois loan group was dissolved. It consists of 12 women from the same village who got together through personal affinities and as neighbors. Mrs. Ndeye F. is responsible for the group: her face is shown in a medallion in the upper left of the picture. She is 54 years old, married, the mother of eight children, and has her two grand-children under her care. She has been fattening sheep for the past five years, and has acquired a solid experience in this activity. Her new loan will enable her to buy five sheep. She will fatten them for at least five months before reselling them at local markets in her area. She assists her husband in taking care of family expenses. She also intends to strengthen her level of savings.

Translated from French by Ren McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy sheep

loan.name: Beatriz Yolanda

texts.es: Beatriz Yolanda L. C. de 41 aos de edad, reside en el municipio de Aguilares, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, en donde se dedica a la venta de jeans para hombres y mujeres, ropa para nios, sandalias, y as mismo cuenta con una pequea tienda de productos perecederos. Ella vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como comerciante y as mismo junto a sus dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar da con da. Beatriz es una persona muy trabajadora, quien desea poder contar con todo lo necesario para ver feliz a su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante por diferentes colonias de Aguilares, as mismo atiende su pequea tienda, al mismo tiempo que se dedica a sus hijos. Beatriz solicita un prstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir ms en la tienda, comprando todo lo necesario para convertirla en un negocio bastante fuerte en el cual pueda realizar una mayor cantidad de ventas y as mismo competir con los otros negocios que estn a su alrededor, de esta mismo forma ella desea poder comprar mayor cantidad de ropa, ya que este es uno de los negocio de los cuales obtiene mayores ganancias, las cuales son muy necesarias en su hogar.
texts.en:
Beatriz Yolanda L. C., age 41, lives in the Aguilares municipality, located in the department of San Salvador, where she sells jeans for women and men, children's clothing, and sandals. She also has a small perishables store. She lives with her husband who works as a merchant, and their two young children, who go to school every day. Beatriz is a very hard-working person, who wants to be able to have everything necessary to see her family happy. She sells clothing traveling to different districts in Aguilares, and also tends to her own store. At the same time, she takes care of her children. Beatriz is requesting a loan with which to invest more in her store, buying all the necessary items to make it a very strong business where she can make more sales and also compete with the other businesses around. She also wants to buy a greater quantity of clothing, since this is the business which makes her the most money, which is very needed at home.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: the purchase of clothing to sell.

loan.name: El Sol Sale Para Todos 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Madelin is the coordinator of her group, El Sol sale para Todos 1, 2 & 3. She makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenge right now is improving her business. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to sew.
Madelin is excited to be taking her 10th loan with Esperanza having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over 6 years, starting with some savings and Esperanza's loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling goods in her cafeteria: a place where people can have snacks like juices, cookies, sandwiches and groceries. She is also a tailor and makes household items like curtains and blankets. She will use the profits to invest in her business. She wants to have a successful business.
This Esperanza associate began working with this group because they were looking for a loan and a friend talked about Esperanza. So, the group from this community joined. Madelin's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loan.use: to buy blankets, bedding, cookies and food for resale

loan.name: Jos David

texts.es: Jos David C. de 47 aos de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulutn, vive junto a sus padres y una pequea sobrina. Jos posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad y productos comestibles como: granos bsicos, productos lcteos, pan, aceite y otros ms los cuales vende por mayor, el negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacin en donde cuenta con muchos clientes, los cuales compran sus productos para surtir negocios ms pequeos. Jos es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo quien se esfuerza mucho por sostener a sus padres y a su sobrina, as como tambin todos los gastos del hogar, sus padres son de edad bastante avanzado pero a pesar de esto le ayudan a atender el negocio, sobre todo en horas pico que hay bastantes clientes. Jos solicita un prstamo con el fin de poder comprar productos nuevos, los cuales an no posee, como tambin comprar productos como harina, aceite, granos bsicos, productos lcteos y otros ms los cuales poseen mayor demanda, esto le permitir percibir mayores ganancias y as mismo mantener estable su negocio.
texts.en:
Jos David C., who is 47, lives in the Usulutn district with his parents and a small niece. Jos has a small store in which he sells basic necessities and food products such as basic grains, dairy products, bread, oil, and other items that he sells wholesale. The business is located in his home, where he has many customers who buy his products to stock smaller businesses. Jos is a person who is very dedicated to his work and who makes a great effort to support his parents and his niece, as well as covering all the household expenses. His parents are of a rather advanced age, but in spite of this they help him tend his business, especially at peak hours when there are a lot of customers. Jos is applying for a loan so that he can buy new products that he still doesn't have and also buy products like flour, oil, basic grains, dairy products, and others items which are in great demand. This will permit him to increase his earnings and at the same time to keep his business steady.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy products that are basic necessities

loan.name: Edelmira

texts.es: Edelmira H. D. P. D. 64 aos D. edad, una seora muy esforzada y trabajadora, posee un puesto en el mercado Central D. San Salvador, en el cual comercializa diferentes productos como: canastas, bolsones, carteras, alcancas D. plsticos, escobas, lazos y otros productos ms. Ella vive en el departamento D. Sonsonate, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante D. productos varios, y as mismo vive junto a su hija la cual se dedica a trabajar para sus gastos personales y aportar un poco a la casa. La seora Edelmira cuenta con 43 aos D. poseer este negocio en el mismo lugar, lo cual la ha hecho muy conocida en el mercado por diferentes personas las cuales son clientes D. ella desD. mucho tiempo atrs. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, ya que las personas la conocen muy bien por ser amable y trabajadora. Edelmira solicita un prstamo para poder comprar ms productos y D. esta forma surtir el negocio con ms escobas, depsitos plsticos para colocar agua, canastas D. mimbre para colocar ropa y otros ms, los cuales en la actualidad son bastante escasos como el ultimo mencionado, el mayor deseo D. Edelmira es el D. continuar adelante con su negocio y D. esta forma contar con las ganancias necesarias.
texts.en:
Edelmira H. D. P. is 64 years old, a vigorous and hard-working woman. She has a stall in the central market of San Salvador, where she sells different products such as baskets, purses, handbags, plastic piggy banks, brooms, ropes, and other products. She lives in the Sonsonate district with her husband, who works as a merchant of various products, and she also lives with her daughter, who works for her personal expenses and also contributes a little to the household. Seora Edelmira has had this business in the same location for 43 years, which has maD. her very well known in the market by various people who have been her customers for a long time. She has very good personal references, since she is well known for being kind and hard-working. Edelmira is applying for a loan to buy more products and in this way to stock her business with more brooms, plastic bottles for collecting water, wicker baskets for storing clothes, and other items that at the present time are rather scarce, like the last-mentioned item. Edelmira's greatest desire is to continue forward with her business and thus count on the earnings that she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy domestic products to stock her business

loan.name: Lubov

texts.en: Lubov is married with one child. For the past nine years, she has owned a small store selling food, cosmetics and related products. Lubov is an open and sincere person, and these character traits have helped her in her business. Her customers like buying from her and come back again. Her business is quite competitive. Lubov would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to increase the assortment of products she offers. She hopes to increase her sales and make additional income.

loan.use: To increase her assortment of products

loan.name: Sope Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarit SOPE SERIGNE FALLOU est cr en juin 2010 lors de la scission du Banc Villageois. Il est compos de 11 femmes toutes issues du mme village. Elles se sont organises par affinit et par voisinage.
Madame Maty N., accroupie droite de la photo, de blanc vtue, et un foulard blanc sur la tte, est la responsable du groupe. Elle est ge de 35 ans. Elle est marie et mre de 06 enfants.
Elle dveloppe un petit commerce. Elle va TOUBA dans le dpartement de MBACKE rgion de DIOURBEL pour acheter sa marchandise. Elle revend dans les marchs hebdomadaires de sa zone et en faisant du porte porte.
Son nouveau prt permettra d'acheter en quantit plus importante des parfums et de l'encens.
Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille, surtout en ce qui concerne la nourriture et la sant.
texts.en:
The Sope Serigne Fallou solidarity group was created in June 2010 when the Banc Villageois loan group was dissolved. It consists of 11 women from the same village who got together through personal affinities and as neighbors. Mrs. Maty N. is responsible for the group: she is shown kneeling on the right of the picture, clothed in white with a white scarf on her head. She is 35 years old, married and the mother of six children. She is developing a small commercial business. She gets her merchandise from Touba in the Mbacke region of the Diourbel department. She resells at weekly area markets and door-to-door. Her new loan will enable her to buy larger quantities of perfume and incense. She assists her husband in taking care of their family, particularly concerning nutrition and health matters.

Translated from French by Ren McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy perfume and incense

loan.name: Hipolito Gabriel

texts.es:
Hiplito de 30 aos, vive en las Orqudeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orqudeas porque en su descubrimiento haban muchas flores orqudeas), el vende productos Herbaline (productos naturales para el cuerpo hechos con frutas).
Hace dos aos el comenz como vendedor de la lnea Herbaline vendiendo y haciendo promociones, (todos los vendedores son independientes), desde ese tiempo ha implementado vender batidos compuestos de productos herbaline, trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 00h00pm todos los das.
Para seguir trabajando y darle una mejor vida a su familia el quiere comprar con el prstamo productos herbaline como adelgazador, frezztoo, noni etc. En el futuro quiere tener locales de batidos naturales herbaline.
texts.en:
Hiplito, 30, lives in Orqudeas de Guayaquil ["Orchids of Guayaquil"], an urban area that got its name because, when it was discovered, there were many orchid flowers around. He sells "Herbaline" products (natural products for the body, made from fruits). He became an Herbaline vendor two years ago, selling and running promotions (all of the vendors are independent). Since that time, he has started selling shakes made of Herbaline products. He works from 8:00 in the morning until midnight every day. In order to keep working and to provide a better life for his family, he wants to take out a loan to buy Herbaline products like weight-loss supplements, "frezztoo," noni, etc. In the future, he would like to open shops where he sells natural Herbaline shakes.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to buy Herbaline products like weight-loss supplement, frezztoo, noni, etc.

loan.name: Sara Josefina

texts.es: Sara Josefina C. D. V. D. 44 aos D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulutn, lugar en el cual comparte su hogar junto a su esposo, quien se dedica a trabajar y junto a sus dos hijos D. 12 y 1 ao D. edad. Sara posee una venta D. tortillas, las cuales estn hechas a base D. maz, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa, en donD. las personas llegan a comprarlas. DesD. hace 4 aos que ella trabaja elaborando este alimento el cual es muy necesario en la dieta D. las personas salvadoreas, ya que se comen a diario hasta dos o tres veces al da, por lo que este es un negocio bastante estable. Sara desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, debido a que las ganancias generadas D. este negocio, le permiten brindarle toda la ayuda necesaria a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y el D. sus hijo, los cuales son la razn principal para querer mejorar y poder brindarles lo mejor a ellos. Es por esto que Sara solicita un prstamo por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para comprar maz por mayor y D. esta manera atender a ms personas y as obtener ms ganancias las cuales beneficien a su familia.
texts.en:
Sara Josefina C. D. V. is 44. She lives in the department of Usulutn, a place where she shares her home together with her husband, who works, and with her two children who are 12 and 1. Sara sells tortillas, which are maD. from a base of corn. Her business is located in her home,where people come to buy them. She has worked for 4 years making this food which is very necessary in the diet of Salvadorean people, as they eat it daily up to two or three times per day, therefore it is a very stable business. Sara really wishes to be able to improve her business, owing to the fact that the profits generated from this business, allow her to offer all the help needed to her husband for the household expenses and for her children,who are the main reason for wanting to improve and be able to offer the best for them. This is why Sara is asking for a loan so she has the money necessary to buy corn wholesale and in this way serve more people and so earn more profits which will benefit her family.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy corn wholesale for selling tortillas.

loan.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora Alicia G. de 54 aos de edad, es una persona soltera, la cual vive junto a cuatro nietos de: 15, 14, 12, 9 aos de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar y quienes se encuentran a cuidado de Dora, ya que la madre de ellos se encuentra en Los Estados Unidos de donde le manda remesas para el sustento de los nios. Dora se dedica a la venta de ropa para mujeres, jvenes y nias, as mismo ropa interior y calcetines para hombres y mujeres. La venta esta ubicada frente a su casa de habitacin, en Coln, lugar el cual es muy bueno para la venta, ya que se encuentra sobre la calle principal, en donde es un lugar muy concurrido, ya que hay escuelas y diferentes negocios alrededor, por lo que Dora se encuentra a la vista de todas las personas quienes pueden apreciar los productos de ella. El negocio es muy estable, por lo que ella solicita un prstamo a Integral con el deseo de poder aumentar su inventario comprando mayor variedad de tallas, estampados, colores y estilos de ropa, todo esto con el deseo de mejorar sus ventas y as contar con una vida mejor para ella y sus nietas.
texts.en:
Dora Alicia G. is 54 years old and is single. She lives with her four gandchildren, who are 15, 14, 12, and 9 years old. They are in school and are in her care, since their mother is in the United States, and from there she sends remittances to support the children. Dora sells clothing for women, youth, and girls, as well as underwear and socks for men and women. Her stall is in front of her home in Coln; it is in a location that is very good for sales, since it is on the main street, which has a lot of traffic, since there are schools and different businesses around it. Thus Dora is in sight of all the people who appreciate her products. The business is very stable. For this reason she is applying to Integral for a loan so that she can increase her inventory by buying a greater variety of sizes, prints, colors, and styles of clothing. She is doing all this with the desire to improve her sales and thus have a better life for her and her grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy a greater variety of clothing

loan.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina tiene 46 aos, es viuda y vive el lado de sus 3 hijas en su casa propia. Desde hace mas de 10 aos se dedica al tejido, actividad que lo realiza en su misma casa con ayuda de su hija, las chompas que realiza son de muy buena calidad por lo que tiene clientes fijos y estables y cada cierto tiempo le solicitan este trabajo bien elaborado. Sabina no se queda solamente con realizar tejidos, pues siempre esta al pendiente de nuevas oportunidades de negocio como por ejemplo la venta de desayunos frente a una universidad, con ello tiene un aporte adicional a su economa. Esta tan entusiasmada con el trabajo, su mayor anhelo en este negocio es producir mas cantidad de prendas de vestir a base de lana tejida, para ello desea comprarse una maquina de tejer. Es su tercer crdito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, adems le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que sern gestoras del prstamo que solicita y le ser muy til en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crdito que solicita, invertir en la compra de lanas de diversas calidades y colores.
texts.en:
Sabina is 46-years-old. She's a widow and she lives with her 3 daughters in her own house. For more than 10 years she's been a weaver, an activity which she does in her home with the help of her daughter. The sweaters that she makes are very high quality, which is why she has loyal and stable customers who solicit her elaborate work on a regular basis. Sabina doesn't stop at weaving. She's always on the lookout for new business opportunities like, for example, selling breakfast foods in front of a university, which supplements her income. She's so enthusiastic about her work that her greatest desire in this business is to produce a greater quantity of woven wool garments. For this purpose she wants to buy a loom. This is her third loan with MFP and she's very happy to know that she has financial support because she's always been responsible with her payments, and, furthermore, it gives her pleasure to be a part of her local communal bank because all of its partners are responsible, supportive people. She's thankful to those who will participate in this loan that she's asking for, which will be very useful in the progress of her business. With this loan she will invest in the purchase of wool of various qualities and colors.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Puchase of wool of various qualities and colors

loan.name: Martha Susana

texts.es:
Martha de 19 aos, vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecologa en disolucin a las afuera de Guayaquil), hace unos meses atrs sus padres le dieron una tienda pequea para Martha.
Por la falta de oportunidades y al ver sus padres el empeo que ella tenia por independizarse decidieron comprar algunos vveres y ubicarle una tienda para Martha, poco a poco ella ha administrado la tienda, cuando sale en las noches a la universidad su mama le ayuda atender la tienda, vende arroz, bebidas, lcteos etc.
Ella quiere continuar con su tienda e invertir en dinero comprando arroz y bebidas con el prstamo. En el futuro quiere surtir su tienda y terminar sus estudios con xito.
texts.en:
Martha is 19 years old and lives in Primavera de Duran (an area outside the city of Guayaquil with a deteriorating ecosystem). A few months ago, her parents gave her a small store. Because of the lack of other opportunities, when her parents saw her determination to work independently, they decided to buy some groceries and create a store for Martha. Little by little, she has improved the store, and when she goes out at night to her university classes, her mother helps her by working in the store, selling rice, beverages, dairy products, etc. Martha would like to continue with her store and invest the funds from the loan to buy rice and beverages. In the future, she would like to expand the range of goods she sells and successfully complete her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying rice and beverages for her store

loan.name: Yerlin

texts.es: Yerlin V. A. es una joven de 20 aos de edad la cual vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; est comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montaosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro pas. Sus principales actividades econmicas son la ganadera y la agricultura especficamente se da la siembra de granos bsicos, caa de azcar, naranja Desde hace pocos aos, doa Yerlin fue impulsada por su padre para que desarrollara su propio negocio en el pequeo terreno que l le haba dado por herencia. Hoy ella se dedica a la siembra de ame, un tubrculo de agradable sabor, rico en nutrientes, de procesamiento agroindustrial amplio y de gran demanda tanto en Costa Rica como en otros pases. Actualmente Doa Yerlin est solicitando un prstamo de 623,000 (seiscientos veinte tres mil colones), para ayudarse con la preparacin del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra ptima del ame Doa Yerlin es socia de la Empresa de Crdito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este ser su primer prstamo y con el espera mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de produccin.
texts.en:
Yerlin V. A. is a youth of 20 years of age who lives with her husband and her 2 children in a community called Santa Fe, located in Los Chiles in the Alajuela province. This community is in a mountainous region that is located very close to the northern border of the country. The main economic activities are livestock and agriculture, specifically the cultivation of staple grains, sugar cane and oranges. A few years ago Yerlin was motivated by her father to develop her own business on a small plot of land that he had given her for an inheritance. Today she is cultivating yams, root vegetables that taste good, are rich in nutrients and are processed in large volume by the local agro-industry. There is great demand for this product in Costa Rica as well as in other countries. Yerlin is now requesting a loan of 623,000 Costa Rican colones to help with the preparation of the soil by purchasing of seeds, fertilizers and other supplies that are needed to guarantee the optimal cultivation of yams. Yerlin is a member of the communal bank "Manatial de Santa Fe," one of the 100 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and with it she hopes to improve her income and the quality of her production.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to buy supplies to prepare the soil, and to cultivate yams

loan.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma O. R. es una seora de 37 aos de edad la cual vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; est comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montaosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro pas. Sus principales actividades econmicas son la ganadera y la agricultura especficamente se da la siembra de granos bsicos, caa de azcar, naranja. Con el deseo de mejorar su condicin de vida y la de su familia ella busc alternativas diferentes y desde hace poco ms de un ao inici un negocio, una panadera , en la cual ofrece diferentes tipos de pan y sobre todo repostera casera. Dice que le ha ido muy bien ya que en su comunidad ha tenido mucha aceptacin puesto que antes no haba un lugar que brindara ese servicio. En estos momentos lo que desea doa Norma es solicitar un prstamo por 623 000 (Seiscientos veinte tres mil colones) para mejorar las condiciones del local donde se elabora el pan. Con esto espera que su microempresa crezca y llegue a generar ms ingresos para mejorar su condicin de vida. Doa Norma es socia de la Empresa de Crdito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este ser su primer prstamo y con l espera crecer ms a nivel personal y mantener su negocio
texts.en:
Norma O. R. is a 37-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children in a community named Santa Fe, in Los Chiles, Alajuela province. This community lies in a mountainous zone very close to our country's northern border. The area's leading economic activities are ranching and farming, especially staple grains, sugar cane and oranges. With the desire to improve her quality of life and that of her family, Norma was looking at various alternatives, and a little more than a year ago, she started a business: a bakery in which she offers different types of bread and especially homemade pastries. She says that the business has gone very well for her; she has enjoyed great acceptance in her community, since there had previously been no business providing this service. At this time, Norma would like to request a loan of 623,000 colones in order to improve the infrastructure of the place where she bakes her bread. With this, she hopes that her microenterprise will grow and generate more income to raise her standard of living. Norma is a member of the Empresa de Crdito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe (Santa Fe Springs Communal Credit Company), one of EDESA's 100 member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and she hopes that it will help her to grow on a personal level and allow her to maintain her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Materials to improve her bakery

loan.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor P. L. es una joven de 18 aos de edad la cual vive con su esposo y su hijo en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; est comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montaosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro pas. Sus principales actividades econmicas son la ganadera y la agricultura especficamente se da la siembra de granos bsicos, caa de azcar, naranja. Flor tiene un pequeo terreno en el cual ha sembrado diferentes cultivos tales como papaya y pltano, pero desde hace tres aos ella se dedica a la siembra de ame un tubrculo de agradable sabor, rico en nutrientes, de procesamiento agroindustrial amplio y de gran demanda tanto en Costa Rica como en otros pases. Asegura que desde que se dedica solo a este producto sus ingresos han aumentado. Actualmente Flor est solicitando un prstamo de 623,000 (seiscientos veinte y tres mil colones) para ayudarse con la preparacin del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra ptima del ame.
