Doa Flor es socia de la Empresa de Crdito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este ser su primer prstamo y espera aprovecharlo al mximo y seguir teniendo acceso a este de tipo de Crditos.
texts.en:
Flor P. L. is an 18 year-old youth who lives with her husband and their son in a community called Santa Fe, located in Los Chiles in the Alajuela province. This community is in a mountainous region that is located very close to the northern border of the country. The main economic activities are livestock and agriculture, specifically the cultivation of staple grains, sugar cane and oranges. Flor has a small piece of land where she has cultivated different crops such as papaya and bananas, but three years ago she started to grow yams. Yams are root vegetables that taste good, are rich in nutrients and are processed in large volume by the local agro-industry. There is great demand for this product in Costa Rica as well as in other countries. She tells us that since she dedicated her production entirely to this product her income has increased. Now Flor is requesting a loan of 623,000 Costa Rican colones to help with the preparation of the soil by purchasing of seeds, fertilizers and other supplies that are needed to guarantee the optimal cultivation of yams. Flor is a member of the communal bank "Manatial de Santa Fe," one of the 100 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and she hopes to take maximum advantage of it and to continue to have access to this type of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to buy supplies to improve her land

loan.name: Leandro

texts.es:
Leandro P. D. es un seor de 57 aos de edad el cual vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; est comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montaosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro pas. Sus principales actividades econmicas son la ganadera y la agricultura especficamente se da la siembra de granos bsicos, caa de azcar, naranja.
Durante toda su vida Don Leandro se ha dedicado a la ganadera de doble propsito. Una de sus especialidades es la produccin de queso. De la cual asegura que la calidad que el produce es la mejor alrededor de la zona.
En estos momentos el desea obtener un microcrdito por 623.000 (seiscientos veintitrs mil colones), para comprar semilla de pasto y mejorar las condiciones del corral donde tiene sus vacas. El dice que la calidad de la leche que producen sus vaquitas depende de la calidad del pasto.
Don Leandro es socio de la Empresa de Crdito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este ser su primer prstamo y con l espera crecer ms a nivel personal y mantener su negocio.
texts.en:
Leandro P. D. is 57 years old and lives with his wife and their three sons in a community called Santa Fe. Santa Fe is located in the Los Chiles area, in the province of Alajuela; this community is in a mountainous area and is very close to the countrys northern border. His main economic activities are ranching and farming, specifically, growing staple grains, sugar cane, and oranges. For all of his life Leandro has made a living raising cattle for milk and for meat. One of his specialties is producing cheese, and Leandro guarantees that his cheese is the best produced in the area. At this time Leandro wants to obtain a micro-loan for 623,000 (six hundred and twenty three thousand colones) so that he can purchase grass seed and improve the conditions of the corral where he keeps his cattle. He says that the quality of the milk his cows produce depends on the quality of the grass they eat. Leandro is a member of the Empresa de Crdito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, one of EDESAs 100 member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be Leandros first loan, and he hopes it will help him to grow more on a personal level and maintain his business.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Maintaining his business and purchasing grass seed.

loan.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila tiene 64 aos, es casada y vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 21 aos D. experiencia en la actividad agrcola y lo que principalmente cultiva es papa y maz sobre extensiones D. terreno que posee en su tierra natal ubicado en la zona rural D. su localidad. Casi siempre acuD. a ver sus terrenos y ms en poca D. siembra y cosecha, este ultimo es ella misma la encargada D. vender su cosecha al por mayor en el mercado local donD. tiene regulares rentas que le permiten incrementar un poco mas su inversin para la siguiente siembra, puesto que no tiene edad suficiente para continuar con esta actividad. Ahora sus hijos trabajan mas seguido y se dedican a ver sus terrenos D. cultivo, sin embargo Teofila no descansa en buscar buenos compradores para su cosecha, es por eso que continuara esforzndose en la agricultura. Es su sptimo crdito con MFP, esta muy contenta D. saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, adems le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que sern gestoras del prstamo que solicita y le ser muy til en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crdito que solicita, invertir en la compra D. semillas y abono para su prxima campaa D. siembra.
texts.en:
Tefila, 64, is married and lives in her own home with her three children. She has been a farmer for 21 years. Her main crops are potatoes and corn. Her fields are located in the area where she was born in her localitys rural zone. Customarily she visits her fields mostly during planting and harvesting times. She herself sells her crops at wholesale in the local market where her profits are satisfactory and which permit her to gradually increase her investment in the next planting. Because she is now of an age that does not permit her to continue with this kind of work, her children now work more often and see to the fields. However, Tefila works tirelessly to find good buyers for her crops and this is why she will continue to work in farming. This is her 7th loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she can count on financial support because she has always been responsible with her repayments. In addition, she enjoys being part of a communal group because all its members are responsible, very united people. She is grateful to all those who will fund the loan she is requesting that will be very useful for her business. She will use the requested funds to buy seed and manure for the next planting cycle.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy seed and manure for the next planting cycle.

loan.name: Bella Angelica

texts.es:
Bella de 56 aos, Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayora de habitantes son comerciantes informales), ella tiene una tienda de vivieres.
Ella tiene la tienda para ayudar con los gastos familiares y a su esposo , comenz comprando arroz, verduras y lcteos. Desde ese tiempo ella a continuado trabajando para asegurar su vejez porque ya sus hijos son mayores de edad. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los das.
Con el presta quiere comprar arroz, y bebidas para surtir mas su tienda, en el futuro quiere comprar una casa con su esposo.
texts.en:
Bella is 56 years old and lives in the Suburbio de Guayaquil (an urban area in which the majority of its residents are informal vendors). She owns a general store.

She runs the store in order to help her husband with the family expenses. She started out by purchasing rice, vegetables and dairy products. Since then, she has continued to work in order to be able to support herself during old age, since her children are now over age. She works from 8:00am until 9:00pm every day.

With this loan, she would like to purchase rice and beverages in order to better stock her shop. In the future, she would like to buy a house with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase rice and beverages

loan.name: Kuakuera Katupyry Group

texts.es: El contacto para el inicio del presente comit fue la seora Mirna quien ya conocia el programa D. Comite D. Mujeres Emprendedoras e invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte D. comite y hasta la actualidad siguen trabajando, y se encuentran contentas con sus trabajos. La sra. Mirna C. obtiene buenos ingresos mediante la venta D. ropas, tiene su clientela ya formada y debido a la temporada D. invierno aument su demanda por el fro. Deseando incrementar sus ingresos quiere invertir en ms compra al por mayor D. prendas D. vestir como pantalones, tricotas, camperas, remeras, medias, bufandas, gorros, etc. al por mayor para venta al detalle.
texts.en:
The contact person for the establishment of the current committee was Ms. Mirna, who was already familiar with the Comite D. Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Enterprising Women) Program. She invited and organized her friends to form the group, which has been functioning since then. The group members are satisfied with their jobs.

Ms. Mirna C. earns a living via her apparel business. She has established her client base, and due to the winter season, demand has increased because of the cold weather.

Hoping to increase her income, she would like to invest in purchasing apparel such as pants, sweaters, jackets, T-shirts, socks, scarves, caps, etc. both wholesale and retail.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase wholesale and retail apparel

loan.name: Shalom 6 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Harthanesse is the coordinator of her group Shalom 6 & 7 (Shalom). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have a stable business. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying being at home.
Harthanesse is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for four years. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying different shoes, including sports, kid and women's shoes. She will use the profits to improve her business.
This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to make her business better, with more products. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for Baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities are the Free trading zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loan.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy beauty supplies.

loan.name: William

texts.es:
William es un padre de familia de 35 aos de edad, tiene un hijo dependiente, vive junto a su familia en el casero Maravillas, una zona agrcola del distrito de Mochum, zona perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque, situada a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en una mototaxi (motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina utilizada en el transporte de carga y pasajeros). El lleva nueve aos trabajando en esta actividad, usualmente brinda su servicio uniendo la ruta de Mochum con su casero y otros caseros aledaos. Adicionalmente percibe ingresos vendiendo algunos animales que el mismo cra. Con estas actividades el sostiene la economa de su familia.
William desea realizar algunas labores de reparacin y mantenimiento de su unidad mvil ya que, debido al continuo uso y al estado accidentado de los caminos del lugar, ha sufrido algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparacin para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 1500 nuevos soles.
William es un joven tranquilo y bastante entregado a su familia, en la zona donde vive el es bastante conocido y estimado por sus vecinos, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como transportista y llegar a tener una mototaxi mas.
texts.en:
William is a 35-year old father who has one dependent child. He lives with his family in the town of Maravillas, an agricultural area in the district of Mochum, Lambayeque, about 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He dedicates himself to providing transportation services with his mototaxi (a motorcycle outfitted with passenger seating and storage areas). He has been carrying out this activity for nine years, usually providing service along routes in Mochum and other neighboring areas. He also generates income by selling livestock that he raises himself. He provides for his family financially through these activities. William would like to do some repairs to his vehicle. Because of continuous use and the bad state of the local roads, he has experienced some breakdowns and is in urgent need of some mechanical work so that his mototaxi will continue to run properly. In order to meet his goal, he has found himself having to turn to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 1500 Peruvian soles. William is a calm young man, and very dedicated to his family. He is well-known and liked by his neighbors, and his greatest wish is to continue growing his business and buying another mototaxi.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To pay for repairs and maintenance for his mototaxi.

loan.name: Danny Felipe

texts.es:
Danny de 31 aos, Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayora de habitantes son comerciantes informales), el tiene una lavandera para poder solventar los gastos familiares.
Por la falta de oportunidades el tuvo que invertir sus ahorros en lavadoras para poder tener dinero y mantener a sus dos hijos que ahora tienen 7 y 8 aos. Hace 5 aos atrs comenz con una lavadora ahora tiene tres y trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 22h00pm todos los das.
Para continuar con su negocio el quiere comprar dos lavadoras con el prstamo y en el futuro quiere tener sucursales de lavado y secado de ropa.
texts.en:
Danny, 31 years of age, lives in a suburb of Guayaquil (an urban area where a majority of residents are merchants). He runs a laundromat to support his households expenses. Due to lack of opportunities, he had to invest his savings into washing machines so he could support his two children, now 7 and 8 years old. Five years ago, he started with one washing machine and now he has three. He works from 7 am until 10 pm every day. He would like to use the loan to buy two washing machines, in order to grow his business. In the future, he would like to open more branches of his laundromat.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase washing machines.

loan.name: Naciones Unidas Group

texts.es:
La Asociacin Comunal Naciones Unidas est conformada por diez personas, nueve mujeres y un varn. Este es su segundo ciclo, la seora Cristina P. V. es la presidenta para este ciclo.
Naciones Unidas es una asociacin comunal que pertenece al Centro Focal de Alto Lima. La seora Cristina tiene como negocio la produccin y venta de zapatos, desde hace varios aos; el taller est ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Ella indica que trabaja en forma conjunta con su esposo y su cuado.
Para el primer crdito la asociacin le aprob de Bs. 2000. Ahora el prstamo solicitado es por Bs.2000.- y ser destinado a la compra de material para la elaboracin de zapatos.
Las integrantes de la asociacin comunal tienen diferentes tipos de negocios: venta de pescado frito, venta de aceite, venta de abarrotes, venta de comida, venta de verdura, venta de cerveza, produccin de calzados, produccin de mantas y venta de fruta.
texts.en:
The Naciones Unidas (Nations United) Communal Bank is comprised of ten people, nine women and one man. This is their second cycle. Cristina P. V. is the president for this cycle. Naciones Unidas is a communal bank, which belongs to the community center in Alto Lima. Cristina has had a business producing and selling shoes for several years. Her workshop is located in her house. She says that she works together with her husband and her brother-in-law. Her first loan with the association was for 2,000 BOB. Now she is requesting a loan for 2,000 BOB. She will use the loan to buy material to make shoes. The members of the communal bank have different types of businesses like selling fried food, selling oil, selling groceries, selling food, selling vegetables, and selling beer. Some members make shoes, make blankets, or sell fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy raw material to make shoes

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase wood to use as a fuel for making hot water

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Purchase of products to increase her stock

loan.name: Jesusa

texts.es: Jesusa tiene 40 aos, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 1 ao ofrece el servicio de llamadas, por lo que cuenta con un locutorio instalado en su misma casa, aprovechando adems que tiene una tienda. Es as que de manera diaria atiende su establecimiento con la ayuda de sus 2 hijas la apoyan en esta tarea. Por otro lado se dedican tambin bordar bellas prendas tpicas. Lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que le gusta ser independiente y tambin porque le permite tener una vida tranquila ya que le permite tener las rentas necesarias para su familia, afirma adems que aunque su trabajo suele ser tranquilo requiere de muy buena administracin y control de las ventas diarias, es por eso que Jesusa esta planificando crecer ms en su negocio. Es su doceavo crdito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, adems le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que sern gestoras del prstamo que solicita y le ser muy til en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crdito que solicita, invertir en la compra de lnea telefnica para llamadas en su locutorio y materiales para realizar bordados as como la compra de un saco de arroz para su tienda.
texts.en:
Jesusa is 40 years old and lives with her two children in their own home. For a year she has been offering phone service from her house, where she also runs a small store. Every day she runs the business with help from her two daughters. Jesusa also has another line of work, embroidering beautiful traditional clothing. She enjoys this second job because she can work independently and it allows her to have a less stressful life because it helps to cover the household expenses. Jesusa says that while her work is not stressful, it does require careful planning and sales management. For this reason, she is planning to expand her business. This is her twelfth loan with MFP [the Kiva field partner]. She is very happy to have this financial support and has always repaid her loans on time. She also enjoys being a part of her communal bank because her fellow bank members are responsible and supportive. She thanks the people who will fund her loan. It will be very useful for her to move her business forward. She will use the loan money to buy another telephone line for her business, to buy materials for embroidery work, and also to buy a sack of rice for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of a telephone line and embroidery materials

loan.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar es un padre de familia de 50 aos que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector San Miguel del casero Lagartera, una de las tantas zonas rurales que conforman el distrito de Mrrope, un distrito agrcola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica a confeccionar prendas de vestir en un pequeo taller que est instalado en su vivienda, el cuenta con una mquina de coser pequea con la que confecciona pantalones, los cuales ofrece en venta a un acopiador de la zona que los distribuye en ciudades de la sierra norte del pas, este negocio es la principal fuente de sustento para la economa de su familia, adicionalmente tiene ganado de engorde, el cual vende eventualmente con lo que se genera ingresos adicionales.
Cesar desea implementar su taller adquiriendo una remalladora que le permita realizar sus labores con mayor comodidad y eficiencia, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 2000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su meta.
Cesar es un hombre trabajador y entregado a su familia, anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institucin y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas. En la zona donde vive es considerado una persona responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Cesar is a 50 year old husband and father who lives with his wife and children in the San Miguel sector of the village of Lagartera. This is one of the many rural areas that make up the district of Mrrope, an agricultural district that belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is found forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He makes clothing in a small workshop set up in his home. He has a small sewing machine with which he makes pants that he sells to an area warehouse that distributes them in cities in the northern sierra of the country. This business is the main source of support for his family. He also has beef cattle which he sells eventually and with which he generates additional income. Cesar wants to outfit his workshop adquiring an overlocker which will allow him to do his work with more convenience and efficiency. That is why he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles which will allow him to attain his goal. Cesar is a hardworking man who is dedicated to his family. He has worked with our institution previously and has shown himself to be punctual and responsible when it comes to making payments. In the area where he lives he is considered a responsible and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase an overlocker to improve his clothing making business.

loan.name: Ilusiones De Alto Lima Group

texts.es:
La Asociacin Comunal ILUSIONES DE ALTO LIMA est conformada por ocho personas, siete mujeres y un varn. Este es su segundo ciclo, la seora Jesusa A. C. es la presidenta. Como su nombre lo indica, la asociacin es parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima.
La seora Jesusa tiene como negocio la venta de comida, desde hace diez aos, por ahora no tiene un lugar especfico de venta, es vendedora ambulante.
Si bien este es el segundo ciclo para la asociacin, es el primer ciclo para la presidenta, la asociacin le aprob de Bs. 1500.-, monto de dinero que le servir para la compra de insumos para la venta de comida. En cuanto a la asociacin comunal, tienen diferentes tipos de negocios: venta de tostado, venta de abarrotes, venta de comida, venta de verdura, venta de repuestos, tapicera.
texts.en:
The Ilusiones de Alto Lima Communal Association is comprised of 8 members: seven women and one man. This is the group's second loan cycle. Ms. Jesusa A. C. is the group president. As its name indicates, the association is part of the Alto Lima headquarters.

Ms. Jesusa has been selling food for a living for ten years. As of right now, she does not have a fixed business space; she is a street vendor.

This is the association's second loan cycle, but it is the first cycle for the president. The association approved a loan of 1,500.00 BOB, which will be used to purchase supplies for selling food.

Regarding the group, the members own different types of businesses: roasted nuts and legumes, provisions, food, produce, spare parts, and upholstery.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase wholesale provisions

loan.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es: LA SRA. LIZABETH MARIELA, TIENE 49 AOS D. EDAD, ES CASADA, TIENE UN HIJO D. 24 AOS. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "MUJERES EN ACCIN", INTEGRADO POR 8 PERSONAS. SUS COMPAERAS LA ELIGIERON PRESIDENTA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO. HACE 6 AOS INICI EL NEGOCIO D. LA VENTA D. GOLOSINAS, UNA AMIGA LE DEJ EL LUGAR DOND. AHORA ELLA SE UBICA CON SU CARRETA, QUE LO COMPR JUNTANDO SUS GANANCIAS ASI COMO TAMBIN ADQUIRI UNA PEQUEA VITRINA PARA EXHIBIR LOS PRODUCTOS D. VENTA. CON SU TRABAJO HA PODIDO ARREGLAR SU CASA Y SOBRETODO AUMENTAR SU STOCK D. GOLOSINAS LO QUE LE PERMITE TENER MAYOR INGRESOS Y MAS CLIENTES. SU META MAS CERCANA ES AMBIENTAR UN ESPACIO D. SU CASA PARA IMPLEMENTAR UNA BODEGA, AS YA NO TENDRA QUE SALIR A VENDER A LAS CALLES Y EVITARA PASAR FRO EN POCAS D. INVIERNO E INSOLACIN EN POCA D. VERANO. EL PRSTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA D. GOLOSINAS Y GASEOSAS PARA SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Lizabeth Mariela is 49 years old, married, and has a 24-year-old son. She is part of the "Mujeres en Accin" [Women in Action] group, which has 8 members. Her fellow group members elected her as the head of the group. For 6 years, Lizabeth has worked selling candy. A friend found her a place to park her mobile sales stand, which she purchased with her earnings. She also bought a small glass display case in order to show off her products. With her earnings, Lizabeth has been able to make improvements to her home, but principally she has been able to increase her stock of candies, which in turn has allowed her to gain more customers and make better profits. Lizabeth's current goal is to remodel part of her house to start a small grocery store. This will mean she does not have to sell in the street and will avoid being cold in the winter and getting too much sun in the summer. She will use this loan to buy candy and soft drinks for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of candy for her store

loan.name: Libia

texts.es: Libia tiene 23 aos, vive en casa de su hermana en compaa de su madre y sus 2 hijos. Desde hace 2 aos se dedica a vender prendas de vestir, ofreciendo a personas que en su mayora son conocidas o familiares, eso le garantiza el pago de la mercadera que vende. Afirma que este negocio es muy rentable porque compra a un precio mdico las prendas y puede ofrecer a un buen precio a sus clientes, es as que se abastece de mercadera cada 2 meses donde viaja a la ciudad de Lima y compra al por mayor. Una de sus metas es tener ms capital y tener un puesto de ventas. Es su cuarto crdito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, adems le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que sern gestoras del prstamo que solicita y le ser muy til en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crdito que solicita, invertir en la compra de ms mercadera en casacas y prendas gruesas ya que son los que ms demanda tiene en esta poca de fro.
texts.en:
Libia is 23 years old and lives in her sister's house along with her mother and her two children. For the past two years she has worked selling clothing, mostly to family members and acquaintances. This helps her to be sure that she will be paid for her merchandise. Libia says that her business is very profitable because she can buy clothing for a low price and offer her customers a good price when she sells it. She stocks up on clothing every 2 months when she travels to the city of Lima, where she can purchase the clothing wholesale. One of her goals is to obtain more working capital and set up a sales stand. This is her fourth loan with MFP [the Kiva field partner]. She is very happy to have this financial support and has always repaid her loans on time. She also enjoys being a part of her communal bank because her fellow bank members are responsible and supportive. She thanks the people who will fund her loan. It will be very useful for her to move her business forward. She will use the loan money to buy more jackets and other heavy clothing that is in demand during the cold winter season in Peru.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of jackets and other cold-weather clothing for the winter season.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: For home enlargement.

loan.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto Benavidez tiene 26 aos y vive en el barrio la Luz, su negocio se llama Venta de vveres donde Carlos este es su tercer crdito y lo invertir en la compra de surtido para la tienda, entre vveres ranchos, licores y abarrotes. Su negocio lo inici en el ao 2005 con una venta de jugos naturales y otros refrescos, como gaseosas y bebidas fras, gradualmente fue agregndole otras mercancas, porque sinti la necesidad de aumentar sus ingresos y adems porque el lugar result propicio para esta actividad; en la actualidad en su tienda vende adicionalmente bebidas fras al por mayor y al detal y tambin productos de papelera que adicion ltimamente. Carlos Alberto ha recibido 3 crditos que le han ayudado a producir ciertos cambios como el su economa que se ha mejorado y tambin han ocurrido en los aspectos organizacionales de su tienda, que cada da reviste un mayor orden. Su meta es continuar adicionando otros productos como los de miscelnea e independizar su negocio de su espacio familiar. Su mayor desafo es la competencia que existe en ese sector, por eso su meta es tener gran variedad de mercanca e ir diversificando la oferta de productos y servicios.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto Benavidez is 26 years old and lives in the La Luz neighborhood. His business is a general store called Venta de vveres donde Carlos. This is his third loan, and it will be invested in purchasing products for the store, like general provisions, food and liquor.

He started his business in 2005, initially selling fruit juices and other beverages, such as soda pop and cold drinks. He gradually added other merchandise because he felt the need to increase his income. Furthermore, the business turned out to be favorable. He currently also sells cold drinks wholesale and retail, as well as stationery, which he recently added.

Carlos Alberto has received 3 loans, which have helped him achieve several changes; his financial situation has improved, and his store organization is improving day by day. His goal is to continue adding other products and to separate his business from his residence. His biggest challenge is the competition that exists in the area, which is why his goal is to offer a greater variety of merchandise and to diversify his goods and services.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase provisions, food and liquor for general store

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loan.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es: El comit Mujeres Luchadoras del barrio Loma Merlo de la ciudad de Luque, se form gracias a que una de las integrantes del comit lleg a la oficina de la Fundacin para informarse sobre los crditos, y form con un grupo de amigas un comite y solicitaron para formar parte del programa de Comit de Mujeres. De esta forma se inicia el comit Mujeres Luchadoras, el cual actualmente se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo del Programa Comit de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundacin Paraguaya y est conformado por 16 integrantes que invierten en distintas actividades. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mara M. quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles y bebidas, as como helados y golosinas. La misma est bien situada por lo que posee una buena clientela y con buena demanda, por lo que desea incrementar sus ingresos ampliando su negocio con ms variedad de comestibles, mas variedad de bebidas, as como diversidad de golosinas y helados para la compra de estos productos ella solicita el prestamo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Luchadoras Group of the Loma Merlo neighborhood in the city of Luque was formed thanks to one of its members who came to the Fundacin office to get informed about microloans. She formed a committee with a group of friends, and they applied to be a part of the Comit de Mujeres program.

This is how the Mujeres Luchadoras Group was formed, which is currently in its fourth loan cycle in the Comit de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Enterprising Women) Program of the Fundacin Paraguaya. The group is comprised of 16 members who invest in different businesses. One of the members is Ms. Maria M., who sells food, beverages, ice cream and candy for a living.

She is prosperous because of her solid client base and high demand, which is why she wishes to increase her income by expanding her business with a variety of foodstuffs and beverages, as well as a large assortment of ice cream. She is requesting this loan in order t o purchase these products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase wholesale charcoal, soft drinks, beer, vegetables, cooking oil, flour, breads, meats, and ice cream

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy construction tools like: polisher, saw, hammer, etc.

loan.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. JINA, ES SOCIA DEL GRUPO "NUEVO AMANECER", FORMADO POR 8 INTEGRANTES. ELLA TIENE 53 AOS DE EDAD Y TIENE 7 HIJOS, DE CUALES DOS AN SON MENORES. HACE SIETE APOS SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE CONDIMENTOS, ELLA LOS PREPARA Y REPARTE EN LOS DIFERENTES MERCADOS; FUERON SUS HIJOS QUIENES EMPEZARON STE NEGOCIO Y ELLA SOLO LOS APOYABA, AL VER LA ACOGIDA DECIDI FORMAR SU PROPIO NEGOCIO Y AS APOYAR A SUS HIJOS MENORES EN LOS GASTOS ESCOLARES. CON SUS INGRESOS HA LOGRADO ARREGLAR SU CASITA, COMPRAR SUS ARTEFACTOS Y SOBRETODO LO MAS IMPORTANTE PARA ELLA HA PODIDO CUBRIR LOS GASTOS DE ESTUDIOS DE SUS HIJOS. SU PROXIMA META ES INCURSIONAR EN LA VENTA DE ABARROTES, ALQUILANDO UN LOCAL EN UNA ZONA COMERCIAL PRIMERO PARA LUEGO ADQUIRIR SU PROPIO LOCAL.
EL PRSTRAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE INGREDIENTES PARA LA PREPARACIN DE SUS CONDIMENTOS, APROVECHAR QUE RFECIBE UHNA CANTIDAD CONSIDERABLE PARA COMPRAR LOS PRODUCTOS A PRECIO POR MAYOR Y OBTENER AS UN POCO MAS DE GANANCIA.
texts.en:
Jina, 53, is a member of the "NUEVO AMANECER" (New Dawn) group which has 8 members. She has 7 children two of whom are still minors. For the last 7 years she has sold condiments that she prepares herself and sells in the various markets. Her children were the ones who started the business and she just helped out. In view of the good reception she got, she decided to set up her own business to help her youngest children with their school costs. Her income has made it possible for her to fix up her little house, to buy her appliances and, above all, to cover her childrens educational expenses. Her next goal is to go into grocery sales by first renting a locale in a commercial area and subsequently acquiring he own locale. She will use the requested funds to buy ingredients to prepare the condiments. She will take advantage of the fact that she will receive a considerable sum to buy supplies at better wholesale prices thereby earning somewhat higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy ingredients for condiments preparation.

loan.name: Cruz Esperanza

texts.es:
Cruz Esperanza tiene 33 aos de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un pequeo hijo, vive en el casero El Huantaco, un centro poblado del rea rural del distrito agrcola de Tambogrande, una zona dedicada principalmente al cultivo de rboles frutales, se encuentra en la provincia de Piura y pertenece a la regin del mismo nombre, se localiza a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica a vender artculos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en el domicilio donde reside, este negocio le permite a sus clientes y vecinos contar con productos de uso diario al alcance de la mano, por lo que su negocio cuenta con bastante clientela, las ganancias que percibe de esta actividad las utiliza en solventar sus gastos personales y cuidar se su pequeo nio.
Ella desea ampliar su negocio comprando mas artculos para aumentar su stock y tambin aumentar su nivel de ventas. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.
Cruz es una mujer honrada y bastante trabajadora. En la zona donde reside sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y de confianza. Su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a su hijo la oportunidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cruz Esperanza is a 33-year-old single mother with a small child. She lives in the El Huantaco hamlet, a rural community in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, a region where there is mainly fruit tree cultivation. This place is located in the Piura province, and is a part of the region that goes by the same name. It is located more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells basic need items and provisions from home. This business allows her customers and neighbors to have easy access to daily use products, which is why she has a solid client base. She uses the profits earned from this business to cover her personal expenses and to support her young child.

She wishes to expand her business by purchasing more goods and increasing her stock, thus boosting sales. For this reason, she feels the need to request a 2,000.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time so that she can reach her goal.

Cruz is an honest and hard-working woman. Her neighbors and acquaintances in the area consider her to be a calm and trustworthy person. Her greatest wish is to be able to grant her child the opportunity to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase basic need items and other provisions to expand her in-home general store

loan.name: Julio Omario

texts.es:
Julio Omario A. C. tiene 25 aos. Vive en unin libre en el cantn de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolvar. Tiene 1 nia de 4 aos.
Julio es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que est ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maz y cacao. Esto es el primer prstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San Jos.
Julio se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maz y cacao. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Mata de Cacao cada fin del mes.
Solicita el prstamo para cultivar sembros de cacao para cambiar su economa personal y familiar. Su sueo es seguir adelante con su trabajo y de esta manera dar una buena educacin a su hija.
Le gusta practicar el juego de billar.
texts.en:
Julio Omario A. C. is 25 years old. He lives with his common-law wife in the canton of Chillanes, in Bolvar province. He has one daughter who is 4 years old. Julio is a member of the rural solidarity group El Placer, located three hours from Chillanes. It has a total of 19 members, most of whom are involved in growing corn and cacao [cocoa]. This is their first loan through the San Jos Cooperative. Julio works in agriculture, growing corn and cacao. He makes his purchases and his sales in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month. He is requesting the loan so he can cultivate more cacao crops, in order to improve his personal economic situation and that of his family. His dream is to continue with his work so that he can give a good education to his daughter. He enjoys playing billiards.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Growing cacao

loan.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 35 aos, vive con su esposo y su hija en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 2 aos brinda el servicio de transporte y su herramienta principal es el propio carro que han adquirido y ahora el servicio que brinda va por diferentes puntos de la ciudad. Es por esta razn que han contratado a un chofer, para que pueda trabajar todo el da, mientras que Martha y su esposo trabajan como docentes en un centro educativo. Cada da el trabajo les genera la renta que necesita para la economa de su hogar, adems eso le ayuda a pagar las letras de crdito que an faltan para cancelar el carro que posee. Manifiesta que se siente muy satisfecha de tener los ingresos porque le permite disponer para muchos gastos que se requiere en su hogar. En adelante desea adquirir un carro ms para que siga trabajando de esta modalidad. Es su primer crdito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, adems le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que sern gestoras del prstamo que solicita y le ser muy til en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crdito que solicita, invertir en el pago del mantenimiento mecnico y en la compra de repuestos de su carro.
texts.en:
Martha is 35 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a rented house. For the last 2 years she has been in transport services and her principal tool is a car which she has acquired. She offers service to different points in the city. Recently Martha has hired a driver to work all day, so that she and her husband can serve as teachers in an educational center. Each day the work earns them the money they need for their household economy. It also heps them to pay off what they still owe on the car. Martha feels very satisfied to have her taxi income because it permits her to cover many household expenses. In the future, she would like to acquire another car and to continue to work in the same manner. This is Martha's 1st loan with MFP. She is very content to know that she has financial help and appreciates being part of her communal group, because all the members are responsible people who offer solidarity. Martha is grateful to those who supported her loan, which will be very useful in the progress of her business. She will invest her loan in maintenance and replacement parts for her car.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: TO OBTAIN SPARE PARTS AND MECHANICAL MAINTENANCE FOR HER TAXI

loan.name: 16 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La Asociacin Comunal 16 DE JULIO est conformada por nueve personas, ocho mujeres y un varn. Este es su primer ciclo, la presidenta es la seora Eustaquia Santusa Q.. La asociacin es parte del centro focal de Santiago II.
La seora Eustaquia, socia de 51 aos de edad, casada, madre de 5 hijos, tiene como negocio la venta de flores, ella comenta que aprendi este negocio de su madre desde los quince aos.
Ingres a Pro Mujer por invitacin de sus amigas. El crdito le servir para aumentar el capital de trabajo. Compra la mercadera en el mercado Rodrguez que se encuentra en la ciudad de La Paz, para venderlas en la feria, los das: viernes, sbado y domingo por las maanas.
Conversando con la presidenta comenta que lo que ms le gusta de Pro Mujer es la capacitacin y el ahorro. En cuanto a la asociacin comunal, tienen diferentes tipos de negocios de servicio y comercio.
texts.en:
The 16th of July Communal Bank is made up of nine people: eight women and one man. This is their first loan cycle. Ms. Eustaquia is the group's president. This communal bank is part of the Santiago II branch. Ms. Eustaquia is 51 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Her business is selling flowers. She notes that she learned this business from her mother, starting when she was 15 years old. Her friends invited her to join Pro Mujer. She will use this loan to increase her working capital. She buys merchandise in the Rodriguez market in the city of La Paz, then sells the flowers at the fair on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday mornings. When Pro Mujer was speaking with Ms. Eustaquia, she told them that her favorite things about Pro Mujer are the training and savings. The other members of the communal bank have various types of service and commercial businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to buy flowers

loan.name: Roberto Hugo

texts.es: Roberto es un joven muy trabajador, el vive solo, y hace poco tiempo adquiri una vivienda de inters social, poco a poco ah estado acondicionndola para cuando tenga una familia. Roberto trabaja en una constructora y tiene muchas ganas de ver terminada su casa, el requiere este crdito para colocar el Vitro piso de su casa y as tener el y su futura familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roberto is a very hard-working young man. He is single, and through social services he has recently obtained a house that he is arranging little by little in view of having a family one day. Roberto works for a construction company, and is really eager to finish his house. The loan he is requesting will be used to put tiled floors in his house, in order to grant to himself and his future family better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To put tiled floors in his house.

loan.name: Yonny Capri

texts.es:
Yonny Capri P. R. tiene 44 aos. Vive en unin libre en el cantn de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolvar. Tiene 3 nios de 20, 19, y 17 anos.
Yonny es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que est ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maz y cacao. Esto es el primer prstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San Jos.
Yonny se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maz y cacao. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Mata de Cacao y en Babahoya, 2 veces al ao para maz y cada 2 semanas para el cacao.
Solicita el prstamo para comprar insumos para maz, para ingresar pollos y chanchos. No se poda hacer sin el crdito. Su sueo es seguir adelante con su trabajo y terminar de dar estudios a los hijos.
Le gusta jugar indoor futbol y salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Yonny Capri P. R. is 44. He is in a common-law marriage and lives in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. He has 3 children ages 20, 19 and 17. Yonny is a member of the rural solidarity group El Placer, which is located three hours from Chillanes. There are 19 members total, the majority of whom cultivate corn and cocoa. This is their first loan from the Cooperativa San Jose. Yonny is a farmer who grows corn and cocoa. He makes his purchases and sales in Mata de Cacao and in Babahoya, twice per year for corn and every two weeks for cocoa. He is requesting this loan to purchase inputs for corn, and to introduce chickens and pigs. He would not be able to do this without the loan. His dream is to succeed with his work and to finish his children's education. He likes to play indoor soccer and go for walks with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to purchase inputs for corn, and to raise chickens and pigs

loan.name: Edelmira

texts.es: La Seora Edelmira F. tiene una familia muy unida, cuanta con dos hijas ya grandes y su esposo el Seor Facundo. Todos en la familia trabajan para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Quieren mejorar la casa y agrandarla, requieren de este prstamo para construir un cuatro en la parte trasera de la vivienda y as vivir con mas comodidad. Poco a poco le han hecho mejoras a su vivienda, ellos agradecen su apoyo.
texts.en:
Ms. Edelmira F. has a very close-knit family, composed of two adult daughters and her husband, Facundo. The whole family works to contribute getting a better quality of life. As they would like to improve and enlarge their house, the requested loan will be used to build a room in the back of the house that will grant them better living conditions. They have improved their house, little by little, and they are thankful to the lenders for their support.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To build a room.

loan.name: Antonio Francisco

texts.es:
Antonio Francisco G. Z. tiene 45 aos. Vive en unin libre en el cantn de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolvar. Tiene 6 nios de 14, 13, 12, 8, 5, y 3 anos.
Antonio es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que est ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maz y cacao. Esto es el primer prstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San Jos.
Antonio se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maz, cacao, pltano, yuca, y maracuy. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Mata de Cacao cada fin de semana.
Solicita el prstamo para la compra de insumos para sus cultivos para cambiar su economa. Su sueo es poder dar una buena educacin a todos sus hijos.
Le gusta practicar el deporte de indoor futbol.
texts.en:
Antonio Francisco G. Z. is 45. He is in a common-law marriage and lives in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. He has 6 children ages 14, 13, 12, 8, 5 and 3. Antonio is a member of the rural El Placer solidarity group, which is located three hours from Chillanes. There are 19 members in total, the majority of whom cultivate corn and cocoa. This is their first loan with the Cooperativa San Jose. Antonio is a farmer who cultivates corn, cocoa, plantains, yucca and passion fruit. He makes his purchases and sales in Mata de Cacao every weekend. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of inputs for his crops and to change his economic situation. His dream is to be able to give a good education to all of his children. He enjoys playing the sport of indoor soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to invest in the purchase of inputs for his crops

loan.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Jacinta tiene 51 aos D. edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su esposo en el casero San Eloy, una zona rural del distrito D. TambogranD., un distrito agrcola perteneciente a la provincia D. Piura, se caracteriza por producir principalmente frutas, las cuales son vendidas en algunas procesadoras del lugar que manufacturan este producto para exportarlo a diversos pases del exterior. La zona se encuentra ubicada a mas D. tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.
Se dedica a la preparacin y venta D. chicha D. jora (una bebida tpica del pas que se prepara en base a un tipo especial D. harina D. maz), Esta bebida es bastante consumida en la zona, sobretodo en diversas celebraciones y festividades. Adems los trabajadores del lugar la consumen antes D. iniciar sus actividades ya que creen que la bebida les ofrece energa y vigor.
Jacinta ofrece esta bebida acompaada D. diversos platos denominados 'piqueos' los dias sabado, domingo y lunes. El negocio goza D. buena acogida gracias al buen trato que ella brinda a sus clientes. Los ingresos que ella percibe D. esta actividad los utiliza en ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con los gastos econmicos D. su familia.
Jacinta desea adquirir mas insumos para seguir elaborando esta bebida e incrementar sus ventas. Por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr sus metas.
Ella es una mujer tranquila y respetuosa, su mas granD. anhelo es seguir trabajando para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia, en la zona donD. vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer honesta y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Jacinta is 51 years old, she is married and has two children. She lives with her husband in San Eloy, a rural community located in the agricultural district of TambogranD., in the Piura province, which is three hours away from the town of Chiclayo. The main activity of this area is the production of fruit that is then sold to some local food processors manufacturing this product to export it abroad. Jacinta engages in producing and selling chica D. jora (a typical drink of the area prepared with a special kind of maize flour). This is a fairly consumed drink in the area, especially during the various holidays and celebrations. On top of this, local workers drink it before starting to work, because they believe this drink gives energy and strength. Jacinta offer this drink together with different appetizers called piqueos on Saturdays, Sundays and Mondays. Her activity enjoys a good reputation thanks to the good way she treats her customers. She uses the money she earns from this activity to help her husband, a farmer, cope with the economic expenses of their family. Jacinta wishes to buy more ingredients to keep on preparing this drink and increase her sales. For this reason, and for the first time, she has requested a loan of 1000 PEN to Edpyme Altenativa in order to reach her goals. She is a calm and respectful woman, whose biggest desire is to keep on working to improve her familys quality of life. In the area where she lives she is known by neighbors and acquaintances for being a honest and hard-working woman.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy ingredients to prepare chicha and to enlarge her stall.

loan.name: Jesus Hector

texts.es: El seor Jess Hctor cuenta con dos trabajos, uno es en una empresa donde trabaja todos los das y el otro trabajo es de fin de semana, el Seor Jess Hctor lucha por darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El requiere de la impermeabilizacin de el techo de su vivienda, ya que con las lluvias intensas que han Cado en la cuidad se ah daado considerablemente. El seor Jess solo quiere lo mejor para su familia. Y agradece sinceramente el apoyo.
texts.en:
Mr. Jess Hctor has two jobs: he works in a company during the week, and has another job for the weekend. Jess Hctor struggles for his family to offer them better life conditions. The loan he is requesting will be used to waterproof the roof of his house, as the heavy rains that fell on the city have severely damaged it. Jess only wants what is best for his family, and he is sincerely thankful for the offered support.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To waterproof the roof of his house.

loan.name: Luis Estalin

texts.es:
Luis Estalin S. R. tiene 27 aos. Vive en unin libre en el cantn de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolvar. Tiene 4 ninos de 7 meses hasta 8 anos.
Luis es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que est ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maz y cacao. Esto es el primer prstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San Jos.
Luis se dedica a la agricultura y al cultivo de cacao. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Mata de Cacao 2 veces por mes.
Solicita el prstamo para criar los pollos y chancos. Su sueo es sacar adelante una casa y los estudios de los nios.
Le gusta jugar el deporte del indor futbol.
texts.en:
Luis Estalin S. R. is 27. He is in a common law marriage and lives in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. He has 4 children from 7 months to 8 years. He is a member of the rural El Placer solidarity group, which is located three hours from Chillanes. There are 19 members in total, the majority of whom cultivate corn and cocoa. This is their first loan with the Cooperativa San Jose. Luis is a farmer who cultivates cocoa. He makes his purchases and sales in Mata de Cacao twice a month. He is requesting this loan for raising chickens and pigs. His dream is to get ahead with a home and his children's studies. He enjoys playing the sport of indoor soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: chickens and pigs

loan.name: Soledad

texts.es: La Seora Soledad es una persona trabajadora y con muchos nimos de hacer crecer su negocio, ella y su esposo tienen un local en donde venden ropa usada y aparatos electrnicos, viven solos en su vivienda y son una pareja muy unidos, ellos requieren de este crdito para invertir en su negocio, La seora Soledad quiere comprar mas mercanca para la venta y as incrementar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Soledad is a hard-working woman with a great desire to make her activity grow. She and her husband own a stall where they sell used clothes and electrical appliances. They live alone in their house and they are very close as a couple. They will use the requested loan to invest in their activity. Soledad wants to buy more products to sell in order to increase their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To increase her working capital.

loan.name: Alfredo

texts.es: El seor Alfredo N. Sols, es un hombre muy trabajador, el vive con uno de sus hijos y se ayudan en los gastos de la casa, ellos quieren una mejor calidad de vida y requiere de este crdito para reparar un techo de madera de su vivienda, ya que con las lluvias tan intensas que han cado, el techo esta muy daado y temen que con la humedad que guarda la madera ocurra un accidente y se pueda caer. El Seor Alfredo les agradece la ayuda que le brindan por que de verdad que si necesita la reparacion de este techo.
texts.en:
Alfredo N. Sols is a very hard-working man. He lives with one of his children, and they both help with household expenses. They want a better quality of life, and he needs the loan to repair the wooden roof of their home, since with the recent intense rainfalls the roof is quite damaged and they fear that with the humidity in the roof, there will be an accident and the roof could fall.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Repair of a wooden roof

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Purchase balanced feed for improved animal production

loan.name: Arturo

texts.es: El seor Arturo R. es un hombre muy emprendedor, que quiere el bienestar de su familia, el seor Arturo es albail y el mismo con ahorros le ah hecho muchas mejoras a su vivienda. Tiene una familia muy unida. El requiere de este credito para la instalacion de el drenaje en su localidad, ya que no cuentan con este servicio tan necesario para su familia, El seor Arturo siempre esta al pendiente del bienestar de su familia. y el les agradece su apoyo.
texts.en:
Arturo is a very entrepreneurial man who wishes for his familys well-being. Arturo is a mason. He himself has made many improvements to his home with savings. He has a very close family. He needs this loan to install drainage in his area since his family does not have this much needed service. Arturo is always on the lookout for his familys well-being and he thanks you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Drainage Installation

loan.name: Ma De Los Angeles

texts.es: La seora Ma de los ngeles cuenta con un negocio de venta de ropa usada, desde hace 16 aos, este negocio ah permanecido gracias al empeo que ella ah puesto. En esta ocasin la seora Ma de los ngeles requiere de este crdito para la compra de juguetes para la venta que ella tiene. La seora quiere hacer crecer el negocio, incrementar las ventas y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria de los Angeles has a business selling used clothing. The business has stayed open for the past 16 years thanks to her efforts. Maria de los Angeles is requesting a loan to buy toys to sell in her store. She wants to grow her business, increase sales and provide a better quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Investment in the business

loan.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda E. is from the village of Balugo, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 46 years old. Luzviminda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Luzviminda raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Luzviminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be the second loan taken out by Luzviminda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loan.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel B. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 40 years old. Richel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Richel owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice like "masipag" for sale. (Masipag rice is grown using green methods.) Richel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2010, Richel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Richel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Richel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.
About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loan.name: Alice E

texts.en: Alice E T. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 45 years old. Alice E is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Alice E raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice like "bordagol" and "mimis" for sale. Alice E has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Alice E joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alice E has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Alice E is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Alice E from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loan.name: Nilda Rosa

texts.es:
En Jacinto la tierra de las artesanias y hamacas en el departamento de Bolvar, vive Nilda L. O.,con su conyuge y sus tres hijos de 17 a 26 aos de edad.Su negocio es elaborar artesanias como hamacas, sandalias mochilas y todo lo que desarrolle su creatividad natural. Aprendi esta actividad por tradicin familiar, se dedica a ella desde hace 35 aos y es justamente lo que la ha ayudado a sostener su hogar y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Desde que empez a acceder a crditos con la Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo, su negocio logr cambios favorables, porque le ha permitido adicionar un nuevo capital de trabajo, generndole mayores oportunidades de bienestar familiar por ejemplo la educacin de sus hijos, que estn en la universidad estudiando derecho y licenciatura en ciencias sociales; tambin le ha permitido en el arreglo de su vivienda,que aunque es propia la ha levantado poco a poco al lado de su cnyuge. Este es su cuarto crdito con esta organizacin y lo invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboracin de artesanas y algunas sandalias que tiene encargadas.
Sus mayor desafo lo vivi hace 10 aos cuando su esposo no tena trabajo estable y se mantenan subsistiendo con pocos ingresos y mucho trabajo por parte de ella, pero todo les ha cambiado, porque con su negocio les va bien, viven en un barrio rodeado de comerciantes de artesanas, competencia que los impulsa da a da y sus vecinos son trabajadores del campo y personas conocidas y muy familiares, lo que genera gran tranquilidad y una dinmica social saludable.
texts.en:
Nilda L. O. lives with her husband and three children between the ages of 17 and 26. They in in Jacinto, land of crafts and hammocks in the department of Bolivar. Her business is making crafts such as hammocks, sandals, bags and anything that her natural creativity inspires. These skills were passed down by her family and for 35 years have helped maintain her home and help her children succeed. Since she started receiving loans from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo her business has changed for the better, since they allowed her access to working capital. This generated better conditions for the family such as education for her children, who are in college studying law and social sciences. It has also allowed her to improve her home that she built little by little with her husband. This is her fourth loan with this organization and she will invest in in the purchase of materials to make crafts and sandals for which she has orders. She faced her greatest challenge 10 years ago when her husband didn't have a stable job and the family lived on her modest income and hard work. Today all that has changed, the business is thriving and they live in a neighborhood surrounded by craft businesses. This competition motivates them daily. Many neighbors are agricultural workers, well known and friendly, which creates and secure atmosphere and a healthy social interaction.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase materials such as thread and other materials needed for crafts and to fill orders for sandals

loan.name: Sari Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
Ni Luh K. is a 46-year-old female living in the town of Melaya - Bali. Ni Luh is the group leader of a 17-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Sari Pertiwi (PK-10235).
Ni Luh is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ni Luh owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Ni Luh has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 300,000 IDR a month from these activities.
In 2010, Ni Luh joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Luh is requesting a loan from MUK for the first time. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 IDR, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from MUK. Ni Luh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.
About MUK:
The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.
Ni Luh K. (0) merupakan 46 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Ni Luh adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 17 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Sari Pertiwi (PK-10235).
Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Luh sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Luh menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 IDR. Dalam 2010, Ni Luh bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Luh meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR.
Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.
Tentang MUK:
Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.
"

loan.use: To invest in expanding the business

loan.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry P. is from the village of Nipaan. She is 34 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cherry operates a family member's business selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Cherry has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Cherry joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherry has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Cherry is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fishing equipment. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Cherry from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to purchase additional fishing equipment

loan.name: Germalyn

texts.en: Germalyn L. is from the village of Manukan. She is 24 years old, single and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Germalyn owns and operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Germalyn is just starting this business. In 2010,Germalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Germalyn is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Germalyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loan.name: Flamboyan Group

texts.en:
Ni Kadek C. D. is a 25-year-old female living in the town of Melaya - Bali. Ni Kadek is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Flamboyan (PK-10220).
Ni Kadek is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Ni Kadek owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Ni Kadek has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 150,000 IDR a month from these activities.
In 2010, Ni Kadek joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Kadek has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from MUK. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. She is now requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the second loan taken out by Ni Kadek from MUK. Ni Kadek plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.
About MUK:
The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.
Ni Kadek C. D. (0) merupakan 25 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Ni Kadek adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 11 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Flamboyan (PK-10220).
Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Kadek sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Kadek menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR. Dalam 2010, Ni Kadek bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Kadek telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1,000,000 IDR dari MUK. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,000,000 IDR.
Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.
Tentang MUK:
Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.
"

loan.use: To purchase pigs to raise and sell

loan.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en:
Gantsetseg O. is 24 years old and lives with her husband, daughter and parents-in-law in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger a traditional housing tent.
Three months ago, Gantsetseg began her construction materials business, specializing in selling lights for household use, at Jobi one of the biggest construction markets in Ulaanbaatar city. Now her daily sales range between 125,000 and 150,000 MNT. Gantsetseg is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more products in order to increase her business working capital.

loan.use: To purchase inventory

loan.name: Guillerma

texts.en: Guillerma C. is from the village of Manukan. She is 62 years old, married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Guillerma owns and operates a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Guillerma has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Guillerma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guillerma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Guillerma is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Guillerma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loan.name: Batsuh

texts.en: Batsuh T. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and son in their own ger a traditional housing tent in Hovd province, western Mongolia. His wife works as a tailor while he operates a carpentry business in their town. Batsuh has been working as a carpenter since 2005 and over this period, he has earned the loyalty of his customers because of the quality of his work and service. His business is more profitable in the summertime than in the cold season. In the future, Batsuh would like to own his own carpentry shop and expand his product line in order to grow his customer base. He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more timber for his growing business.

loan.use: To purchase more timber

loan.name: Jovita

texts.en:
