She buys bags of charcoal from delivery vans at her home and so doesnt have to pay for transport costs. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. Rose doesnt incur any rent for her business. Her business challenge is seasonality because she works from a muddy place so when it rains her customers dont reach out to her. She resides in, and owns, a three-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes food and school fees.

loan.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loan.name: Josiane Clarisse

texts.fr: A. Josiane Clarisse est ne le 05 Mars 1969 et vit depuis quarante et un an Aylawadj Cotonou, capitale conomique du Bnin. Josiane Clarisse est marie MICHOZOUNOU Jean, un enseignant. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolariss. Josiane Clarisse vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Pour venir en aide son mari dans les diverses charges du mnage, Josiane Clarisse vend du charbon de bois et de faon secondaire, de l'huile d'arachide son domicile. Josiane Clarisse a dj bnfici de deux crdits qui ont t tous bien rembourss. Dans le but d'lever le niveau de son activit et de mieux rpondre la demande de sa clientle, Josiane Clarisse sollicite auprs de ALID, un troisime prt.
texts.en:
Josiane Clarisse A. was born on March 5, 1961; she has been living in the Aylawadj district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for 41 years. Josiane Clarisse is married to Jean Michozounou, a teacher. They have four children, all attending school. Josiane Clarisse lives together with her husband and children. To help her husband support the family, Josiane Clarisse sells charcoal and, as a secondary activity, peanut oil out of her home. Josiane Clarisse already received two loans in the past and repaid them well. With the goal of expanding her business and better respond to customer demand, Josiane Clarisse is seeking a third loan from ALID.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchasing bags of charcoal and cans of peanut oil

loan.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The borrower is 30 years old, married and has four children. She graduated from a literacy program.
The borrower is a tailor. She will use this loan to purchase a new sewing machine, an embroidery machine, and cloth. The borrower has a much experience in sewing and a fine reputation in the area. Many clients go to her.
The borrower has an enormous ambition to develop her business in the future to attract more clients.

loan.use: To buy a sewing machine, an embroidery machine, and cloth

loan.name: Lucie

texts.fr:
Lucie Mukarytabana est une fille de 28 ans, ne Kicukiro - Kigali, province de Kigali du Rwanda. Elle est clibataire, elle a habite a Kicukiro. son niveau dducation est primaire
Concernant son activit, elle est commerante des produits des charbons Kigali, elle a une exprience de 5 ans dans ce domaine et. Le crdit contract avec ACB est son premier prt. Dans lavenir, elle veut continuer ses tudes car elle a suspendu en troisime anne secondaire par manque du minerval, elle pourra avoir une valeur et se marier ensuite.
texts.en:
Lucie Mukarytabana is a 28-year-old girl who was born in Kicukiro Kigali, a province of Kigali in Rwanda. She is single and lives in Kicukiro. She has an elementary school education. She sells coal products in Kigali, which she has been doing for 5 years. The loan she has with ACB is her first. In the future, shed like to continue her studies, because she stopped attending middle school due to lack of funds to pay the fees. She will thus have value and be able to marry.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy 16 bags of coal to resell

loan.name: Jacques

texts.fr: Monsieur Jacques F. est un agent de scurit g de 27 ans. Il mne en parallle de llevage de porcs. Ainsi pour dvelopper cette activit, elle souhaitait un prt de 100 000 FCFA quelques btes. Monsieur Jacques F., clibataire, compte beaucoup sur cette activit pour diversifier et augmenter ses revenus afin de rgler ses besoins et ceux de ses proches parents qui attendent beaucoup de lui
texts.en:
Mr. Jacques F., aged 27, is a security guard. Concurrently, he has a business raising pigs. To develop this business, he would therefore like a loan of 100,000 francs CFA for a few animals. Jacques is unmarried and is counting very much on this business to diversify and increase his revenues in order to cover his needs and those of his parents, who expect a lot of him.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying pigs

loan.name: Kweyamba Womens Group 3-Namawojjolo -Lugazi

texts.en: N. Christine, 28, earns her living waiting for travelers to buy bottled fruit juices and chicken from her stand. It is not always a rosy picture! One has to have reserves of resilience to succeed in this business. Anyone who has traversed the Kampala-Jinja highway will bear witness to the stiff competition that exists at this popular stop-over for refreshments. Christine is now four years into this business and says she has managed to give one of her young children an education out of the profits. In a week she makes close to 45,000 shillings, and is anticipating better prospects with the acquisition of this loan. Through the sale of more bottled soft drinks and roast chicken she will be able to earn more money.

loan.use: Buy more bottled soft drinks and roast chicken to sell

loan.name: Mukono Womens Crafts Enterprise Group

texts.en:
Faith N. is 57 years old, still energetic, resourceful, agile, focused and down to earth. Despite her single status at her late age, she has not wavered in her dreams and aspirations of improving the livelihood and welfare status of her family. With a lot of wisdom, forethought and experience to bank on, for the last five years she has been making significant and steady strides in her local crafts-selling business in Butebe-Mukono.
Having obtained her niche in the local market with 200,000 shillings as weekly profits, she is now taking a long view, anticipating that she will in the future be able to export some of her local crafts, such as mats, baskets and chairs. Her customers cut across from travelers to university students and family people.
Faith is proud of her five children with only one still in school. It is the reason why she views their education as an invaluable responsibility that she has to shoulder by all means necessary. With this loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like sisal and bamboo to make more chairs, mats and baskets.

loan.use: The purchase of raw materials for making her products, like sisal and bamboo

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To purchase more fufu, rice and oil to sell

loan.name: Mdoune

texts.fr: Monsieur Mdoune D. est sa troisime demande de prt. Il sollicitait un montant de 400 000 FCFA. Cest un grand commerant et gre son propre magasin sis en face Hpital This. Il vend des matriels lectroniques, des matelas et divers produits. Avec ce prt, Monsieur D. g de 32 ans veut renforcer son commerce en achetant beaucoup de produits.
texts.en:
M. Mdoune D. is asking for his third loan, in the amount of CFA 400,000. He has his own store across from the hospital in This, selling electronics, mattresses and other goods. With this loan he plans to grow his business, increasing his inventory greatly.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Build inventory of a variety of products

loan.name: Prosperity Group

texts.en:
Oretha S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Prosperity. She is 32 years old, is married and has three children who range from 5 to 15 years old. Oretha was only able to attend school through 10th grade due to lack of financial support.
For six years, Oretha has been selling palm oil, rice, onions, tomatoes and beans in Chicken Soup Factory Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.
Oretha plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more gallons of palm oil, rice, onions, salt and beans. She describes herself as a devoted woman. Her goal is to improve her business, build a house, and continue to educate her children.
in the photo that accompanies this profile, Esther is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loan.use: To buy more gallons of palm oil, rice, onions, salt and beans to sell

loan.name: Ubumwe Group

texts.fr:
Jacqueline N. est une commerante ge de 30 ans qui habite la Commune urbaine de Musaga en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce de produits vivriers de boutique comme le riz, le haricot, et autres articles au march de Musaga depuis 2003. Elle a fait ses tudes primaires jusquen 6e anne. Elle a aussi fait une formation artisanale en cuisine sanctionne par un Diplme. Son mari, Eric N. est un chauffeur mais exerce aussi le commerce dhuile de palme en provenance du Sud- Est du Burundi dans la ville appele Rumonge.Jacqueline vend ce produit cot des articles de boutique quelle vend aux clients. Elle tait employe de Restaurant avant de commencer cette activit. Elle arrive au 12e cycle dans le crdit communautaire avec Turame.
Elle est mre de 3 enfants ; 2 filles et un garon gs respectivement de 12ans, 7ans et 4ans.
Elle demande le crdit Kiva pour acheter de grandes quantits des produits vivriers de boutique mais aussi varier son business en achetant des pommes de terre lintrieur du pays pour les revendre aux clients. Elle espre quavec du bnfice gnr de ce crdit dans le futur, elle sera mesure dacheter une parcelle pour construire sa propre maison, assurer la scolarit de ses enfants et tre une grande commerante qui travaille avec son propre capital.
Elle est une des membres du groupe communautaire Ubumwe .
texts.en:
Jacqueline N. is a 30 year-old shop-keeper who lives in the urban commune of Musaga in the town of Bujumbura. She has sold food products such as rice, beans etc at the Musaga market since 2003. She studied up to sixth grade, and took a cooking apprenticeship for which she was awarded a diploma. Her husband, Eric N. is a driver, but also sells palm oil from the south-east of Burundi in a town called Rumonge. Jacqueline sells this alongside her other products. She worked in a restaurant before setting up her business. She is on the 12th cycle of a community credit programme with Turame. She is the mother of three children - two girls and a boy, aged 12, 7 and 4, respectively. She is seeking a Kiva loan in order to purchase large quantities of food products, but also to diversify her business by buying potatoes from inland to sell to customers. She hopes to use the profits earned in order to purchase her own plot of land in future where she may build her own house, in order to see to her children's schooling and also to become a successful businesswomen who works with her own capital. She is a member of the 'Ubumwe' community group.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to purchase large quantities of food products, but also to diversify her business by purchasing potatoes from inland to sell to her customers

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: purchasing a carpet frame

loan.name: Faith In Christ Group

texts.en:
Janneh A., who is holding the sign, is the leader of Faith in Christ Group. She is 25 years old and has a 4-year-old child. Janneh completed the 10th grade before leaving school when she had her child.
Janneh sells drinks, fried fish, and chicken at New Georgia Junction. She began her business six years ago when her mother gave her 2,000 Liberian dollars. Her goal is to expand her business to include other areas of town.

loan.use: To buy oil, flour, and coal for her business

loan.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 35-year-old married man with four kids from Lebanon and has been working with scrap iron and haberdashery since 2006. Mohamad requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to do the necessary maintenance on his pickup in order to keep it safe as long as he needs it. This is Mohamads fifth loan with Al Majmoua; in the last four cycles he has maintained a good credit record and never missed any payment.

loan.use: To do the necessary maintenance on his pickup

loan.name: Kuwoe Group

texts.en:
Sarah S., shown holding the sign, is the leader of Kuwoe Group. This 36-year-old mother of six children between the ages of 2 and 16, several of whom are enrolled in school from kindergarten to sixth grade, completed the sixth grade before Liberia's Civil War interrupted her education and she began having children.

Sarah sells a variety of personal-use products such as lotion, hair care products, and baby care products at the New Georgia Junction. She began her business eight years ago using 5,000 Liberian Dollars that her friends gave her. She will use her 4,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 21,000 Liberian Dollar loan to purchase additional inventory to sell including lotion, hair products, deodorant, and slippers.

Sarah's goal is to build a shop, buy land, and educate all of her children.

loan.use: To purchase personal hygiene products, baby care products, and slippers to sell

loan.name: Kind Yvette

texts.fr: A. Kind Yvette est ne en 1967 Ouidah, ville historique du Bnin. Yvette est veuve et mre de trois enfants, tous scolariss. Il y a prs de dix sept ans que Yvette habite le quartier Akpakpa Cotonou, capitale conomique du Bnin, avec ses enfants. Yvette a un autre enfant sa charge, en plus de ses enfants. Yvette vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule ses diffrentes charges. Pour y arriver, Yvette prpare et vend de la nourriture (pte de mas et riz accompagn de sauce) Cotonou. Yvette s'approvisionne Dantokpa, march international du Bnin. Yvette exerce cette activit depuis une dizaine d'anne et a dj bnfici de quatre crdits qui ont t tous bien rembourss. Face l'accroissement de sa clientle, Yvette dsire rehausser le niveau de son activit et mieux satisfaire sa clientle.
texts.en:
Kind Yvette A. was born in 1967 in Ouidah, an historic town in Benin. Yvette is a widow with three school-aged children. She has lived in the Akpakpa quarter of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, with her children for almost 17 years. She has another child in her care as well as her own, and sees to their needs by herself. To do so, she prepares and sells food (corn and rice with sauce) in Cotonou. Yvette sources her goods from Dantokpa, Benin's international market, and has been in this line of work for around ten years. She has already received four loans which have all been successfully repaid. In light of rapid growth in her customer base, Yvette wishes to boost her business proposition and better satisfy those customers.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of corn, rice, and condiments and sauce

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy more palm oil, rice, onions, tomatoes, pepper, salt and beans to sell

loan.name: Gertrude Matilde

texts.fr: femme de 40ans,marie et mre 4 enfants dont l'ge varie de 20ans 5ans et dont 4 sont scolariser. ayant un niveau secondaire et ayant 8 personnes charge elle se lana dans le commerce d'alimentation en 2001 avec un capital de 50000.Son revenu moyen est de 100000frs par jour. Avec ce prt elle compte renforcer son activit en achetant des cartons de bite de lait, bote de conserve(exeter,bull boeuf,rio),pte alimentaire,sucre,friandise,jus de fruit(ceres) et d'autres produits de premiers necessit. pour l'avancement de son activit elle pargne tout les jours, avoir un bon acceuil,s'efforce avoir un bon tallage et cela en dpit de la hausse des prix des marchandises sur le march. son ambition est d'avoir une gande boutique si possible en avoir plusieurs dans la ville afin d'tre grossiste dans les jours futurs. son plus grand rve est d'amliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants afin qu'il poursuivent leur tudes et s'aqurir d'un terrain. dans son quartier estune bonne femme.
texts.en:
This lady is a 40 year-old married mother of four, whose children are aged 5 to 20, and four of whom attend school. Having completed secondary education and with 8 dependents, she entered the food retail business in 2001 with initial capital of 50,000 FRS. Her daily revenue is now 10,000 FRS. She aims to use this loan to boost her business by purchasing boxes of milk, jars of jam (exeter, bull beef and rio), pasta, sugar, biscuits, fruit juice and other staple foods. She saves money every day in order to help grow her business and so that she will have a good display of goods for potential customers, despite a rise in prices. Her goal is to have a large shop, and if possible eventually several others in the town, so that she can be a wholesaler in future. Her dream is to improve her children's living conditions so that they can continue their studies, and also to buy a plot of land. She is seen as a good woman in her quarter.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of biscuits, jars of jam, milk and sugar

loan.name: Bossou

texts.fr: Ne en Avril 1977, BOSSOU A. vit depuis trente trois ans au quartier Xwlacodji Cotonou, capitale conomique du Bnin. A. est marie ANATO Vincent, un couturier. Le couple a quatre enfants charge, dont trois sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolariss et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents Xwlacodji. Les charges de la famille sont assures ensemble par le couple. A. n'a pas frquent l'cole, mais a appris la coiffure. A. a son atelier de coiffure situ dans son quartier et y vend galement divers produits de coiffure. A. achte ses produits Dantokpa, march international du Bnin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALID, ayant obtenu antrieurement six crdits qui ont t tous bien rembourss. A. dsire agrandir davantage son atelier et mieux rpondre aux exigences de sa clientle ; raison pour laquelle A. sollicite un autre prt. Plus tard, A. envisage acqurir une parcelle.
texts.en:
A. Bossou was born in April,1977, and for 33 years has lived in the Xwlacodji neighborhood of Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. She is married to Vincent Anato, a tailor. They care for four children, including three of their own. All the children have been to school and still live with the family in Xwlacodji. Together, the couple pays for the family's expenses. A. didn't go to school, but learned hairdressing. She has a neighborhood salon, and also sells hair care products that she buys at Dantokpa, Benin's international trade center. She has repaid six previous loans from ALID. A. wants to increase the size of her salon so she can better meet customer demand. For that reason, she's asking for another loan. In future, she plans to buy a building lot.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy hair care products

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: purchasing sewing materials and a new machine

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy more fish to sell

loan.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is married to a taxi driver with whom she has eight children; only four of her children go to school. She doesnt take care of additional family members. She sells cold drinks in Mulago market. She sells cold drinks like soda, orange juice, passion fruit juice and water. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.
Aisha has been in this business for over five years. She wants to use this loan to buy more baskets of passion fruit, oranges, crates of soda and boxes of mineral water. She sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale. She buys these baskets of oranges and passion fruit from Kalerwe market and uses motorcycles to and from shopping. Crates of soda and boxes of mineral water are bought at her place of work by delivery vans. Her business challenge is the rainy season. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big so that she can get enough profit to buy another plot of land.
Aisha decided to join MCDT because she wanted capital to start her business. Aisha resides in and owns a four-roomed house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses includes food and school fees.

loan.use: To buy more crates of soda, boxes of mineral water, and baskets of oranges and passion fruit

loan.name: Patrick Arnaud Gildas

texts.fr: Jeune commercant de 36 ans, apres ses etudes universitaires a l'obtention de sa licence en economie, il se lance dans le commerce des Poissons de mer fumes, comme les Harengs et Maquerelles. Avec la somme de 50000frs une partie de sa bourse quand il etait etudiant, il achete 2 cartons de poissons fumes et loue une table et commence a vendre dans le grand marche de brazzzaville, chose etrange , le poisson fume dans ce marche n'est vendu que par les femmes. il se fait plusieurs clients , parcequ'il etait le seul homme, et par jour il peut vendre 80000 a 100000frs parceque ce genre de poisson fume est tres apprecie par les habitants du Congo , tres moins chere et disponible pour toute les couches de la populations. Avec ce pret il pense acheter 50 cartons de harengs et 10 de maquerelles, puisqu'il s'approvisionne chez les Beninois qui font la peche a Pointe -Noire, et chaque semaine il doit envoyer de l'argent pour avoir du poisson au lieu de cela il fera ses commandes au moins deux fois le mois. Il pense lui meme dans peu de temps acheter beaucoup en se faisant fournisseurs aupres des vendeuses du marche et faire aussi la vente en detail en meme temps.Tres aimable tout le monde l'appelle papa gentil
texts.en:
This young 36-year-old merchant, who obtained a degree in Economics upon completing his university studies, started a business selling smoked fish such as herring and mackerel. Using 50,000 francs of his scholarship money from when he was a student, he bought two boxes of smoked fish, rented a table, and started selling at the great market of Brazzaville. Oddly, smoked fish is typically sold only by women at this market. Being the only man involved in this activity, he got many customers. He was able to achieve sales of 80,000 to 100,000 francs per day as the people of Congo really appreciate this type of smoked fish, and because it is much more affordable and available to all segments of the population. With this loan, he plans to buy 50 boxes of herring and 10 boxes of mackerel. He gets his stocks from the Beninese, who fish in Pointe-Noire, and each week he has to send money to get fish. Otherwise, he places orders at least twice a month. In the short term, he plans to increase his stocks of smoked fish and become a supplier for the ladies who sell it at the market, while continuing with his own sales. He is very likable and everyone calls him papa gentil (nice daddy).

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase 50 boxes of smoked fish such as herring and mackerels

loan.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is married with six children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She owns a stall at her home in Bwaise, selling bananas and charcoal. She buys bunches of bananas from delivery vans which get them from villages of Masaka. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas and bags of charcoal.
Farida first dealt only in bananas but with additional loans from MCDT, she started investing in charcoal. She works in a semi-urban area of Bwaise in Kawempe Division, Kampala district. She has been in this banana business for over six years. Besides this banana business she has rental rooms.
Farida works seven days a week. Her business challenges are thieves and seasonality. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big and starting going to farmers in Masaka district. She decided to work with MCDT because she wanted additional capital. Farida resides in and owns a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses includes food and school fees

loan.use: To buy more bunches of bananas and bags of charcoal

loan.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 44-year-old married man with three school-age children. He has many years of experience working as a car electrician and car electronics seller. And in 2003, he opened his own shop in his town to earn his own profit. After opening his shop, he noticed that his family economic situation was improved and hes thankful for this. He has taken a first loan and he has been a reliable borrower, with on-time repayments throughout his loan cycle. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more car electronics equipment in order to grow his business into other areas. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. About Ameen: Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in microfinance. At Ameen s.a.l., we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loan.use: Purchase more car electrical equipment

loan.name: Sophie

texts.fr: Femme commercante de 54 ans,veuve avec 3 enfants dont l'age varient entre 18 et 24 ans. En 1994 elle perd son mari et pour faire face aux difficultes de sa nouvelle vie de veuve, elle se lance dans la vente des produits divers avec la somme de 50.000frs qu'on lui avait donnee pour les condeleances lors du deces de son mari Elle a des revenus de 30000 a 50000 frs par jour, puisque la majorite de ses clients sont ceux les femmes Ouest Africaines tel que les Beninoises,les Maliennes... qui fabriquent du jus de gingembre et le jus de Bissap et elle s'approvisionne aux grossistes de la place . Ses fournisseurs de bissap sont les grossistes aui Avec le pret qu'elle compte recevoir , elle va acheter des sacs de Bissaps, gingembre, sucre, des aromes , de la vanille et des sacs de farine. Elle pense agrandir son etalage et faire beaucoup d'epargne pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, prendre en charge les etudes de ses enfants et a la longue acheter un terrain pour ses enfants . Dans le quartier tout le monde l'apprecie , et est tres celebre dans le grand marche ou elle passe tout son temps.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur is a 54-year old widow, with three children between 18 and 24 years of age. She had lost her husband in 1994 and, in order to adjust to the challenges of her new life as a widow, she launched a business retailing miscellaneous items, using as a starting capital the 50,000 West African francs she had received as condolence gift. Her revenue ranges from 30,000 to 50,000 per day; most of her clients are West African women (coming, for example, from Benin or Mali) who produce ginger juice and bissap [hibiscus] juice. She purchases from local wholesalers. Her bissap suppliers are also wholesalers. With this expected loan, she plans to purchase bags of bissap, ginger, sugar, flavorings, vanilla and bags of flour. She intends to expand her business and put a big part of money away as savings in order to meet her family needs, pay for her childrens education, and, in the long term, purchase a land plot for her children. She is well liked in her neighborhood, and very well known at the big market where she spends all of her time.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchasing bags of ginger, sugar,bissap,flavorings,vanilla and flour

loan.name: Ines Sylvie

texts.fr:
Femme de 38ans celibataire et mre de 2 enfants dont l'ge varie de 5ans 3 mois, 1 enfant est scolaris. aprs son bac, n'ayant pas de soutien financier pour poursuivre ses tudes, elle s'est lanc dans le commerce de petite patisserie depuis 2003. avec ce prt elle veut renforcer son activit en achetant deux sacs de farine, un sac du sucre,de la levure chimique, dela vanille, des boites de margarine, un sac de 25 kg de sucre, plus un bidon d'huile.
Elle a plusieurs strategies pour faire ecouler sa marchandise; elle fait des livraisons des ses cakes,madeleines, gauffres et brioches dans les boutiques environnants, au marche et elle vend aussi a domicile. A l'avenir elle pense a ouvrir une patisserie ou elle pourrait employer 2 ou 3 personnes, et vac ses epargnes elle veut soutenir sa famille et les etudes de ses enfants. Femme tres calme, elle a bon temoignage dans son quartier et a l'eglise ou elle communie.
texts.en:
This 38-year-old woman is a single mother of two children, a 3-month-old and a 5-year-old who attends school. After obtaining her bachelors degree, she had no financial support to continue with her studies. She started selling small pastries in 2003. She wants to use this loan to strengthen her activities by buying two bags of flour, baking powder, vanilla, containers of margarine, a 25kg bag of sugar, and a can of oil. She uses different strategies for a quick turnover: she delivers her cakes, madeleines, waffles and sweet rolls in the neighboring shops, at the market, and she also sells baked goods from her home. In the future, she plans to open a pastry shop and hire two or three employees. She wants to use her savings to support her family and pay for her childrens tuition. She is a quiet woman with a good reputation around her neighborhood and at the church where she receives communion.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase flour, sugar, milk, butter, vanilla, and vanilla sugar

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: increase his shop inventory

loan.name: Adrienne

texts.fr: Femme commercante de 47 ans, mariee et mere de 4 enfants est en activite depuis son jeune age, quand elle assistait sa mere a vendre , elle prit gout au commerce de la friperie et a l'arret de ses etudes en classe de troisieme , elle commenca elle meme aussi a vendre de la friperie Elle a une vente journaliere de 25.000 a 30.000frs par jour,et s'approvisionne dans les grands depots et magasins de la place ou chez les grossistes qui vont acheter a Matadi en RDC. Des que le pret lui ai octroye, elle compte renforcer son commerce en achetant des ballots de serviettes, draps, couvre lits et rideaux et peignoirs non utilises Ses strategies de vente sont tres remarquables, elle fait laver les draps et serviettes non utilises et fait des livraisons dans les administrations et domiciles de series de serviettes, et lots de draps classes par rapport a la taille et aux couleurs A l'avenir elle pense ouvrir une ou plusieurs boutiques dans les differents quartiers de Brazzaville et cela va l'aider a epargner plus et prendre en charge la scolarite de ses enfants pour qu'ils puissent faire des etudes universitaires Tres connue dans le quartier, elle fait la fierte de son mari
texts.en:
Adrienne K. is a 47 year-old retailer. She is married and the mother of 4 children. She has been in business from a young age, when she helped her mother with her sales. She developed a liking for second-hand clothing and at the end of her junior high school studies, she also began to sell secondhand clothing. Her daily sales are from 25,000 to 30,000 francs and she gets her supplies in the storehouses and department stores in the area or from the wholesalers who go to buy in Matadi in the Democratic Republic of Congo. Once the loan is granted, she plans to expand her business by purchasing bundles of unused towels, sheets, bedspreads, curtains and robes. Her sales strategy is very remarkable. She has the unused sheets and towels washed and delivers sets of towels and bundles of sheets sorted by size and color to offices and homes. She is thinking of opening one or more shops in various districts of Brazzaville. That will help her to save more and to provide for the education of her children so that they will be able to get a university education. Very well known in the neighborhood, her husband is proud of her.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy bundles of unused towels, sheets, bedspreads, curtains and robes

loan.name: Maranatta Sisters For Development Group

texts.en:
Mercy G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Maranatta Sisters For Development. She is 35 years old, is single, and has three children who range from 9 to 18 years old. Mercy was only able to attend school through 6th grade due to lack of financial support.
For twenty years, Mercy has been selling cosmetics in Chicken Soup Factory Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 4,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 26,500 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more cosmetics to sell.
Mercy describes herself as a serviceable woman. Her dream is to improve her business and continue to educate her children.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, Amelia is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loan.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loan.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia G. is currently in the business of selling dried fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil, onions and tomatoes to sell. Nadia is 31 years old and is married to a husband who is a teacher. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

loan.use: Stock cooking oil, onions and tomatoes to sell

loan.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret D. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and local brew out of her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Margret is 50 years old and is widowed. She has 5 children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a real charcoal store.

loan.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loan.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan K. is currently in the business of selling bags of maize, beans, rice and pulses in a little store and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice and maize to sell. Susan is 49 years old and is married to a husband who is a security guard. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her little store.

loan.use: Stock more bags of rice and maize to sell

loan.name: Cotton's Business Group

texts.en:
Tenneh J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Cotton's Business. Tenneh lives in Montserrado County and is served by the Monrovia North branch of this MFI. She is 45 years old, is married, and has two children who range from 18 to 24 years old. Tenneh was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support.
For twenty years, Tenneh has been selling lappas (traditional dress for women), gents and ladies trousers, blouses, underwear, etc. in Harbel Cotton Tree community, Margibi County, Liberia. She plans to use her 4,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 20,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more lappas, gents and ladies trousers, blouses, underwear, etc.
Tenneh describes herself as easy-going. Her dream is to expand her business and build a house.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, J. T. is inset at lower right because he was absent during disbursal.

loan.use: To buy more lappas, gents' and ladies' trousers, blouses, underwear, etc., to sell

loan.name: Sadia

texts.en: Sadia A. is currently in the business of selling various perfumes, gels and body lotions in the shop and is requesting a loan to stock more perfumes to sell. Sadia is 27 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her shop.

loan.use: Stock more perfumes, etc., to sell

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy more timber to fix beds, chairs and other funiture

loan.name: Mujeres Inteligentes Group

texts.es: Este comit sigue desarrollandose dentro del sexto ciclo del programa de comite de mujeres emprendedoras y todas se encuentran muy contentas de estar trabajando muy unidas realizando cada una sus actividades que les ayuda con los gasto especialmente para la alimentacin de su familia adems de mejorar los ingresos. La seora Mara Dominguez es una de las integrantes y se dedica a la venta de comestibles, tiene su negocio con buena ubicacin y bastante demanda, debido a la calidad de sus preparados, su forma de trabajo es la de levantarse muy temprano diariamente para trabajar por sus comestibles con la ayuda de su marido. Y al amanecer ella se traslada hasta los lugares donde vende sus productos como en las paradas de buses, mercado y otros. Ella desea incrementar sus ingresos para tener su local propio con ms variedad de comidas, as como postres y bebidas. Invirtir el dinero en la compra de insumos como carnes, verduras, aceites, arina, arrz, condimentos, etc..
texts.en:
This group continues to demonstrate itself through the sixth cycle of the committee for entrepreneurial women, and all of the members are very happy to be working together to do the things they do to be able to feed their families and increase their incomes. Ms. Mara Dominguez is one of the members. She sells food and has a business in a good location and there is plenty of demand because of the quality of her items. Each day she arises early every morning to work on her food, with her husbands help. At dawn she travels to the places where she sells her products; places such as bus stops, markets, and others. She would like to increase her earnings so that she can have her own location with a greater variety of food, such as drinks and desserts. She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies, such as meats, vegetables, cooking oils, flour, rice, condiments, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Ingredients

loan.name: Maxime

texts.fr: jeune femme de 41 ans; mariee et mere de 3 enfants, dont l'age varie entre 7 et 25 ans.A la fin de ses Etudes universitaires, ne trouvant pas de debouche sur le marche du travail , elle ouvre une boutique pour vendre des habits pour nouveaux nes et autres articles pour bebes. Elle vend en moyenne 50.000 frs par jour; et s'approvisionne das les grands magasins de la place,a Kinshasha et les grossistes qui vont acheter en Chine et Dubai. Avec le pret qu'elle compte recevoir elle va approvisionner son stock en ajoutant des lots de couches, brassieres grenouilleres, draps, biberons, tetines, goupillons... A l'avenir elle pense etre grossiste en allant meme acheter a l'etranger et fournir chez les vendeurs du marche et les dames qui ont des boutiques. Tres entreprenante, elle fait de son mieux pour satisfaire sa clientele.
texts.en:
This is a young woman, 41 years old, who is married and a mother of three children, who range from 7 to 25 years of age. With a university-level education, she did not have job opportunities in her field. So she opened a store selling clothing for newborns and other baby items. Her sales average 50,000 francs a day. She gets her supplies locally from major stores, in Kinshasa, and from wholesalers who are going to go to China and Dubai. With this loan that she plans on receiving, she is going to stock up by including batches of diapers, night shirts, bed sheets, baby bottles, pacifiers, bottle brushes. In the future, she is thinking of being a wholesale merchant by going abroad herself to buy goods for supplying market vendors and ladies who have shops. A very enterprising woman, she does her best to satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying baby clothing, bed sheets, shirts, diapers, knit clothing

loan.name: Martina

texts.es:
La seora Matina de 50 aos de edad es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas caballeros y nios su puesto de ventas se encuentra en la Terminal de mnibus de la ciudad hace mas de 15 aos, en el trabajo le ayuda su cnyuge el seor Carlos de 56 aos de edad, a cargo de la pareja solo se encuentra una hija de 21 aos estudiante. Comenta que empez con poca mercadera y se hicieron de capital gracias a un prstamo que se le otorgo actualmente cubre todo los gastos familiares gracias al ingreso diario de las ventas de ropas.
Solicita el prstamo a Fundacin Paraguaya para la compra de ms mercaderas como camperas, medias, bufandas, pantalones y otros, para satisfacer la gran demanda que tiene estos prendas de vestir por la temporada fria.
texts.en:
Martina, age 50, is a businesswoman. She sells clothes for women, men, and children. She has been selling at the citys bus terminal for over 15 years. Her life partner, 56 year old Carlos, helps her with the work. The couple only has one daughter under their care. She is 21 years old and goes to school. Matina comments that she started with little merchandise. Her capital grew thanks to a loan she received. She now covers all of the family expenses thanks to the daily income from the clothing sales. She is requesting a loan from the Fundacin Paraguaya to buy more merchandise like jackets, hosiery, scarves, pants, and others. She wants to do this in order to satisfy the great demand there is for these articles of clothing for the cold season.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To get seasonal cothes wholesale to sell retail: jackets, hosiery, scarves, pants, t-shirts, and shirts, etc.

loan.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Hawa S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Unity. She is 33 years old, widowed and has two children who range from 10 to 12 years old. She was only able to attend school through seventh grade due to lack of financial support.
For five years, she has been selling plantains and bananas in New Georgia Market, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.
She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more plantains and bananas. She describes herself as a caring mother.
Her dream is to improve her business, make a profit, and continue to educate her children.

loan.use: To buy more plantains and bananas

loan.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and has nine children. They live in Twalatwal, a neighborhood in Belo Sub-Division, Boyo Division, Cameroon. The fact that Margaret never went to school has made life very difficult for her. She is unable to assist her husband in paying tuition fees for her children and also she is unable to raise money that can be used as take-off capital in her farm. With all these difficulties she decided to look for a way to find this capital. She decided to join GHAPE. This is Margaret's first loan, and this loan will help provide capital, thus increase her income and the well-being of her family.
With the loan, Margaret plans to rent farmland for 25,000 FCFA, buy three tins of beans seedlings for 21,000 FCFA and 4,000 FCFA will be used to pay for labour that will assist her in the farm. She knows this business will succeed because she has been doing this activity for a very long time.
With the profits from this loan, Margaret will assist her husband to construct a house for the family. She will also pay tuition fees for her children and ensure that they are well prepared for school. She will also provide good food for her family. Her training in business management that she received from GHAPE will help her to invest this loan in the most efficient and productive manner.
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loan.use: seedlings, rent farm land, and pay for labor

loan.name: Eduardo Jos

texts.es:
El seor Eduardo de 22 aos de edad es comerciante, cuenta con una pequea micro industria familiar en su casa, prepara productos de limpieza como detergentes, lavandinas, suavizantes, desodorante de ambiente y otros. Empez gracias a la ayuda econmica de sus padres, actualmente trabaja por su cuenta.
El mismo se encarga de la comercializacin de sus productos por la zona, para lo cual necesita de mas capital para trabajar mejor, ha aumento notablemente su clientela, confa en Fundacin Paraguaya, y se siente seguro para lograr todos sus desafos.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 22 years old. He is a merchant who runs a small business out of his home, where he prepares cleaning products, such as laundry detergents, bleach, fabric softeners, household deodorants, and others. He started this business with his parents financial help and now he works on his own. He takes care of making sales within his zone and needs to increase his working capital in order to be able to work better, since he has noticeably increased his number of customers. He trusts Fundacin Paraguaya and feels confident that he will be able to meet all of his challenges.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Supplies

loan.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with nine children and they live in Twalatwal, a neighborhood in Belo Sub-Division, Cameroon. Poverty has been the main cause of problems in her family. In order to solve some of these problems, she decided to became a GHAPE member. This is Regina's first loan. She is very interested in the activities of GHAPE.
This loan will help her rent farmland for 10,000 FCFA, buy Irish potato seedlings for 20,000 FCFA, and also buy bean seedlings for 20,000 FCFA. She knows this business will succeed because the land where she will carry out her farming is still very fertile and her community will provide a ready market for her farm produce when it is ready.
With the profits from this loan, Josephine F. will open a workshop for her daughter. She will also pay her childrens and the children of her late sister's tuition fees and ensure that they are well prepared for school. Her training in business management that she received from GHAPE will help her to invest this loan in the most efficient and productive manner.
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loan.use: seedlings, rent farmland and to pay for labour

loan.name: Khadim Rassoul Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarit KHADIM RASSOUL est cr le 30 dcembre 2009. Il fait partie du Banc Villageois de PALENE COKI. Il est compos de 30 femmes qui sont toutes issues du mme village. Et se sont organises par affinit.
Le groupe a comme responsable Madame NDOUMBE S. W.. Elle se trouve debout l'extrme droite de la photo. Elle est ge de 56 ans. Elle est marie et mre de 02 enfants.
Elle fabrique et vend des jus de fruits naturels. Par ailleurs, elle fait de l'embouche ovine.
Son nouveau prt lui permettra d'acheter des condiments pour la fabrique de ses jus de fruits naturels et d'acheter galement 02 moutons.
Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'pargne et de participer la prise en charge de la famille, par la nourriture et la sant.
texts.en:
Solidarity group KHADIM RASSOUL was created on December 30, 2009. It's part of the "Banc Villageois de PALENE COKI". It is composed of 30 women, all from the same village. They are grouped by affinity. Mrs. NDOUMBE S. W. is the head of the group. She's standing on the far right in the picture. She's 56 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She prepares and sells natural fruit juice. She also raises sheep. Her new loan will enable her to buy ingredients to prepare her natural fruit juices, and to buy two sheep. Her goal is to bolster her savings and to help paying her family's food and healthcare expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy ingredients to prepare natural fruit juices, and to buy two sheep

loan.name: Wilfrid

texts.fr:
jeune homme de 31 ans, celibataire et pre d'1 enfant de 5 ans.Apres sa licence n'ayant pas des moyens pour prolonger ses etudes et n'ayant pu postuler dans une entreprise de la place, il ouvre une boutique d'alimentation en 2008.
Son revenu moyen est de 100000f par jour. Avec ce prt il compte renforcer ses produits de premiere necessite de son alimentation comme un sac de sucre roux,un sac de sucre blanc, des cartons de lait, des botes de conserves,carton de beurre,et tous produits que l'on consomme regulierement dans son alimentation.
Pour faire avancer son activit il pargne souvent, s'efforce avoir les produits, faire un bon accueil a ses clients parce qu'il a pour vision d'tre grossiste dans les jours avenirs.
IL veut la longue construire une maison pour sa famille et amliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et mettre ses enfants dans mes meilleures coles.
texts.en:
This is a young man, aged 31, who is unmarried and the father of a 5-year-old child. After receiving his degree, he could not afford continuing his education. And unable to apply for a position in a local company, he opened a grocery store two years ago. His average revenues amount to 100,000 francs per day. With this loan, he intends to bolster his supply of basic necessities, such as brown sugar, white sugar, canned foods, butter, and any typical consumer product in his store. To advance his business, he often saves and strives to offer these goods in order to accommodate his customers well, since his vision is to be a wholesale merchant in the days to come. Over time, he wants to build a house to improve his family's living conditions and to put his children into the best schools.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying milk, butter, sugar, canned foods, margarine

loan.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Este Comit se formo gracias a las Seora Calixta Zoraida quien invito a sus vecinas para formar parte del comite D. mujeres emprendedoras y todas encantadas aceptaron conformar el comite Nombrandolo Comit Santa Librada.
El comit cuenta con veinte miembros en donD. la mayoria se dedica a realizar bordados en Ao-poi, confeccionando ya sea camisas, manteles y muchas otras creaciones que son heredadas D. sus madres, abuelas, pasando estos conocimientos D. generacin en generacin.
Calixta Zoraida G. que vive en Mbocayaty se dedican a la artesania o pequeos comercios D. ropas y productos artesanales en Ao Po-; vestimentas, manteles, mantas, adornos, etc.
Por la calidad D. sus productos, le resulta bastante productiva la venta D. los mismos y desea incrementar sus ingresos ampliando el negocio mediante la adquisicin D. ms materiales para su elaboracin as como muebles utilizados para la exposicin.
texts.en:
This group was formed thanks to Calixto Zoraida. She invited her neighbors to become part of a group of enterprising women. All of them were delighted to accept, and they formed the communal bank. They named it the Santa Librada Communal Bank. The group has twenty members. Most of them make Ao-poi (traditional Paraguayan needlework). They make shirts, blankets, and other creations that they inherited from their mothers and grandmothers. This knowledge was passed on from generation to generation. Calixta Zoraida G. lives in Mbocayaty. She devotes herself to handicrafts and small businesses, which deal with clothing and products that are crafted in Ao Po-. Some of those items are garments, table cloths, blankets, and decorations, etc. Her sales are good because of the quality of her products. She wishes to increase her income by expanding the business. She will do this by getting more materials to work on like furniture, which will be used for display.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy Ao Po- fabric to make their embroidersed tableclothes and shirts, etc.

loan.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old married man and has 2 young children; he is from Lebanon. For the past 22 years, he has been working in a car repair shop. He is the main provider for his wife and kids. He works hard to earn the profit needed to pay for his children's schooling. Today, he is requesting to borrow US$ 1,800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. It will be his second loan and is intended to buy additional spare parts and motor oils required by his clients. In the future, he is looking to continue the expansion of his business and to further increase his productivity. He expects that his business will continue to be successful in the coming year.
Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.
About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.
At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.
Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loan.use: buy additional spare parts and motor oils

loan.name: Laure Rachel Estelle

texts.fr: Femme couturire de 38 ans clibataire avec 3 enfants dont lage varie entre 7 et 21 ans. Quand elle finit sa formation en Coupe et Couture, sa mre lui fait cadeau dune machine coudre et elle ouvre un atelier de couture en 1996. Elle a une forte clientle et elle a en moyenne 45000 a 50000 Frs par jour des recettes. Avec le prt quelle compte recevoir elle va acheter des tissus et pagnes et faire des camisoles, des chemises, des ensembles dames quelle va vendre ses clients et en dehors de cela il y a aussi les commandes de clientes quelle reoit chaque jour. Les difficults quelle rencontre se situent dans laccumulation des commandes et les clients qui ne respectent pas leur rendez vous. A lavenir elle pense ouvrir une cole de couture pour la rinsertion des jeunes filles mres et les aider a la longue se prendre en charge Elle pense aussi continuer ses cours de designer pour tre modliste et faire des dfiles de mode dans le futur.
texts.en:
This is a seamstress, aged 38, who is unmarried. She has three children, who range from 7 to 21 years of age. When she finished her training in the tailoring trade, her mother gave her a sewing machine as a gift. She opened a workshop in 1996. She has a strong customer base and has an average income of 45,000 to 50,000 francs CFA per day. With this loan that she plans on receiving, she is going to purchase some fabrics and pagnes (colorful West African cloth) to make camisoles, shirts, and women's outfits that she will sell to her customers. Beyond this, there are special orders from customers she receives each day. The difficulties she encounters involve the accumulation of orders, and the customers do not keep their appointments. In the future, she is thinking of opening a sewing school for re-integrating young mothers into the working world and for helping them to support themselves eventually. She is also thinking of continuing with her design courses in order to be a designer and to put on fashion shows in the future.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying fabrics, yardage, traditional cloths, thread, lace, linings

loan.name: Marina Landrine

texts.fr:
femme de 30ans, celibataire et mre de 2 enfants dont l'age vari de 7ans 5ans tous scolaris, ayant 2 personnes charges.ayant un niveau scolaire secondaire, elle debute son commerce comme gerante dans une boutique en 2000 et se lana dans la vente de friperie en 2005. sa recette journalire varie de 7000frs) 20000frs .
elle veut renforcer son activit avec ce prt en achetant des balons de t-chirt,de serviette,de gean's . sa strategie est de mieux sa marchandise afin de satisfaire ses clients, avoir un bon tallage.
elle veut tre grossiste dans les jours futur afin de mieux amliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille, aider ses enfants prosperer dans les tudes.dans son quartier elle est l'exemple des femmes ambitieuses encourager.
texts.en:
Marina Landrine N. N. is 30 years old, unmarried and the mother of two children whose ages range from 5 to 7 years. Both of the children are in school and in her care. With a middle school education, she started in business in 2000 as a manager in a shop and went into secondhand clothing sales in 2005. Her daily revenue ranges from 7,000 to 20,000 francs. She wants to expand her business with this loan by purchasing bundles of t-shirts, towels and jeans. Her strategy is to have better merchandise in order to satisfy her customers and to have a good display. She wants to be a wholesaler in the future so as to better improve the living conditions of her family and to help her children prosper in their studies. In her neighborhood she is a model of an ambitious woman to encourage.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy bundles of shirts, towels and t-shirts

loan.name: Sergio Alberto

texts.es: Sergio Alberto de 64 aos de edad, tiene 5 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. Sergio se dedica a la venta de madera, la venta est ubicada en su casa de habitacin, lugar el cual es muy bueno para la venta, ya que se encuentra en un lugar muy concurrido, ya que tiene muchos clientes que siempre apreciar los productos de l. El negocio es muy estable, por lo que Sergio solicita un prstamo con el deseo de poder aumentar su inventario comprando mayor variedad de maderas para la elaboracin de sus productos, todo esto con el deseo de mejorar sus ventas y as contar con una vida mejor para l y su familia.
texts.en:
Sergio Alberto is 64 years old. He has five children, and they all work independently. Sergio sells wood, and this business is located at his house. The location is very good for sales because it is in a very busy place. He has many customers who always value his products. The business is very stable. Serio is requesting a loan because he wants to be able to increase his inventory. He will buy a greater variety of wood in order to make his products. All of this is because he wants to improve his sales. That way he and his family will have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Mwinda Plus Group

texts.en:
Erick B., aged 27, is the president of the Community Bank Mwinda Plus, which is composed of 19 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.
Erick is single. He sells second-hand clothing. He has been in business since 2001. He manages his business in his area located the center-east of the city of Kinshasa. He has already received one loan and has repaid it properly. He intends to use the next loan to expand the inventory of his business by buying a bundle of used clothing to resell with the aim of increasing his profits. Each week, his business brings in a profit of US$ 30. His ambition is to open a general store.

loan.use: increasing his inventory by buying a bundle of used clothing

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Clmentine Flavie

texts.fr: femme de 38 ans, mari et mre d'un enfant age de 18 ans scolariser et ayant 5 personnes en charge.ayant quitter ses tudes en terminale elle se lance dans la restauration en 2000, sa recette est de 10000frs minimun par jour. avec se prt elle aimerai renforcer son activit en achetant de la boissons gaseuze et des vivres frais et du de restauration comme des assietes, poisson sal, poisson fum,lgume, feuille de manioc, manioc,haricot,riz,huile et bien d'autres condiments. comme strategie elle s'efforce amliorer la qualit de sa cuisine pour mieux attirer les clients et aussi pargner chaque jour apres la vente. elle veut ouvrir dans futur en ayant un grand restaurant plus moderne, avoir une maison et surtout soutenir sa fille faire ses tudes de mdecine, son restaurant est tres populaire , car elle reoit beaucoup des gens chez elle et est trs acceuillante.
texts.en:
This is a 38-year-old woman who is married and the mother of an 18-year-old child in school. She has five people to support. Having dropped out of school in her last year of high school, she got started in the restaurant business in 2000. Her income amounts to 10,000 francs minimum per day. With this loan, she would like to bolster her business by buying carbonated soft drinks, fresh provisions, and restaurant goods, such as plates, salted fish, smoked fish, vegetables, cassava leaves, cassava, beans, rice, oil, and many other condiments. As a strategy, she strives to improve the quality of her cooking in order to attract more customers and also to save money each day after the sales are made. In the future, she wants to open a big restaurant that is more modern, to have a house, and especially to support her daughter in studying medicine. Her restaurant is very popular, since many people go there, and she is very welcoming.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying beverages and restaurant supplies

loan.name: Amabengeza Group

texts.fr:
Josiane D. est une femme de 30 ans, ne Nyamata, province de lEst du Rwanda. Elle est marie et trois enfants, le moins ge a 7 mois et le plus ge 4 ans, 2 parmi ses enfants sont all lcole. Josiane avec sa famille habite Gisenyi.
Concernant son activit, elle est commerante des produits alimentaires comme riz, haricot, huile, sorgho,. elle a une exprience de 2 ans dans ce domaine. Le crdit contract avec ACB est le deuxime, le prcdent lui a aide dameliorer son business de commerce ambulant et payer le loyer pour sa famille qui habite a Nyamata Dans lavenir, elle pourra avoir un nouveau prt bien dun gros montant pour augmenter son chiffre daffaires ainsi elle pourra acheter ou btit sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Josiane D. is a 30-year-old woman who was born in Nyamata, in East Province, Rwanda. She is married and has three children, of whom the youngest is 7 months old, and the oldest is 4 yours old. Two of her children are attending school. Josiane lives with her family in Gisenyi. Regarding her business, Josiane is a merchant selling foodstuffs, such as rice, beans, oil, sorghum She has two years of experience in this domain. The loan signed with the micro-finance institution ACB is the second one. The previous one helped her to improve her itinerant business and to pay the rent for her family living in Nyamata. In the future, she will be able to obtain a much larger loan to increase her sales. Thus, she will be able to buy or to build her own house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying beans, rice, sorghum for retail sale in her store

loan.name: Ths Jarrel

texts.fr:
jeune commerant de 24ans, celibataire et pre d'un enfant ag de 4ans.Ayant fini ses tude secondaire et n'ayant plus de soutien il dbute son commerce avec la vente de boissons en 2007 avec un capital de 150.000 et se lance dans l'alimentation en 2008. sa revenu journalier est de 35000frs 40000frs.
Avec ce prt il aimerait agrandir son ativit en achtant des cartons de lait,de bite de conserve. Malgr les difficults d'ouvrir tt et de refermer tard son alimentation,il pour strategie, d'ouvrir tt afin d'tre fidele l'acceuil de ses clients, ouvrir un bon service, bien valuer ses marchandises. il veut epargner de jour en jour pour atteindre son but.
il se bat pour l'epanouissement de sa famille et que ses enfants vivent dans des meilleures conditions. c'est un jeune qui est connu dans son quartier du petit au pus grand grce ses exploits.
texts.en:
This is a young merchant, 24 years old, unmarried, and the father of a 4-year-old child. Having finished middle school but having no more support, he started his business selling beverages in 2007 with 150,000 francs in capital. He launched his grocery store in 2008. His daily revenues amount to 35,000 to 40,000 francs. With this loan, he would like to expand his business by buying boxes of milk and canned foods. Despite the difficulties of opening his store early and closing late, his strategy is to open early in order to accommodate his customers faithfully, to provide good service, and to price his merchandise well. He wants to save money each and every day to achieve his goal. He struggles, so that his family may come into its own and so that his children may live under the best conditions. He is a young person who is known in his district by everyone from kids to older people, thanks to his accomplishments.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying milk, canned foods, sacks of sugar, butter, margarine

loan.name: Marie Irne Ida

texts.fr:
femme de 48 ans, celibataire et mre de 5 enfants dont l'age varient entre 22 10 ans.Ayant quitter sa scolarite tt par manque de soutien financier elle s'est lanc dans le commerce de vente des ustentils de plastiques,des sous vtements,des bombons, biscuits en 1990 afin de palier la crise financire et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.son revenu journalier vari de 15000frs 20000frs.
avec ce prt elle compte renforce son activiter en achetant des plastiques tel que des paniers, des cuvettes, des bassines, des bols,sceaux, des cucreries(bombons,biscuits kwik, biscuit telephonne, biscuit chocolat),des mches(pony,afro,darling,x-pression, olive et des mches angaise),des sous vtements( slip,soutien) et bien d'autres choses.
sa strategie est de bien ranger son talage afin de mieux attirer ses clients, le bon acceuil,et pargner du jour au jour.
elle a pour vision d'avoir une grande boutique dans le futur, s'acqueruir un terrain et mettre ses enfants dans des bonnes conditions.Elle est un bon exemple des femmes de son quartier.
texts.en:
This 48-year-old woman is a single mother of five children whose ages range from 10 to 22 years old. She had to quit school early on for lack of financial support. She started selling plastic cutlery, underwear, candy and cookies in 1990 in order to deal with the financial crisis and provide for the needs of her family. Her daily income varies from 15,000 to 20,000 francs. With this loan, she plans to boost her business by purchasing plastic items such as baskets, bowls, basins, bowls, buckets, as well as sweets (candy, cookies), hair extensions (pony, Afro, darling, x-pression, olive, English), underwear (slips, bras) and many other things.Her strategy is to set up an appealing display of her merchandise to attract customers, to give them a proper greeting, and to accumulate daily savings. For the future, she plans to open a big shop, get a piece of land, and provide good living conditions for her children. She is a good representation of the women in her neighborhood.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase cutlery, plastic chairs and tables, etc.

loan.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married to a taxi driver; they have three children and all their children go to school. She doesnt take care of additional family members. She owns a stall in Nakulabye selling second-hand clothes. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She buys bales of clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda, and uses public transport to and from shopping.
Margaret has been in this clothing business for years. She sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale. Margaret goes for shopping once a week. She works six days a week. Her business challenges include seasonality and transportation of bales of clothes from Owino to her stall in Nakulabye. She is aspiring of improving her standard of living and even starting importing clothes from Dubai. She decided to work with MCDT because she wanted additional capital. She resides in and rents a three-roomed house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, food, and rent.

loan.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loan.name: Annie

texts.fr: Femme couturire de 43 ans, marie et mre des 4 enfants dont lage varient entre 4 et 18 ans, elle sest lanc dans la couture il y a bientt 20ans, aprs sa formation elle se spcialise dans la couture et broderie des draps des nouveaux ns. Elle achte des rouleaux des tissus popelines de diffrents couleurs comme le rose, le bleu, le blanc et les tissus fleuris, avec sa machine elle couds 10 a 15 draps par jour et les emballe dans des sachets en plastique et va dposer les exposer dans une boutique pour les vendre. Elle vend en moyenne 25000 Frs par jour et par moment elle livre ses draps dans les martenites de la place. Avec le prt elle compte acheter des rouleaux de popelines de diffrentes couleurs pour commencer les draps non seulement pour les nouveaux ns mais aussi des sries des lits de diffrente taille (single bed, King bed) pour les adultes. Trs entreprenante, elle fait la fiert de son mari et ses enfants.
texts.en:
This lady is a seamstress, 43 years old and married, the mother of four children whose ages vary between four and 18 years. She began working as a seamstress almost 20 years ago, after she finished her training. She is specialized in sewing and embroidering sheets for newborns. She buys bolts of poplins in various colors such as pink, blue, white and flowered fabric and with her sewing machine, she sews 10 to 15 sheets per day and wraps them in plastic before displaying them for sale in a shop. She makes sales of an average of 25,000 francs per day and sometimes she makes sheets for local birthing centers. With the loan she intends to buy bolts of different colored poplins in order to begin making sheets, not only for newborns but also sets of sheets in various sizes (single bed, King size) for adults. A very enterprising person, she is the pride and joy of her husband and children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: purchase of poplin to make sheets for newborns and adults

loan.name: Marble

texts.en:
Marble is married with five children and all her children have attended school. None of her children currently goes to school, they all finished their education. She also takes care of additional family members.
Marble changed her business enterprise from selling cold drinks to a shoe business. She has been in this business for a few months and she is now proud of this business. She buys bales of second-hand shoes from shops in Nabugabo and Owino market and sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale. Besides this shoe business she also sells piped water and hires out her sewing machine at 2000 per day.
Marble owns a stall in Kawempe where she sells her shoes. Her business challenges include defaulters, ever increasing prices of second-hand shoes, and transportation of bales of shoes from Nabugabo to her stall in Kawempe. She works seven days a week.
Marble is aspiring of seeing her business grow big so that she can get enough profit to buy a plot of land. She decided to join MCDT because she could get loans without any collateral and the loans are timely. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and paying utility bills.

loan.use: to buy more bales of second-hand shoes

loan.name: Patricia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Patricia de 31 aos, vive en las Orqudeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orqudeas porque en su descubrimiento haban muchas flores orqudeas), ella tiene un restaurante de comida tpica.
La mama de Patricia era empleada de un restaurante y como no tenia donde dejar a sus hijos los llevaba con ella al trabajo, cuando Patricia creci decidi tener su propio puesto de comidas, poco a poco lo convirti en un restaurante, ahora ella trabaja desde las 05h00am hasta las 14h00pm todos los das, sus hermanas le ayudan a cocina mientras que otras reparten la comida.
Para poder continuar con el negocio ella quiere comprar con el prstamo un congelador y as mantener las carnes y vegetales fros. En el futuro quiere comprar una camioneta.
texts.en:
Patricia is 31 years old and lives in Orqudeas de Guayaquil (an urban area named after the many orchids that existed when the place was discovered). She has a restaurant where she serves traditional food.

Patricias mother was employed at a restaurant, so she brought her children with her to work since she did not anywhere to leave them. When Patricia became old enough, she started her own food stand. Over time she converted her business into a restaurant. Now she works every day from 5am to 2pm. Her sisters help in the kitchen while she has other employees who serve the food.

To continue her business, Patricia will use her loan to buy a freezer for keeping meats and frozen vegetables. In the future, she wants to buy a truck.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase a freezer

loan.name: Blandine

texts.fr: femme de 33ans,marie et mre de 2 enfants dont l'age varie de15ans 16 mois et a 3 personnes sa charge, ayant quittee sa scolarit tt aprs le deces de son pre,tant ain elle se lanca dans la coiffure en 1995. son revenu journaliere est de 10000frs par jour. Avec ce prt elle aimerai agrandir son activit en achetant des produits cosmtiques tel que des defrisants, des demelants, des bigoudis, des mches(pony,anglaise,olive), des filets et pinces cheveux et d'autre produits de premire necessit. sa strategie est de faire des promotions de ses produits, avoir des prix abordable, avoir des meilleurs produits dans son salon de coiffure. Son ambition est d'aller acheter les produits de cheveux l'tranger et tre grossiste car elle pense beaucoup amliorer les conditions de vie de sa mre et de ses frres. son entourage est content d'elle car elle se debrouille bien.
texts.en:
Blandine is a 33 year old mother of two children aged 15 years and 16 months, who also cares for 3 other people. She had to quit school soon after her father died, since she was the eldest in her family. In 1995, she started hairdressing, and her daily income is 10,000 francs. With this loan, she would like to grow her business by buying cosmetics such as hair straighteners, detangler, curlers and extensions (ponytails, ringlets, Olive brand), hair nets and clips, and other essential items. Her strategy is to promote her products, have reasonable prices and keep the best products in her salon. Her ambition is to someday go overseas to buy hair products and become a bulk seller since she believes this would very much improve living conditions for her mother and brothers. Her friends and family are proud of her because she is very resourceful.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy cosmetic products (hair extensions, straighteners, detangler)

loan.name: Jenny Yadira

texts.es:
Jenny de 35 aos, vive en las Orqudeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orqudeas porque en su descubrimiento haban muchas flores orqudeas), ella tiene una papelera en su casa vende bebidas, papelera, cuadernos .(en Ecuador se los llama bazar).
Comenz con la papelera para poder mantener a su familia y tener una mejor estabilidad econmica, vendiendo cuadernos, plumas y papeles a sus vecinos y conocidos cuando completo el dinero para ubicar su pequea papelera.. Trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 20h30pm todos los das.
Para surtir mas su negocio ella quiere comprar con el prstamo cuadernos, libros y papelera, en el futuro quiere que sus dos hijos terminen sus estudios con xito.
texts.en:
Jenny is 35 years old and lives in Orqudeas de Guayaquil (an urban area named after the many orchids that existed when the place was discovered). She has a stationery shop in her home where she sells beverages, paper, and notebooks. In Ecuador, this type of store is called a bazaar. To restock her business, she plans to use her loan to buy notebooks, books, and paper. In the future, she hopes to see her two children successfully finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase notebooks, books, and paper

loan.name: Las Alfareras Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Las Alfareras. Esta ubicado en la comunidad de Barrio Santiago, Acteopan, en el estado de Puebla, Mxico. El grupo esta conformado por 5 integrantes que se conocen por ser vecinos. Este es su 1er. Prstamo con Fundacin Realidad. El representante del grupo es la seorita Pompilia T. A. tiene 37 aos de edad, estudio hasta el 6. Ao de primaria obteniendo su certificado de primaria, Ella es soltera no tiene hijos y se dedica a la Alfarera y necesita el prstamo para comprar barro, lea, greta, celite, pintura para elaborar sus cazuelas, ollas y jarros en varios tamaos y modelos. Ella desde muy pequea le gusto ayudarle a su papa con el trabajo y le fue enseando como se trabaja el barro, tiene en el negocio 15 aos y participan en el la elaboracin de sus productos, su pap, su mam y su hermano unos cortan el barro, otros lo machucan y otro va poniendo las cintas, las asas y las orillas a las cazuelas, ollas y jarros.
