Ella considera importante su negocio porque de ah tienen ingresos para los gastos de su casa, la alimentacin y para ir ahorrando para seguir comprando la materia prima este negocio ya viene de familia, pues se a trabajado por generaciones en la alfarera, le proporciona gran satisfaccin ver sus cazuelas, ollas y jarros ya terminados por que se ven muy bonitos, o cuando los clientes les dicen que estn muy bonito. Ellos llevan sus productos a vender a la plaza de Ozumba los martes. Y tambin a Tonatico, estado de Mxico, se enfrenta mucha competencia pues stos son lugares donde especialmente se vende alfarera, lo bueno es que la seorita Pompilia ya tiene clientes que solo le compran a ella por su calidad, buen precio y buen servicio, las ganancias que obtienen son para comprar mas barro, lea y va guardando para pagar los gastos de la casa. Barrio Santiago, Acteopan, Estado de Puebla es un pueblo bonito hay rboles, campo, siembran sorgo, milpa, cacahuate y utilizan para trabajar en el campo los burros, caballos, mulas utilizan las yuntas de bueyes para arar sus tierras, sus calles pavimentadas, algunas con adoqun o cemento, tambin hay una fiesta del barrio Santiago el 25 de Julio celebran misa, procesin, queman castillo, hay baile, chinelos y comida para todos los que van a la fiesta del barrio Santiago. Sus sueos y esperanzas son comprar una camioneta para transportar el barro, la lea y tambin su mercanca que van a vender a Tonatico Estado de Mxico. Las integrantes del grupo son Fidelia M. P. y va a comprar con su prstamo barro, greta, celite y pintura para elaborar sus ollas y cazuelas, la Seora Jaime T. Martnez va a comprar barro, Tierra blanca para elaborar sus macetas rusticas, La seora Gregoria M. H. va a comprar greta, lea, barro, etc. para elaborar sus cazuelas, la seorita Pompilia T. A. va a comprar barro, greta, lea, celite, pintura para elaborar sus cazuelas, ollas y jarros, la seora Virginia B. B. va a compra barro para elaborar sus cazuelas. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundacin Realidad agradecerles que confan en nosotros y si vamos a cumplir con el pago, para que nos vuelvan a prestar.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called Las Alfareras ["The Potters"]. It is located in the community of Barrio Santiago, Acteopan, in the state of Puebla, Mexico. The group is made up of 5 members who know each other because they are neighbours. This is their first loan with Fundacion Realidad. The representative of the group is Miss Pompilia T. A., age 37, who studied until the 6th grade and obtained her primary certificate. She is single and has no children. She is a potter and needs a loan to purchase clay, firewood, lead, celite, and paint for decorating her pans, pots and jars of various sizes and models. From a very young age she has enjoyed helping her father with this work, and he taught her how to work with clay. She has been in this business for 15 years and her father, mother and brother are involved in the making of the products. Some will cut the clay, others will crush it and others put on the plaster, handles and edges of the pans, pots and jars. She considers her business to be important because it generates the income for her household costs, food and savings to continue purchasing materials. This is a family business; generations of her family have worked in pottery. She takes great satisfaction in seeing her completed pans, pots and jars because they are very beautiful; and she gets great satisfaction when her customers say that they are beautiful. They bring their products to sell in the Ozumba plaza on Tuesdays, and also in Tonatico, in the state of Mexico. They have much competition since these are locations where much pottery is offered for sale. The good thing is that Pompilia already has customers who only buy from her because of her quality, good price and good service. Her earnings are used to purchase more clay and firewood, and she saves to cover her household costs. Barrio Santiago, Acteopan, in the state of Puebla is a very beautiful village. There are trees and fields, and they sow sorghum, corn, and peanuts and use donkeys, horses and mules to work in the fields. They use yoked oxen to plough the land. There are paved roads, some with cobblestone and some cement. They have a festival in the neighbourhood of Santiago on July 25th where they celebrate mass, have a procession, and set off fireworks. There is dancing, the Chinelos [a traditional Mexican dance] and food for all who go to the Santiago neighbourhood party. Pompilia and her family dream and hope to purchase a truck to transport the clay, firewood and their merchandise for sale to Tonatico in the state of Mexico. The group members are: Fidelia M. P., who will use her loan to purchase clay, lead, celite and paint to make her pots and pans; Mrs Jaime T. M., who will purchase clay and ceramic to make her rustic flowerpots; Mrs Gregoria Montano H., who will purchase lead, firewood, clay etc for the making of her pans; Pompilia T. A., who will purchase clay, lead, firewood, celite and paint to make her pans, pots and jars; and Mrs Virginia B., who will purchase clay to make her pans. The group members want to tell Kiva and Fundacion Realidad "thank you for your confidence in us, and we will repay the loan so that you will lend to us again".

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: the purchase of clay, firewood, lead, celite and paint for making pots, pans and jars

location.town: Barrio Santiago, Acteopan, estado de Puebla

loan.name: Ftima Del Rosario

texts.es:
La seora Ftima del Rosario M. N., tiene la edad de 47 aos vive en el Barrio Nindiri, es casado y su esposo labora como chofer apoyndole en los gastos que se incurren mensualmente tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad que estudian y apoyan a sus padres en las actividades del hogar y la finca.
Ellos se dedican a la Agricultura, desde hace 15 aos, fue gracias al apoyo de sus suegros que lograron incursionar en esta actividad que ha sido la fuente de ingresos de la familia durante todos estos aos, es ahora que ellos solicitan un prstamo para la compra de materiales agrcolas que le permitan brindarle un mantenimiento a sus terrenos para que se produzca a futuro una mejor cosecha, esta inversin les permitir mejores condiciones econmicas, que favorecern el desarrollo econmico a la familia y sobre todo a sus hijos que estn inicindose en el mundo universitario, as mismo como proyectos familiares para el bienestar de todos.
texts.en:
Fatima del Rosario M. N. is 47 and lives in the Nindiri neighbourhood. She is married, and her husband works as a driver, helping her with their monthly costs. They have 3 grown children who study and support their parents in the household and farm activities. They have been farmers for 15 years. It was thanks to the support of their parents that they were able to enter into this activity which has been the source of their family's income for all these years. They are now requesting a loan for the purchase of agricultural materials which will permit them to maintain their lands so that they produce a better harvest in the future. This investment will allow them better economic conditions, which will help the economic development of the family and above all of their children who are joining the world of university. It will also help with family projects for the well-being of all.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: the purcahse of agricultural materials that will allow them to maintain their lands so that they produce a better harvest in the future

loan.name: Idania Del Socorro

texts.es: La seora Idania del Socorro R. A., tiene la edad de 33 aos vive en el Barrio Buenos Aires es casada y su esposo labora como cobrador, apoyando con sus ingresos a la economa del hogar, ellos tienen dos hijos uno menor de edad y el otro adolecente, los cuales se dedican a los estudios de primaria y secundaria respectivamente. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano desde hace 6 aos, esta actividad se ha incrementado debido a la buena acogida de parte de la poblacin por la crisis que afecta el bolsillo domestico y se recurre a la compra de ropa de segundo uso, fue gracias a al apoyo de su esposo que comenz en este negocio y a futuro espera la apertura de una tienda en el centro comercial de Ticuantepe municipio de la capital, el prstamo lo solicita para la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadera e incrementar de esta forma los volmenes de venta para llevar a cabo sus planes evolutivos para su empresa, que conllevara a futura a una mejor estabilidad econmico-social de todos los miembros de la familia.
texts.en:
Idania del Socorro R. A., age 33, is married and lives in the Buenos Aires neighborhood. Her husband works as a fare collector, and his income helps with the household finances. They have two children. One is a minor and in elementary school. The other child is an adolescent, and he is in high school. She has been selling second hand clothes for six years. This activity has increased because of how well it is received by the population. This is due to the domestic economic crisis; people are buying second hand clothes. She started this business thanks to her husbands support. In the future she plans on opening a store in the commercial center of the Ticuantepe municipality in the capital. She will use the loan to buy a greater inventory of merchandise. That way she will increase her sales volume in order to complete her progressive plans for her business. In the future this will bring better socioeconomic stability for all of the members of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy a greater inventory of merchandise

loan.name: Gilberto Crispn

texts.es:
El seor Gilberto es soltero de 33 aos y tiene una hija de 1 ao, tiene un estudio de serigrafa hace 5 aos, el cual cuenta con una ubicacin muy estratgica, pues, esta ubicado frente a un comercial muy concurrida, el cual facilita que se conozca su negocio. Cuenta con una vasta clientela quines gustan mucho de sus trabajos por la calidad de las mismas.
El crdito solicitado es para comprar pinturas, plsticos y resma de papel ya que, adems, de su servici de serigrafa tambin realiza fotocopias para tener un ingreso agregado.
Su mximo sueo es tener su propio local, para lo cual necesita incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sr. Gilberto is 33 years old, single, and has a one year old daughter. Five years ago, he opened a silk screening business in a very strategic location on the opposite side of a busy shopping center. This enables his business to be easily recognized. He has a list of clients who are fans of the quality of his work.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy paints, plastic, and reams of paper. In addition to silk screening, he also provides photocopying services to generate extra revenue.

His greatest dream is to have his own location where he can increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase screen printing & photocopying supplies

loan.name: Estelle Rajy

texts.fr: Femme de 32ans, celibataire et mre d'un enfant age d'une annee, ayant arrete ses tudes en terminale et n'ayant plus de soutien financier elle se lance dans le commerce en 2009. son revenu varie de 8000frs 10000frs par jour. A l'octroi de son pret , elle compte approvisionner son stock en ajoutant des cartons de viande, poissons frais,volailles, condiments, cartons de tomate ,bidon d'huile... Elle s'approvisionne dans les chambres froides et marches de la place, toujours pret a reserver un bon accueil a ses clients, offrrir ses meilleurs services, faire des prix abordables, et respecter les heures d'ouverture de son resto. Elle l'avenir elle pense ouvrir un grand restaurant et epargner plus, pour soutenir son enfant et acheter un terrain .
texts.en:
Estelle Rajy B. is 32 years old, single, and mother of a one-year old child. Having stopped her studies in final year of secondary school and being without financial support she threw herself into commerce in 2009. Her income varies from 8000 frs to 10000frs a day. When granted a loan, she intends to increase her supplies and buy meat, fresh fish, poulty, condiments, boxes of tomatoes, cans of oil etc. She gets her supplies from the local coldrooms and markets, and always offers a warm welcome to her clients, providing the best service at affordable prices, and respecting the opening hours of her small restaurant. In the future she would like to open a big restaurant and save more, to support her child and buy a plot of land.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: achat des cartons de poissons, viande, volailles,

loan.name: Maria Haydee

texts.es: Maria Haidee tiene 1hijo que se encuentra de 9 meses pues est bajo su cuidado. Desde hace 4 aos cuando empez la venta de cosmticos, con iniciativa propia pues en la comarca donde vive no existen muchas personas que se dedica a este tipo de actividad. El avance de su negocio ha sido su desafo constante, pues vive sola y sostiene su hogar con este negocio y dinero. En la actualidad solicita un crdito que lo invertir en la compra de lpiz, labial, perfumes, cremas tratamientos y ropa interior, que es lo que ms compra su clientela. Su deseo es que su negocio pueda crecer cada da ms tener si propio local.
texts.en:
Maria Haidee has a 9 month old son in her care. Four years ago, she took the initiative to start her own business selling cosmetics since there were no other people in the area engaged in this same activity. Making progress in her business is a constant challenge since she lives alone and relies on her income to maintain her household.

At the moment, Maria is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of eye pencils, lipsticks, perfumes, crmes, treatments, and undergarments since these items are the most requested by her customers. Her wish is to grow her business each day until she is able to have her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase eye pencils, lipsticks, perfumes, crmes, treatments, and undergarments

loan.name: Rosalie

texts.fr:
Femme commerante de 54 ans, clibataire avec 2 enfants, dont lage varient entre 22 ans et 19 ans.En classe de premire ,quand elle perd ses parents par manque de soutien , elle se lance dans le commerce des poissons fumes. Elle a une recette journalire de 30000 a 50000frs par jour, elle sapprovisionne Dans les marches intrieures du pays ou les villages riverains ou lactivit principale est la pche des poissons du fleuve Avec le prt quelle compte recevoir elle va acheter 5 paniers de Mboto (gros carpes) ,10 paniers de silures (Ngolo) et 8 paniers de lamproie ou anguilles (Nzombo), poissons trs consommes dans les familles congolaises.
Avec le temps, elle a des projets dlargir en ouvrant un grand dpt de poissons, avoir des fournisseurs riverains qui viendront livrer des paniers de poissons sur place au lieu deffectuer des voyages par pirogues chaque semaine. Plus elle va accrotre son stock, plus les bnfices seront normes pour accrotre son pargne et cela va la permettre de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et les pousser a faire des grandes tudes.
texts.en:
Rosalie M. is 54 years old, single and mother of 2 children aged between 19 and 22. In her second last year of high school she lost parents and due to lack of support started a business selling smoked fish. She has a daily revenue of 30000 to 50000 and gets her supplies from the inland markets or from the riverside villages where fishing is the principal activity. With the loan she hopes to receive, she will buy 5 baskets of Mboto (large carp). 10 baskets of brown bullheads (Ngolo) and 8 baskets of sea lamprey or eel (Nzombo), all heavily consumed fish in Congolese familiies. In time, she has plans to expand and to open a large fish outlet, and have the riverside suppliers deliver their baskets of fish rather than her having to make the trip by canoe each week. The more she increases her stock, the greater her profits will be, enabling her to increase her savings and in turn provide for her family and put her children through tertiary level education.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Achat de paniers de poissons fumes de carpes, anguilles,silures

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: Achat des t shirts; pantalon; curottes;...en vu de les detailler

loan.name: Fanny Vladys

texts.es:
Fanny de 45 aos, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), ella vende productos qumicos, como shampoo, desinfectante, etc.
Cuando se separo de su esposo ella decidi continuar con el negocio de qumicos que los dos haban empezado, desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ella trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los das. Ella hace shampoo, desinfectante, aromatizante, y los llena en envases plsticos.
Ella quiere comprar con el prstamo mas qumicos para hacer sus productos, en el futuro quiere tener su propia distribuidora de qumicos y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Fanny is 45 years old and lives along the Perimetral Highway in Guayaquil (a periurban area that is surrounded by a salt marsh). She sells chemical household products such as shampoos, disinfectants, etc.

When she separated from her husband, she decided to continue the household chemical business that the two of them started. She now works every day from 8am to 9pm. Fanny makes shampoos, disinfectants, and air fresheners and sells them in plastic containers.

With this loan, she wants to buy more chemicals for making her products. In the future, she wants to open her own distribution center and finish the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase household chemicals

loan.name: Unidos Para Progresar 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maxima is the coordinator of her group Unidos para Progresar 1 & 2 (Progressing Together). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and 4 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to improve her house. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying being with her family.
Maxima is excited to be taking her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over 7 years, starting when she learned how to sew. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business where she makes and sells curtains, sheets, quilts, tablecloths, and she will buy fabric, needles, thread and others. She will use the profits to improve her home, by changing some wood and having a floor. She wants to be successful in her business and with God's will and her Esperanza Loan, she will do it.
This Esperanza associate's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. The rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffer from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and unreliable electricity.

loan.use: to buy fabric, needles and thread

loan.name: Carine

texts.fr:
Femme age de 30ans,celibataire et mre de 2 enfants dont l'age varie de 15ans 7ans et ayant 3 personnes en charge,par manque des moyens financiers elle arrte ses tudes au lyce en classe de terminale et commence vendre comme agent de l'aroport des plats pour des vols de 2004 2009 et se lance dans la coiffure en fin 2009. son revenu journalier est de 30000frs.
avec ce prt elle veut renforcer son activite en achetant des produits cosmetiques de coiffure dames comme des demelants,defrisants,pinces et filets chignon, mches(pony,anglaise...) et autres produits de premire necessit.
Elle pour strategie de mieux faire son travail avec beaucoup de professionalisme faire preuve d'un bon accueil et avoir du respect pour ses clients.
Avec les bnfices que son activit vont gnres, elle veut amliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille en soutenant ses enfants dans les tudes. Continuer dans cette activit est son soucis majeur, elle veut la longue ouvrir un salon plus moderne avec une salle de soins esthtique,dans son milieu social elle est connue parmi les femmes qui se dbrouillent.
texts.en:
Carine K. I. is 30 years old, single,and mother of 2 children aged between 7 and 15 years. Due to lack of financial support, she left her studies in final year of high school and began to sell inflight meals as an employee at the airport between 2004 and 2009. She became a hairdresser at the end of 2009, and her daily income is 30000frs. With this loan she wants to strengthen her business by buying hairdressing products for women such as detangler, defrizz, clips, hairnets, streaking kits and other necessary products. Her strategy is to do her work well with a high level of professionalism, to provide a warm welcome, and to show respect to her clients. WIth the profits her busines will generate, she would like to improve the quality of life of her family and support her children through their studies. To continue in this business is her greatest worry, she eventually wants to open a more modern salon with a beauty salon incorporated. In her social circle she is well known, and gets along well with the women.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Achat et materiel de coiffure defrisant; mches,dmelant, fillets; pinces

loan.name: Las Josefas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Las Josefas est conformado por Rosa Yolanda y Barbar Josefa. Rosa tiene 33 aos y se dedica a la venta y elaboracin de comida por lo que todos los das se levanta temprano para buscar los productos en el mercado y tambin realizar los diferentes productos que ofrecer como gallo pinto, tortas de carne, maduros, tajadas, enchiladas y refrescos. Por lo que se siente muy contenta con este medio de vida y por las noches es muy visitada por sus diferentes clientes. En el caso de Barbara se dedica a la venta de ropa, pues con mucho esfuerzo es que ha logrado obtener este medio de ingreso. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para sus diferentes productos que necesitan para su negocio. Juntas tienen los sueos de establecer un restaurante en donde las dos sean las dueas.
texts.en:
The Josefas Solidarity Group consists of Rosa Yolanda and Barbar Josefa. Rosa is 33 years old and earns her living by preparing and selling food. Every day she wakes up early so that she can find the products she needs at the market. She offers different items such as beans and rice, meat pies, fried plantains, plantain chips, enchiladas, and soft drinks. Rosa feels very happy with this way of life and at night she is frequently visited by her different customers.

In Barbaras case, she sells clothing with great effort as her means of income. The loan they are requesting will be used to buy different materials they need for their businesses. They dream of establishing a restaurant where they both are owners.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase ingredients

loan.name: Bacilio

texts.es: El Seor Bacilio nacido el 28 de Febrero de 1966 en Cochabamba casado con la Sra. Filiberta con 7 hijos. Hace 6 aos que el compro una parcela en 2 hectareas en la localidad de San Carlos a 25 Km de Limoncito. En la cual el vive y trabaja desde entonces con su esposa y sus hijos quienes le ayudan en la siembra, cosecha y la comercializacion en el mercado de el Torno. Es primera ves que Esta sacando Credito de Emprender, el dinero lo utilizara para la siembra de Yuca. Tambin l pertenece o es socio de un centro de acopio de Maiz.
texts.en:
Sr. Bacilio was born on February 28, 1966, in Cochabamba. He is married to Sra. Filiberta and they have seven children. Six years ago he bought a parcel of land that measures two hectares in the town of San Carlos, which is 25km away from Limoncito. There he lives and works with his wife and children. The crops that they plant and harvest are sold at the market in El Torno.

This is the first loan he is requesting from Emprender. The money will be used for planting cassava. Bacilio is also a member of the local corn collection center.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Inputs for growing cassava

loan.name: Angelica Victoria

texts.es: Doa Angelica C., es originaria de Sumpango, Sac. municipio que queda a una hora de distanca de la ciudad Capital, tiene 4 hijos. Doa Anelica se dedica a vender perfumes, un negocio que a sido rentable en su vida, ya que ha tenido varios negocios, y no le han funcionado, pero en este si, ya que tiene a personas que le ayudan a vender, por lo tanto ella necesita solicitar un crdito, para poder aumentar la compra de su producto, ella ha trabvjado durante varios aos con FAPE, y durante este tiempo ella ha demostrado su responsabilidad, ella suea con tener un buen suertido de su producto, y asi poder tener mejores ingresos, ya que gracias a este negocio ella ha podido contribuir a que su familia este mejor y salga adelante.
texts.en:
Doa Angelica C. is originally from the town of Sumpango, Sacatepequez, which is located an hour away from the capital of Guatemala. She has four children. Doa Angelica has been selling perfumes, a business that she has found to be quite profitable. She has had several other businesses before, but none of them have ever worked out like this one has.

Angelica has people who help her sell, so she is requesting a loan so that she can buy more products. She has worked with FAPE for several years. During this time, she has demonstrated that she is a responsible person. Her dream is to be well-stocked with her product so that she can earn more income. Through this business, she has been able to provide her family with the best and everything they need to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase more products

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loan.name: Union Y Desarrollo 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group Union y Desarrollo 1 & 2 (Union and Development). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and 4 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to live comfortably in a safe house. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying cooking.
Maria is excited to be taking her 9th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost 5 years, starting with her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying silver jewelry and shoes. She will use the profits to invest in her business, to buy what her children need for school and, in the long term, to build a better house.
This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed to started a business. She talked with some of her friends and maD. up a group to receive a loan from Esperanza. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. The rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffer from unreliable and electricity and running water, none of which is potable.

loan.use: To buy shoes and jewelry for resale

loan.name: Aura Luz

texts.es: Aura Luz tiene 50 aos. Su actividad econmica es el destace de cerdo y elaboracin de nacatamales. Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido generar ms ingresos para su hogar con la ayuda de este negocio. Trabaja desde las 5 de la maana hasta las 8 de la noche todos los das de semana que son los ms solicitados por sus clientes, ya que tambin conocen la ubicacin de su negocio que es su humilde vivienda. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos, ingredientes para la elaboracin de sus nacatamales, hojas, masa y bolsas plsticas.
texts.en:
Aura Luz is 50 years old. She butchers pigs and prepares Nicaraguan tamales to earn a living. With some effort, she was gradually able to generate more income through her business to maintain her household. Aura Luz works from 5am to 8pm every day of the week since her customers are placing more orders. She operates her business from her modest home.

At the moment, Aura Luz is requesting a loan to use as operating capital to buy pigs. She will also purchase ingredients and supplies for making Nicaraguan tamales such as banana leaves, cornmeal, and plastic bags.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase pigs and supplies for making Nicaraguan tamales

loan.name: Kublay Alain

texts.es: El Seor Kublay y su esposa se dedican desde hace tres aos a la elaboracin y venta de sndwich, tienen dos nios la mayor de diez aos y el nio de cinco aos, por las circunstancias de la vida Kublay tuvo que dedicarse a esta actividad pese a que el es ingeniero agrnomo, en pocas de siembra y cosecha de arroz el viaja a la localidad de chapare para realizar estas actividades agrcolas y en esta oportunidad les falto capital razn por la que solicitaron crdito en la institucin, kublay es optimista ya que el dice que pese a haber trabajado en instituciones grandes y ahora vendiendo sndwiches, sabe que las circunstancias cambian y que las cosas van a mejorar.
texts.en:
Sr. Kublay and his wife have been preparing and selling sandwiches for three years. They have two children, ages 10 and 5. Due to the circumstances of life, Kublay had to resort to this business even though he is an agricultural engineer. During the rice planting and harvesting seasons, he travels to the town of Chapare to engage in these farming activities.

At the moment he lacks the capital to continue, so he is requesting a loan from Emprender. Kublay is optimistic and says that despite having worked for larger institutions, he continues to sell sandwiches. He knows that circumstances change and things will get better.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase rice seedlings, provisions, and equipment; pay for labor

loan.name: William Enrique

texts.es:
El seor William Enrique C., tiene la edad de 39 aos vive en Lomas de Guadalupe su esposa es ama de casa y tienen 3 hijos adolecentes que estudian la secundaria, ellos tienen un molino en el cual se dedican a la venta de granos, desde hace mas de 5 aos.
Este es el sustento econmico de la familia, el ao prximo su hijo mayor ir a la universidad y temen no tener los recursos econmicos para poder sobrellevar el gasto en el que se pudiese incurrir, es por esta razn que ellos planean reforzar su negocio y hacer crecer los volmenes de venta para una mejor estabilidad econmica, el crdito lo solicita para la compra de granos bsicos que posteriormente estara ofertando en los mercados capitalinos, ellos son una familia muy unida, y trabajadora que los embates de la economa que afecta a las familias nicaragenses, no es razn suficiente para dejar de ambicionar por un futuro mejor para sus hijos.
texts.en:
William Enrique C. is 39 years old and lives in Lomas de Guadalupe. His wife is a housewife, and they have 3 teenage children who attend secondary school. They have a mill where William has sold grains for more than 5 years. He is the financial provider for the family. Next year, his eldest son will go to college, and they are afraid they will not have the economic resources to bear the expense this could incur. That is why they plan to strengthen their business and make their sales volume increase so they will have greater economic stability. William is requesting the loan to purchase basic grains which he would be offering for sale later in the markets at the capital. They are a very united and hard-working family. They believe the economic blows that are affecting Nicaraguan families are not sufficient reason to stop seeking a better future for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of basic grains to be sold in the capital

loan.name: Try God Group

texts.en:
Tede W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Try God'. She is 50 years old, widowed, and has four children who range from 20 to 27 years old. Tede was only able to attend school through 4th grade due to lack of financial support. She cares for two siblings.
For 6 years, she has been selling dried fish in Banjor Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 5,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more dried fish. She describes herself as a serviceable woman.
Her dream is to improve her business and build a house.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, Agnes is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loan.use: To buy more dried fish

loan.name: Eva Virginia

texts.es: La seora Eva Virginia Snchez tiene 53 aos de edad y es viuda, ella tiene su negocio de venta de productos lcteos y cosmticos en el mercado de San Raymundo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella solicita este crdito porque quiere agrandar su negocio, ya que casi no tiene competencia y ya la gente del pueblo la conoce, por lo que le piden sus productos. Por lo que ella cuenta que necesita el capital para poder tener mejor surtido y poder cumplir con lo que sus clientes le piden. Ella ha demostrado ser una mujer responsable en FAPE y agradece el apoyo que le brinda La seora Eva Virginia Snchez tiene 53 aos de edad y es viuda, ella tiene su negocio de venta de productos lcteos y cosmticos en el mercado de San Raymundo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella solicita este crdito porque quiere agrandar su negocio, ya que casi no tiene competencia y ya la gente del pueblo la conoce, por lo que le piden sus productos. Por lo que ella cuenta que necesita el capital para poder tener mejor surtido y poder cumplir con lo que sus clientes le piden. Ella ha demostrado ser una mujer responsable en FAPE y agradece el apoyo que se le brinda KIVA.
texts.en:
Eva Virginia Snchez is a 53 year old widow. She has a business selling dairy products and cosmetics in the San Raymundo market. She is a very hard-working woman. She is requesting this loan because she wants to expand her business. She has almost no competition. The people in the town know her, and they ask for her products. She says that she needs capital to be able to better stock her business and to fill her customers orders. She has shown herself to be a responsible woman in FAPE, and she is grateful for Kivas support.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Stock her business with more products

loan.name: Franz

texts.es: El Sr. Franz Radica en la localidad de el torno distante a 39 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, tiene 7 hijos de los cuales tres estn con el y los dems ya se casaron y se independizaron, vive en el barrio Miraflores de dicha localidad en casa en alquiler, su ocupacin es herrero, es decir construccin de canaletas para casa, verjas, ventanas, esta actividad es la nica fuente de ingreso, el destino del crdito es para compra materiales como Hierro, clavos, soldador y as poder cubrir sus pedidos, su esposa se dedica a labores del hogar; es cliente nuevo en la institucin y en el sistema financiero y esta muy contento por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Mr. Franz Radica, in El Torno, 39 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz, has seven childred, three of whom still live with him. The other four are married and on their own. He lives in a rented house in the Miraflores neighborhood. [Franz] is a blacksmith; specifically he makes gutters for homes, railings, and windows. This is his only source of income. He will use the money from this loan to buy materials, such as iron, nails, and welding supplies, in order to be able to fulfill his orders. His wife is a homemaker. He is new to our institution and to this system of finance, and he is very grateful for the opportunity given to him.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Materials and supplies

loan.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother of four and all her children go to school. She owns a stall in Kawempe market selling vegetables. She buys these vegetables from the same market where she works and so doesnt incur any transport costs. Besides this vegetable business she also sells Irish potatoes, cassava, sweet potatoes, and yams concurrently. She has done this business for years and works seven days a week. She sells vegetables such as cabbages, carrots, tomatoes, onions, cucumber, etc.
Mary wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of cabbages, onions, tomatoes, and a bag of Irish potatoes. Her main challenge is that selling vegetables is seasonal and she is aspiring of going directly to farmers. Mary decided to join MCDT because of timely loans. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricitybut no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

loan.use: To buy more boxes of cabbges, tomatoes, onions, and Irish potatoes

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Gioconda Del Socorro

texts.es:
La seora Gioconda del Socorro S. L., tiene la edad de 38 aos, habitante del barrio Israel Galeano, con su pareja de vida tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad independientes que subsisten bajo sus propios recursos, su pareja labora como albail apoyndole en los gastos del hogar, habitan en una humilde casa que a futuro esperan poseer el dinero necesario para la remodelacin de la misma, ella se dedica a la venta de cosmticos desde hace ya ms de 5 aos.
Antes laboraba en una zona franca, pero fue gracias a su ahorro y el apoyo de su familia que ella labora para s misma y crea su propia fuente de ingreso, desea invertir un capital ms fuerte para el aumento en las ventas y el beneficio econmico de toda su familia, esta es la razn por la cual solicita un prstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadera cosmetica, que le permita mejores utilidades y la posibilidad a futuro de realizar las remodelaciones a su hogar que tanto aora.
texts.en:
Mrs Giconda del Socorro Sanchez L., age 38, lives in the Israel Galeano neighbourhood with her life partner; they have 4 grown and independent children who live on their own resources. Her partner works as a bricklayer, helping her with household costs. They live in a modest house which they hope to have money to remodel in the future. Giconda has sold cosmetics for more than 5 years already. Before, she worked in a tax-free area, but thanks to her savings and the support of her family she works for herself and has created her own source of income. She wants to invest a greater amount of capital in increasing her sales for the economic benefit of all of her family. This is the reason that she is requesting a loan for the purchase of a larger inventory of cosmetic merchandise, which will be more useful and allow her the possibility of remodeling her home in the future, which she longs to do.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: the purchase of a bigger inventory of cosmetic merchandise

loan.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es: Carlos Jos de 36 aos, vive en el reparto Carlos Nuez el se dedica a la venta de lea, de la manera ms humilde se gana el pan de cada da para mejorar los ingresos de su familia. Por la falta de oportunidades profesionales l comenz a vender en su casa con la ayuda de su esposa, por lo que es su primer crdito y est muy entusiasmado para empezar este negocio. Por lo que trabaja todos los das de 7 de la maana hasta las 7 de la noche, es necesario ya que tiene mantener a su familia. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima y aumentar su inventario. Suea con seguir adelante con su actividad y proporcionar a sus hijos los recursos ms necesarios.
texts.en:
Carlos Jos is 36 years old. He lives in the Carlos Nuez neighborhood and sells firewood. He earns his daily bread in a most humbly way, so that he can improve his familys income. With his wifes help, he began selling out of his home due to a lack of other opportunities. This will be his first loan and he is very excited about starting this business. He works every day from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm. This is necessary because he has to support his family. He will use the money from this loan to buy supplies and to increase his inventory. He dreams of moving ahead with his business and of being able to give his children their most needed resources.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is married to a taxi driver; they have four children and all their children are in school. She owns a stall in Mulago market selling second-hand clothes and she has been in this business for seven years. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of clothes. She buys bales of clothes from Owino market and goes for shopping once a week. Gladys uses public transport to and from shopping.
Besides clothing sales, she also owns a restaurant at her home and has three girls who work in it. She works six days a week. Her business challenge are the rainy season which hinders her customers from getting to her. She is aspiring of building her own house and decided to work with MCDT because she wanted capital. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent, food, and school fees.

loan.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothing

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy more used clothes

loan.name: Mara Biviana

texts.es: Doa Biviana tiene 43 aos de edad esta casada con Don Jos y tienen 6 hijos. Doa Biviana desde hace tiempo tiene una tortilleria, al principio tuvo la tortilleria en su casa y ahora alquila un local y esto lo pudo lograr con la ayuda de KIVA, ahora doa Biviana solicita nuevamente la ayuda de KIVA ya que necesita ampliar su negocio, ella necesita comprar gas, maz para poder seguir adelante con su negocio. Uno de sus sueos es abrir un local ms y asi poder expandir su negocio de tortillas.
texts.en:
Biviana is 43 years old, is married to Jos, and has six children. She has had a tortilla factory for some time. When she started, she ran it out of her home, but now she rents a specific location, which she was able to do with Kivas help. Biviana is once again asking for help from Kiva. She needs to buy gas, and dried corn in order to expand her business and be able to continue moving ahead. Someday she would like to open another location and in this way expand her business more.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Supplies and ingredients

loan.name: Kua Guapa Group

texts.es:
Estelvina M. Rojas: es presidenta del comit de Mujeres kua Guapa de la zona rural de la compaa Caaguy Cup, distrito de Ybycu, departamento de Paraguar.
Este comit se encuentran trabajando desde el ao pasado con un un credito inicial de 300.000mil, actualmente estan en el segundo ciclo del prestamo, inicialmente, empezaron con un grupo de 16 personas de las cuales desertaron 3 y ahora se quedaron con 15 integrantes.
Los miembros del comit trabajan en conjunto haciendo actividades de venta de comida, torneo de futbol, boley para solventar los gastos de pago de cuota, aparte de que los miembros el dinero prestado de la Fundacion Paraguaya utilizan para compra de pollitos, cria de cerdos, ampliacion de almacn y para utilizar en laa actividades agropecuarias para la siembra de los cultivos para el sustento de la familia durante el ao.
Asi la seora Estelvina se dedica a varias actividades en su casa ya que tiene cria de aves y cerdos, y debe trabajar mucho para criarlos para obtener buena ganancia con la venta de los animales. Ella ademas de la cria de animales tambien tiene su huerta con plantaciones de horalizas para el consumo de la familia y vender los excedentes. Solicita el prstamo para invertir en sus actividades como en la compra de pollos, balancelados para cerdos, y otros.
texts.en:
Estelvina M. Rojas is the president of the comit de Mujeres kua Guapa of the Caaguy Cup rural zone, located in the Ybycu district, of the Paraguar department. This group has been active since last year and began with an initial loan of 300,000,000 PYG. They are now in the second cycle of the loan. The group began with 16 people, 3 of whom left, and they currently have 15 members. The committee members work together to organize activities, such as food sales and soccer and volleyball tournaments, to cover the expenses of making their payments. The members also use the money that they borrowed from Fundacion Paraguaya to buy chicks, raise hogs, run a store, and to raise crops to feed their families throughout the year. Estelvina does various things out of her home, since she raises poultry and hogs and she must work hard to raise them in order to produce good earnings from the sale of the animals. She also has an orchard where she raises vegetables for sale and for feeding her family. She is asking for this loan in order to invest in her businesses, such as buying chickens, hog feed, and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Poultry, feed, and supplies

loan.name: Norma Judith

texts.es: Doa Norma hace 13 aos, trabajaba con su ta vendiendo ropa tpica, trabajo con ella durante 7 aos, pero Norma comenzo a pensar en su futuro y penso en tener su propio negocio, ya saba como hacerlo, donde comprar los materiales y la ropa, con sus ahorros ella inicio vendiendo suteres y los ofreci a conocidas y amigas y asi estuvo durante un ao. al pasar el tiempo le hablarn de FAPE y ella comenaz a trabajar solicitando crdito para invertir en mas mercadera y asi hacer su negocio mas grande, al pasar del tiempo ella busco un local para poner su venta, ahora tiene un local propio en su casa, y ella sigue trabajando con FAPE y ahora con KIVA y solicito su crdito para surtir an mas su tienda y asi llegar a ser cada vez mas y mas grande, ya que gracias a su negocio puede ayudar a su esposo con gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Norma worked with her aunt, selling typical clothing, 13 years ago. She worked with her for seven years, but Norma then began thinking about her future and thought about having her own business. Since she already knew this business and knew where to buy materials and clothing, she used her savings and began selling sweaters to her friends and acquaintances. She did this for one year. After some time, someone told her about FAPE and she requested a loan in order to invest in more merchandise and expand her business. After a while she looked for a location where she could sell and now she runs her own store out of her home. She continues to work with FAPE and now with Kiva and requested this loan in order to better stock her store and grow it more and more. Thanks to her business, she is able to help her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Inventory

loan.name: Nicasio Antonio

texts.es: Nicasio Antonio tiene 66 aos, el se dedica a la actividad econmica de una pulpera. Por lo que no es la primera vez que tiene financiamientos por haber comprado los productos. El ofrece la venta de productos bsicos como arroz, azcar, aceite, frijoles, golosinas y pan, ya que su pulpera est ubicada en su vivienda y as ofrecer gran variedad de productos para sus clientes. Solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para comprar los productos necesarios y ofrecer una gran variedad. Siempre suea con mejorar cada da ms su actividad.
texts.en:
Nicasio Antonio is 66 years old, and he owns a small grocery store. This is not the first time he has sought financing to purchase products. He offers for sale basic products like rice, sugar, oil, beans, sweets, and bread. Since his store is located in his home, he can offer a good variety of products to his clients. He seeks this loan to invest in the purchase of the products necessary to offer a good variety. He dreams of improving his business every day.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of food products

loan.name: Paula Francis

texts.es:
La seora Paula Francis, tiene 33 aos de edad vive con su pareja de vida y sus dos hijos adolecentes. Actualmente estudian la estudian la escuela primaria, ella labora como empleada domestica desde hace 3 aos en una casa privada, son una familia muy humilde que habitan en un populoso barrio de la capital conocido por la inseguridad ciudadana que amenaza a las familias que ah residen.
Es por esta razn que ella solicita este prstamo para la compra de materiales de construccin que le permitan asegurar su hogar en la compra de un puerta de madera e instalacin de una verja de hierro, as mismo la mejora de la infraestructura de los cuartos de la casa, trayndole la satisfaccin personal de ofrecerles a sus hijos un hogar ms digno, seguro y comodo donde desarrollar su vida sobre todo que se encuentran en una etapa de sus vidas en donde demandan ms espacio e independencia.
texts.en:
Mrs Paula Francis, age 33, lives with her life partner and their two adolescent children. They currently study in elementary school. She has worked as a domestic employee in a private home for three years. They are a very humble family who live in a crowded neighbourhood of the capital known for the insecurity that threatens the families that live there. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of construction materials which will allow her to secure her home through the purchase of a wooden door and the installation of a wrought-iron gate, as well as the improvement of the infrastructure of the rooms of the home. This will bring her the personal satisfaction of offering her children a more dignified home, secure and comfortable, where they can develop their lives. Above all, they are now at a stage of their lives where they need more space and independence.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: the purchase of construction materials to secure her home

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy more used clothing to sell

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Purchase of men's, women's, and children's clothes (e.g., jeans, blouses, sheets, and hair products)

loan.name: Eseri

texts.en:
Eseri is married with four children and all of them are at school. She also takes care of additional family members. She owns a store selling charcoal and bananas in Nabulagala in Lubaga Division. She has been in this business for four years. She plans to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas and bags of charcoal. She sells to all categories of people in the area, both retail and wholesale.
Eseri works seven days a week. She depends on this job for a living. She buys bunches of bananas and bags of charcoal from Kiboga, one of the districts in the central region. Eseri uses public transport to and from Kiboga and goes shopping once a week. Her business challenges include transportation and the rainy season because when it rains the roads become impassable. She is aspiring of educating her children up to university.
Eseri joined MCDT to acquire additional capital. She resides in and owns a house which has no electricity or piped water. Among her monthly expenses are school fees and medication.

loan.use: To buy more bunches of banana and bags of charcoal

loan.name: Mujeres Solidarias 2 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Milagros is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres SolidA. 2 & 4 (Solidarity Women). She makes her home in a simple structure with her longterm partner and one child. She says that her most difficult challenge is to add some services to her house, like running water. In the meantime she plans to continue to enjoy sharing with more people like her neighbors and family.
Milagros is excited to be taking her 7th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over three years, starting with her first loan.
Milagros plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying cosmetics and personal and household products from catalog sales. She will use the profits to buy a refrigerator and a motorcycle to move faster and carry her products easily. She want to have a successful business and be a professional.
This associate began with Esperanza because she wanted to have a better life with more opportunities. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).
The rural area surrounding Hato Mayor is an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loan.use: To buy more cosmetics and personal and household products to sell

loan.name: Glenda Maritza

texts.es: Glenda es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 21 aos de edad, trabaja todos los das atendiendo su negocio de comida en el mercado municipal, junto a su mam trabajan y asi poder sacarle el mayor provecho al negocio. Glenda tambin trabaja dando clases de computacin en un colegio. Necesita el crdito para comprar una estufa industrial y una churrasquera ya que la que tenian se dao. El sueo de Glenda es expandir el negocio y abrir otro local de venta de comida
texts.en:
Glenda is a hard-working woman. She is 21 years old and works every day tending to her food stand in the municipal market. She works alongside her mother in order to make the most out of the business. Glenda also works giving computation classes at a school. She needs the loan to purchase a an industrial stove and a barbecue grill since the ones she had were damaged. Glenda's dream is to expand her business and open another food stand.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase an industrial stove and a barbecue grill

loan.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
La seora Ana Julia Z. F., tiene la edad de 51 aos vive en el Barrio Laureles Sur es casada y su esposo es fiscal de proyectos de una casa en construccin, siendo sus ingresos parte esencial de la economa del hogar, tienen 2 hijos adolecentes, el cual uno de ellos trabaja y apoya a sus padres y el otro estudia su carrera universitaria. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace mas de 20 aos y refiere que le va muy bien y que su mercadera tiene buena aceptacin entre sus clientas, desde muy joven la seora se dedico al comercio, siendo sus padres quienes la ayudaron en sus inicios en el negocio.
Ellos habitan en una casa humilde que por ahora no posee el dinero para realizar una remodelacin al porche de su hogar, es por esta razn que solicita de un prstamo para la compra de materiales de construccin tales como cermica, cemento, caliche, que le permitan llevar a cabo este proyecto que les traer mejores comodidades, seguridad y un buen desarrollo socio econmico para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Julia Z. F. is 51 years old. She lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. She is married and her husband is a project manager at a construction company and his income is an essential part of the family finances. They have 2 teenage children. One of them works and supports his parents and the other one is studying at the university. She has sold shoes for more than 20 years and she remarks that it has gone very well for her. Her merchandise is well accepted by her customers. She has been a saleswoman since she was very young and her parents helped her get started in the business. They live in a humble home. At this time, they don't have the money to remodel the porch on the house and that is why she is asking for this loan to purchase contruction materials such as ceramic tile, cement, and caliche, which will allow them to finish this project and bring more comfort, safety and good social economic development for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To remodel the porch on their home

loan.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: D. Emilienne est ne le 19 Mars 1972 et est marie GBETINDE Sbastien, un matelassier. Le couple a quatre enfants leur charge, dont trois sont leurs propres enfants. Il y a quatre ans que la famille s'est installe au quartier Yagb Cotonou, capitale conomique du Bnin. Emilienne et son mari assurent ensemble les diffrentes charges de la maison. Pour y parvenir, Emilienne prpare et vend de la nourriture (pte de mas) Cotonou. Emilienne achte ses produits Dantokpa, march international du Bnin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALID, ayant obtenu six prts qui ont tous t bien rembourss. Dans le but de renforcer son activit et de mieux faire face la demande de jour en jour nombreuse de sa clientle, Emilienne sollicite un autre crdit.
texts.en:
Emilienne D. was born on the 19th March 1972 and is married to Sebastien Gbetinde, a quilter. The couple have four children in their care, of which 3 are their own children. It's been four years since the family settled in the Yabe district of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. Emilienne and her husband together cover all the household expenses. To achieve this, Emilienne prepares and sells food (corn paste) in Cotonou. Emilienne buys her products in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She is a longterm client of ALIDe, having taken out 6 loans, all of which have been diligently repaid. In order to strengthen her business, and to better face the growing demands of her clientele, Emilienne is requesting another loan.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Achat de sacs de mas et des condiments de sauce.

loan.name: Mara Eugenia Group

texts.es: R.ParaR. R.esteR. R.comiteR. R.seR. R.reunieronR. R.unasR. R.mujeresR. R.conR. R.elR. R.finR. R.deR. R.capitalizarR. R.suR. R.actividadR. R.yR. R.otrasR. R.paraR. R.emprenderR. R.actividadesR. R.productivasR., R.deR. R.ahR. R.queR. R.coordinaronR. R.laR. R.reuniR.R.nR. R.paraR. R.interiorizarseR. R.sobreR. R.elR. R.programaR., R.lesR. R.resultR. R.muyR. R.fructR.R.ferasR. R.eR. R.interesantesR. R.porR. R.losR. R.beneficiosR. R.queR. R.obtendrR.R.anR. R.conR. R.elR. R.programaR. R.yR. R.asiR. R.conformaronR. R.suR. R.grupoR.. R.ElR. R.comitR. R.llevaR. R.porR. R.nombreR. R.MarR.R.aR. R.EugeniaR., R.enR. R.hornoR. R.alR. R.nombreR. R.delR. R.barrioR., R.actualmenteR. R.seR. R.encuentranR. R.enR. R.elR. R.cuartoR. R.cicloR. R.conR. R.calificaciR.R.nR. loan.use: Purchase of hosiery, hats, sweatsuits, windbreakers.

loan.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with three children and all of them are at school. She also takes care of additional family members. She owns a stall in Kasubi market selling second-hand clothes. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She buys bales of clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda and uses public transport to and from shopping. She has been in this business for ten years. She has no additional income.
Sarah sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale. She works six days a week and depends on this job for a living. Her business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring of building her own house. Sarah Joined MCDT to boost her business by getting additional capital. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house and the family has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loan.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loan.name: Jeaneth Concepcin

texts.es:
La seora Jeaneth Concepcin D. R., tiene la edad de 45 aos habita en el barrio de Laureles Sur, es casada y su esposo labora como guarda de seguridad, tienen 2 hijos mayores de edad que trabajan y habitan de manera independiente, ella tiene un cafetn en un colegio de la capital, desde hace mas de 7 aos, el cual es considerado econmicamente estable.
Ellos habitan en una morada humilde que por los embates de las tormentas, se les han deteriorado los cuartos es por esta razn que solicita un prstamo para la compra de materiales de construccin que les favorezcan a mejores condiciones salubres por el moho que se estaba desarrollando, as mismo comodidades para morar en un ambiente digno, y merecido por ser una familia, trabajadora que no permite que la crisis por la que atraviesa el pas, robe sus aoranzas hacia un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Mrs Jeaneth Concepcin D. R., age 45, lives in the Laureles Sur neighbourhood. She is married and her husband works as a security guard. They have 2 grown children who work and live independently. She has had a snack stand in a school in the capital for over 7 years, and it is considered to be economically stable. They live in a humble dwelling whose rooms have deteriorated from winds and storms. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of construction materials which will be conducive to better living conditions, safe from the mold that was developing, and for amenities to live in the dignified environment her family deserves. She is a hard-worker who has not allowed the crisis that has crossed the country to steal her dreams of a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: remodeling of rooms of her home

loan.name: Awaou

texts.fr: Ne en 1960, A. Awaou est marie AMOUSSOU Damas, un transitaire. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolariss, dont trois sont leur charge. Awaou s'est installe depuis dix huit ans environs au quartier Snad Cotonou, capitale conomique du Bnin, o elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Awaou apporte une aide financire son mari dans les diffrentes charges de la famille. Awaou n'a pas frquent l'cole. Pour faire face ses charges, Awaou vend du charbon de bois et des fagots de bois son domicile. De faon secondaire, Awaou vend du mas. Awaou s'approvisionne Ikpinl, un march de vente de produits vivriers au Bnin. Awaou exerce cette activit depuis une dizaine d'anne et a dj bnfici de quatre crdits auprs de ALID, crdits qu'elle a tous bien rembourss. Awaou dsire augmenter son fonds de roulement et lever davantage le niveau de son activit. C'est ce qui l'amne solliciter un autre crdit.
texts.en:
Born in 1960, Awaou A. is married to Damas Amoussou, a forwarding agent. The couple has four children, all attending (or having attended) school, and of whom three are under their care. Awaou settled some 18 years ago in the Snad borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, where she lives with her husband and children. She gives her husband financial assistance regarding the various family expenses. Awaou has not attended school. To meet her needs, she sells charcoal and bundles of firewood from her home. As a side business, she also sells corn. She gets her supplies from Ikpinl, a farmers market in Benin. Awaou has been running this business for the past ten years and has already been granted four loans from ALID, all repaid in full. She wishes to increase her working capital and her level of activity, which is why she is now requesting another loan.

Translated from French by Ren McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy charcoal and corn

loan.name: Lydie Olouwafmi

texts.fr: Z. Lydie Olouwafmi est ne le 13 Juillet 1977 et est marie OGAH Adrien, un mcanicien. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolariss. Lydie habite le quartier Midombo Cotonou, avec ses enfants. Le couple se partage les diffrentes charges de la famille. Lydie a arrt l'cole au cours secondaire. Depuis une douzaine d'anne, Lydie vend divers produits (ptes alimentaires, conserves, sucre, lait, savons, allumettes, etc.) et aussi des produits de merceries au march de Midombo. Lydie s'approvisionne Dantokpa, march international du Bnin. C'est la deuxime fois que Lydie sollicite auprs de ALID, un crdit en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activit et d'accrotre sa clientle. Lydie a bien rembours le premier crdit.
texts.en:
Lydie Olouwafmi Z. was born 13 July 1977 and is married to Adrien Ogah, a mechanic. The couple has two children, both attending (or having attended) school. Lydie lives with her children in the Midombo borough of Cotonou. The couple shares the handling of family expenses. Lydie interrupted her schooling at secondary level. For the past 12 years, she has been selling various items (pasta, canned goods, sugar, milk, soap, matches, etc.) and also haberdashery products at the Midombo market. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benins international marketplace. This is Lydies second loan request with ALID, the purpose of which is to increase her level of activity and also her customer base. She fully reimbursed the first loan.

Translated from French by Ren McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy haberdashery products and various items (pasta, sugar, canned goods, milk, etc.)

loan.name: Rose Mary

texts.en:
Rose Mary is married to a builder; they have five children and all of them are at school. Currently she doesnt take care of additional family members. Rose Mary changed her business enterprise from a food business to a retail shop. She buys her merchandise from Kikuubo in Kampala city and uses public transport to and from shopping She plans to use the loan to buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap. She has a retail shop as an additional income.
Rose Mary sells to all categories of people around the area. She works seven days a week and her business challenges include seasonality, transportation, and thieves. She depends on this job for a living. She resides in and owns a house which has electricity but no piped water. She is aspiring of educating her children up to university and joined MCDT because she wanted additional capital. Her greatest monthly expenses are for food and school fees.

loan.use: To buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa A. O. es una seora de 54 aos que vive con su esposo y 3 hijos en una pequea comunidad en Guanacaste llamado la Garita. La garita es una planicie de clima bastante clido donde se desarrollan actividades tales como la ganadera, Agricultura y el turismo, entre otros.
Con el deseo de mejorar su condicin de vida y la de su familia Doa Rosa busc alternativas diferentes y desde hace poco ms de un ao inici un negocio, exactamente un bazar-librera en su casa, en el cual ofrece: diferentes tipos de papel, artculos para oficina como lapiceros, lpices, cuadernos, goma, adems de servicio de fotocopiado entre otras muchas ms cosas. Dice que le ha ido muy bien ya que en su comunidad ha tenido mucha aceptacin puesto que antes no haba un lugar que brindara ese servicio.
En estos momentos lo que desea doa Rosa es solicitar un prstamo por 500,000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar mercadera para mejorar su inventario. Con esto espera que su microempresa crezca y llegue a generar ms ingresos para mejorar su condicin de vida.
Doa Rosa es socia de la Empresa de Crdito Comunal La Garita una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este ser su segundo crdito, y espera poder seguir participando de manera ms activa con este tipo de organizaciones.
texts.en:
Rosa is 54 and lives with her husband and 3 children in a small community in Guanacaste called La Garita. It is located on a plain with a very warm climate where activities such as cattle-raising, agriculture, and tourism, among others, occur. With the desire of improving her condition of life and that of her family, Rosa sought different alternatives and just a little over 1 year ago, she launched a business. Precisely, a book store and shop in her house, offering different types of paper and office supplies such as pencils and pencil cases, notebooks, glue, plus photocopying services, among many other things. The business has been well received in her community, since previously no local store offered these things. At present, what Rosa wants is to solicit a loan for 500,000 colons to buy merchandise and improve her inventory. With this she hopes that her micro-enterprise will grow and begin to generate more income and improve her condition of life. Rosa is a member of the Empresa de Crdito Comunal La Garita, one of EDESA's 100 member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be Rosa's 2nd loan and she hopes to participate even more actively in these types of organizations in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE FOR HER BOOK AND OFFICE SUPPLY STORE

loan.name: Marie

texts.fr: D. D. Marie est ne en 1960 et vit depuis une vingtaine d'anne au quartier Snad Cotonou, capitale conomique du Bnin. Marie est une veuve et mre de quatre enfants dont deux sont sa charge. Seulement certains enfants sont scolariss. Marie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs diffrentes charges. Depuis une quinzaine d'anne, Marie vend de l'"akassa" (aliment local fait base d'amidon de mas) son domicile, ce qui lui permet de subvenir ses diffrents besoins. Marie achte ses produits Dantokpa, march international du Bnin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALID, qui a dj obtenu cinq crdits et qui ont t tous bien rembourss. Marie souhaite augmenter le volume de son activit et se faire encore plus de revenu pour mieux satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants ; raison pour laquelle Marie sollicite un autre prt.
texts.en:
Marie D. D. was born in 1960 and has been living for the past 20 years in the Snad borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Marie is a widow and the mother of four children, of whom two are under her care. Only some of the children attend school. Marie lives with her children and is their sole provider. For 15 years Marie has sold akassa (a local foodstuff based on cornstarch) from her home, which enables her to meet her different needs. She gets her products from Dantokpa, Benins international marketplace. Marie is a regular ALID client, and has already been granted five loans, all of which were reimbursed in full. She wants to increase her turnover and generate more revenue to satisfy her childrens needs, which is why she is requesting another loan.

Translated from French by Ren McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy corn and bundles of firewood

loan.name: Mujeres Inversionistas Group

texts.es:
GRUPO SOLIDARIO MUJERES INVERSIONISTAS
El grupo est integrado por 3 personas las represntate del grupo es Doa Teresa P. ella tiene 10 en su negocio se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo y ropa tpica tiene 7 hijos mayores de edad y 1 menor su negocio se encuentra ubicada en su casa y tambin sale a ofrecer sus productos de en otros pueblos, su esposo falleci hace 1 ella a salido a delante con la ayuda de sus hijos y su negocio su mayor deseo para su hijo pequeo es que estudie y salga adelante y tambin desea tener mas mercadera variadas para sus clientes. Doa Candelaria P. tiene una tortillera, tiene 3 hijos uno de ellos es mayor de edad su deseo para su hija es que estudie y tenga una carrera, y prosperar ms en su negocio, Doa Lucia P. su negocio es venta de productos por catlogo y por las maanas vende jugos en su casa, su mayor deseo es tener un pequeo local en su casa para que sus clientes lleguen y puedan ver sus productos
texts.en:
Mutual Group of Investing Women. The group is made up of three persons. The group representative is Doa Teresa P.. She has been in business for 10 years and sells products through catalogs and typical clothing. She has 7 grown children and one that is still young. Her business is located in her home and she also goes to other towns to sell her products. Her husband passed away 1 1/2 years ago. She has gotten ahead with the help of her children and her business. Her wish for her young son is that he studies and gets ahead. She wants to have a variety of merchandise for her customers. Doa Candelaria P. makes tortillas. She has three children, one of them grown. She wishes that her daughter will finish her studies and have a career and that she will prosper in her business. Doa Lucia P. sell products through a catalog and sell juices in the mornings from her house. Her main wish is to have a small shop in her house so that her customers could come and see her products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Invest in their business.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
El seor J. A. Guzman Canda, tiene 44 aos de edad vive en el Municipio de Monimbo, es casado y su esposa con sus ingresos le apoya en los gastos del hogar, tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad, independientes y que le ayudan as mismo al gasto en el que se incurre mensualmente, ellos tienen su propio negocio desde hace 21 aos el cual es una discomvil.
El solicita un prstamo para la compra de un nuevo parlante que le permitir una oferta mejor a su clientes debido a que ahora las fiestas se realizan en lugares de mayor amplitud situacin que dificultaba sus ordenes de trabajo, por ahora asegura que le ir mejor por a demanda alta que se viene de fiestas para estos meses, esto le favorecer a mejorar sus condiciones econmicas y la posibilidad de incursionar en nuevas fuentes de ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr J. A. Guzman Canda, age 44, lives in the municipality of Monimbo. He is married and his wife helps with the household costs with her income. They have 4 grown children who are independent and cover their own monthly expenses. J. and his wife have had their own business for 21 years, which is a mobile disco. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of a new loudspeaker which will allow him to provide a better offering to his customers since currently their parties are conducted in areas with good amplitude; this situation makes it difficult to work. He is sure that it will go well because of the high demand for parties in these months. This will help him to improve his economic conditions and provide the possibility of exploring new sources of income.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: the purchase of a loudspeaker for his business

loan.name: Rosa Maria's Group

texts.es: Las seoras que participan en este grupo soy mujeres emprendedoras ya que cada uno tuvo la creatividad de iniciar su propio negocio; se dedican a la venta de medicina lo cual le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a la familia, una de ellas tiene una venta de juguetes y venta de ropa usada, en lo cual le va muy bien y tambin una de ellas se dedica a la pintura, pinta paisajes y esto le ha ayudado a salir adelante y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. el deseo de las tres es sobre salir y ser mujeres de exito
texts.en:
The women in this group are very enterprising women since each one has the creativity needed to start her own business. One of them make a living selling medicines, which has helped her make headway for her families. One of the women sells toys and used clothing, which has gone very well. Another makes a living in art, painting landscapes, and this has helped her and her husband cover household expenses. All three wish to keep making headway and become successful women.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Invest in their businesses

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Fuerza Divina 1 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Maribel is the coordinator of her group, Fuerza Divina 1 & 7 (Divine Force). She makes her home in a simple structure with her longterm partner and a son. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have a better life. In the meantime she plans to continue to enjoy being with her little son.
Maribel is excited to be taking her 5th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for two-and-a-half years. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying household products. She will use the profits to buy school supplies and she is dreaming of building her house.
This associate began with Esperanza because she wanted to have a better life with more opportunities. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).
The rural area surrounding Hato Mayor is an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loan.use: To buy household products to sell

loan.name: El Eden 5 Group

texts.en:
Elvira is the coordinator of her group, El Eden 5 (The Eden). She makes her home in a simple structure with her three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to raise her children by herself. In the meantime she plans to continue to enjoy being at home with her children.
Elviras business is a colmado, a place where you can find all the ingredients to make your daily meal. Normally these colmados are in the same neighborhood, to be a short walking distance from any home.
Elvira is excited to be taking her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for four years, starting with some savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying more rice, flour, and other foods.
This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed to invest in her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).
The rural area surrounding Hato Mayor is an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loan.use: To buy more rice, beans, sugar, oil, flour, etc.

loan.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa de 54 aos, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), ella tiene una tienda de vivieres, para poder solventar sus gastos.
Ella tiene la tienda de viveres para ayudar con los gastos familiares, comenz comprando arroz, verduras y lcteos. Desde ese tiempo ella a continuado trabajando para asegurar su vejez porque ya sus hijos son mayores de edad. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los das.
Con el prstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceite y carnes para su tienda, en el futuro quiere surtir mas su negocio y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 54 years old and lives in Perimetral de Guayaquil, a suburban area bordered by a salt-water stream. She has a grocery store in order to cover family expenses. She started out purchasing rice, vegetables and dairy products, and since that time she has continued working to ease her into old age because her children are now adults. She works from 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day. With the loan she plans to purchase rice, oil and meats for her store. In the future she wants to better stock her store and make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase rice, oils and meats

loan.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group
